finding: The rs722988 SNP in the NRP1 locus was strongly associated with type 1 diabetes risk, particularly in African and admixed ancestry populations, with an odds ratio of 1.61 and strong p-value evidencing its association.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs2018705 SNP in the RNLS locus was found to have an effect on age at onset of type 1 diabetes, with an odds ratio of 1.18, indicating that it may also influence the disease progression.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs2070303 SNP located in intron 9 of NRP1 was associated with an increased frequency in individuals with an earlier onset of type 1 diabetes, particularly those diagnosed before the age of 4.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: This deleterious variant mapping at CTBP2 suggested involvement in cochlear synaptopathy, potentially linking it to acquired sensorineural hearing loss.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: Significant for CRF-vo2max, this SNP showed no evidence of heterogeneity and was indirectly associated through linkage with another SNP.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The rs11187838 variant in the 10q23.33 region was associated with migraine and influenced multiple functional networks, particularly the auditory and cingulo-opercular networks in resting fMRI, showcasing its potential as a biomarker for headache disorders.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs2629540 variant in 10q26.13 associated with cognitive traits like math ability, education, and cocaine dependence, was particularly involved with the precuneus and indicated genetic overlap with cognitive function.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: In the GWAS of European ancestry, rs10828248 was identified as a significant locus on chromosome 10 with a P-value of 3.17 × 10−08. This SNP was linked to a chronic dizziness phenotype and was further studied within fine-mapping analysis as it had a high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs12779865 (R² = 0.87). This locus had associations with vestibulocochlear disorders and was noted for its potential impact on vestibular function.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: Lead SNP rs12779865 on chromosome 10 was confirmed in trans-ancestry analysis, and associated with chronic dizziness at a P-value < 5 × 10−08. This SNP had a strong linkage with rs10828248 (R² = 0.87) indicating a potential role in the genetic architecture of dizziness.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The SNP rs10905649 was established as a causal SNP, possessing an effect size of 0.02 in the analysis of the simulated phenotypes.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The SNP rs201581170 in the 10q24.33 region showed a significant association with multiple cancers (OR=1.16, P=3.1×10^-12) and invasive cancers (OR=1.17, P=2.4×10^-10), suggesting its relevance in the genetic predisposition to cancer.
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The SNP rs9419958 in the 10q24.33 region showed an association with multiple invasive cancers (OR=1.16, P=1.7×10^-11), indicating its risk contribution, particularly in the context of high linkage disequilibrium with rs201581170.
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The sentinel variant rs2297038 was identified as having a single putative causal variant associated with smoking cessation effectiveness in relation to varenicline treatment.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: This variant in the HABP2 gene was found to reduce protein activity and was associated with carotid stenosis and venous thromboembolism.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: This SNP was linked to the expression of several genes in various tissues and demonstrated significant colocalization with cTnI concentration signals.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The SNP rs61839660 in IL2RA demonstrated significant associations with asthma in the liability method, contrasting with the binary approach where it was not identified. This finding supported previously reported associations in asthma genetics.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs7908662 showed linkage (R²=0.24) with a 446 bp deletion extending into exon 2 of ARMS2, indicating a potential risk factor for AD.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The SNP rs773892439 was in complete LD (R²=1) with a 12.7 Kb deletion in the ADD3 gene, which was exclusively found in AD cases, supporting its connection to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The rs6586028_T allele (TSPAN14) was found to be associated with decreasing levels of CSF Aβ over time specifically in the PD group, but not in the ADNI-Dementia and HC groups, indicating disease-context dependent effects.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: The SNP rs11101440 was found to be related to chromatin interactions and targeted candidate genes at endometrial cancer risk loci, suggesting its potential role in the underlying biology of endometrial cancer as per the research conducted by O'Mara et al. in 2019.
title: Multi-tissue transcriptome-wide association study identifies genetic mechanisms underlying endometrial cancer susceptibility

finding: The intronic variant rs12571421 in the CYP2C19 gene on chromosome 10 was associated with a higher risk of HTPR, indicated by an odds ratio of 2.06 (95% CI: 1.54 to 2.74, p=8.37·10^-7) in a meta-analysis of LAI adjusted GWAS results. This SNP was also in high linkage disequilibrium with the CYP2C19*2 variant.
title: Discovery of Ancestry-specific Variants Associated with Clopidogrel Response among Caribbean Hispanics

finding: SNP rs11187838 exhibited evidence of colocalization with BMD and IA, revealing important implications for understanding genetic correlations between these conditions.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs1126545 was significantly linked to ANC with a beta coefficient of 0.33 (p=0.039). This association suggested that each minor allele correlated with an increase in ANC of approximately 330 cells/mm3, further illustrating the complexities of clozapine metabolism and its effects on neutrophil counts.
title: Clozapine metabolism is associated with Absolute Neutrophil Count in individuals with treatment-resistant schizophrenia

finding: With a significant association (P = 8.2 x 10^-118), rs10886902 associated with 10q26.12 was identified as a key variant in KLK3 impacting PSA levels as part of the larger initiative to quantify genetic contributions to PSA variation.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs10993994 in MSMB at 10q11.23 was significantly associated with PSA levels (P = 7.3 x 10^-87), thus contributing to the insights established through the genotyping of known cancer-related genes.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Associating with FGFR2 in 12, the variant rs10749415 was significant in understanding genetic influences on PSA values.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs9325569 variant at 16q23.1 was significant concerning PSA levels, further adding to the repertoire of genetic determinants affecting this biomarker.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs5030937 was associated with BFP in females, adding to the understanding of genetic influences on adiposity.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12777332, located near the genes CASP7 and NRAP, replicated the association for the risk of cataract in women only, marking a positive finding consistent with previous research.
title: DeepPheWAS: an R package for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: In the analysis, rs11191560 was highlighted as a reported BMI variant associated with the gene NT5C2. This SNP was part of the 115 variants corresponding to significant SNP-transcript-BMI associations for NT5C2 and was linked to lower visceral and subcutaneous fat, as well as obesity.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs11191548 was studied for its effects on miRNA binding efficiency in relation to NT5C2, indicating a significant role in influencing BMI through its variation.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs11314421, mapped to the gene WBP1L, showed a significant interaction with STST for PP in female-specific analysis, with a P-value of 7.8×10^-6. This represents a distinct finding contributing to our understanding of hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: rs111392401, which corresponds to JMJD1C, was tied to LTST interactions for DBP in Hispanic populations, displaying a P-value of 1.3×10^-8, illustrating its significance in hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs2636809 found in SLIT1 also correlated with ASD, stipulating a role in guidance mechanisms for neurodevelopment as per the ASD-SVs noted in the study.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: Locus #18's lead variant, rs10764446, was situated in the intron 2 of the KIAA1217 gene. This variant was found to be in moderate LD with another intronic variant rs11013833, which had been associated with an increased risk of breast-colorectal cancer (OR=1.37, P=6×10⁻⁶). This connection highlighted the potential for rs10764446 in contributing to breast cancer risk through its linkage to KIAA1217.
title: Genome-wide Analysis of Rare Haplotypes Associated with Breast Cancer Risk: Discovery, Replication, and Generalizability Evaluation

finding: linked to Locus #18, the variant rs11013833 was in moderate linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant rs10764446. Previous associations indicated that this variant increased the risk for breast-colorectal cancer, reinforcing its potential relevance in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide Analysis of Rare Haplotypes Associated with Breast Cancer Risk: Discovery, Replication, and Generalizability Evaluation

finding: This SNP was among the shared loci linking hypothyroidism and TSH levels, indicating common genetic influences.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP was among the newly identified loci that showed associations with reproductive health traits, thus linking thyroid function with reproductive outcomes.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP chr10:43119548:G:A was one of the three pathogenic variants identified in the RET gene, associated with multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2 (MEN2). It was noted that this variant, along with two others, accounted for 73 MEN2 cases and represented 65% of all MEN2 cases in the AoU dataset.
title: Prevalence of the major thyroid cancer-associated syndromes in the United States

finding: Variant rs12573077 met a Bonferroni significance level for association with urinary symptoms in the GERA cohort.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The rs7903146 variant in TCF7L2 was significant, being the strongest known locus for type 2 diabetes, implicating it in CAD risk.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: TCF7L2 SNP (rs7903146) was associated with T2D in males, further illustrating the disparity between sexes in genetic predisposition to T2D.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2499908, mapped to the gene USP6NL, was replicated in both the fibromyalgia cohort and the Pain Questionnaire cohort, reinforcing its association with fibromyalgia cases.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The BAG3 missense variant rs2234962 was associated with higher risk for HFrEF (OR 1.12, p-value 9.02×10^-18) and inversely associated with lower risk for HFpEF (OR 0.97, p-value 6.42×10^-3), demonstrating differential effects on these heart failure types.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The SNP rs150952246 at chromosome 10q22.2 was reported as a novel finding with a p-value of 3.14E-07 linked to orofacial clefts, showing significant association in the overall sample analyzed.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Non-syndromic Orofacial Clefts in a Multiethnic Sample of Families and Controls Identifies Novel Regions

finding: The SNP rs118107597 at chromosome 10q24.32 was established as a novel association with a p-value of 8.21E-07 relating to the risk of developing cleft lip with or without cleft palate.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Non-syndromic Orofacial Clefts in a Multiethnic Sample of Families and Controls Identifies Novel Regions

finding: The variant rs4986893 in CYP2C19 was implicated in reduced clopidogrel metabolism and was observed to be 50 times more prevalent in the Singaporean Chinese population than in Europeans, indicating a significant population variation.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: CYP2C9 variant rs1799853 was involved in drug metabolism studies, validating the performance of Nala PGx Core as it demonstrated alignment with benchmark data.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The rs1057910 variant in CYP2C9 was genotyped against the Agena VeriDose Core, maintaining a 100% concordance in the analysis, affirming its relevance in pharmacogenomic applications.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The CYP2C19 variant rs12248560 was validated against a benchmark, supporting the reliability of genotyping from the Nala PGx Core with observed congruence.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The rs4244285 variant in CYP2C19 showed discrepancies in certain analyses but nonetheless remained a significant player in pharmacogenomic considerations based on previous data.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: This SNP was identified as being associated with alanine levels, specifically in the South Asian (SA) population. It was part of a set of four SNPs located on chromosome 10 within the receptor gene SORCS1, which had not been previously associated with alanine.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: Similar to rs12256633, this SNP was also found associated with alanine levels in the South Asian population, being part of the identified set of four SNPs on the SORCS1 gene.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: This SNP was associated with alanine levels in the South Asian population, contributing to the findings related to the receptor gene SORCS1 along with the other reported SNPs.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: As part of the same group of four SNPs associated with alanine levels in SAs, this SNP contributed to the identification of receptor gene SORCS1's involvement with metabolic indicators.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: The missense variant rs1133400 in <italic>INPP5A</italic> was highlighted as a plausible causal variant for migraine with a PIP of 0.93. It was noted to be in modest LD (r2 = 0.36) with the lead variant rs200314499, which had been excluded from fine-mapping due to quality control.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: The mutation rs190780914 was associated with distinct rates of change in the UPDRSII scores, suggesting its role in PD progression. Specifically, the gene MARK2P15, mapped to this SNP, acts as a pseudogene for MARK2, which is implicated in mitochondrial health through its interaction with PINK1. Such mitochondrial dysfunction linked to rs190780914 was posited to contribute to the degeneration of dopaminergic neurons, manifesting in motor symptoms of PD.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: The SNP rs11191116 on chromosome 10 was significantly associated with all four epilepsy phenotypes, showing the strongest association overall. It reached genome-wide significance with a conjFDR of 9.14 x 10^-9 for both cognitive ability (COG) and genetic generalized epilepsy (GGE), indicating a relationship where a higher risk of epilepsy was linked to lower cognitive performance. The gene implicated at this locus was KCNIP2, which plays a role in regulating neuronal excitability, thus linking this SNP to both epilepsy risk and cognitive outcomes.
title: Unraveling the shared genetics of common epilepsies and general cognitive ability

finding: This SNP showed significant association with childhood ALL, located in the intronic region of TET1, at P=3.92 X 10-8 with an odds ratio of 1.15. Its association was primarily driven by Latino (LAT) participants.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: This SNP was also associated with childhood ALL with P=7.27 X 10-8 and an odds ratio of 1.20, situated within a broader association peak that included NRBF2 and JMJD1C, and was primarily driven by LAT.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: This variant was associated with any TP53 mutation phenotype in the discovery (OR 1.54, P value 3.3×10^-5) and in the multi-ancestry validation study (OR 1.4, P value 0.03), although no significance was observed in the MyBrCa study.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The rs12253181 variant, an eQTL for RTKN2, was identified in association with head and neck cancer, highlighting its potential oncogenic role in different cancer types.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The SNP rs75042057 was recorded as having a strong association with impulsivity, with a p-value of 3.6 x 10^-8. It was located in the intron of the PARD3 gene, showing a PVE of 9.3%. Previous linkage studies indicated association with idiopathic generalized epilepsy, which relates to JME as a subtype.
title: SLCO5A1 and synaptic assembly genes contribute to impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy

finding: The variant rs1800450 (B allele) was found to be significantly associated with increased protection against leprosy, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.375, indicating a decreased risk of disease. This finding remained significant even when the results were combined with the C allele (rs1800451), which suggested that genotypes associated with low and intermediate MBL levels were notably more frequent in leprosy patients. Furthermore, the B allele also correlated with protection against the multibacillary form of leprosy (OR = 0.348).
title: Low-MBL producing genotypes playing a role on protection to leprosy and its multibacillary forms in a highly endemic area for leprosy in Brazil

finding: Associated with BAG3, this lead variant showed significant correlation with lower left ventricular ejection fraction; its association with HF mortality was strongly established.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs7098485 was nominally associated with PTB and linked to the AKR1C3 gene. It was thought to influence PTB risk via its role in steroid hormone metabolism, particularly affecting the biochemical availability of prostaglandins, which are critical in labor processes.
title: Genetic association study of Preterm birth and Gestational age in a population-based case-control study in Peru

finding: SNP rs10828247 was also part of the MLLT10 locus showing significant overlaps (11 biofeatures) with functional annotations suggesting its importance in the context of endometriosis risk and potential links to ovarian cancer susceptibility.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs10822145 was included in the analysis and, alongside the other SNPs, underpinned the causal evidence that zinc supplementation improved glycemic control metrics in patients with type-2 diabetes.
title: Triangulating evidence for the causal impact of single-dose zinc supplement on glycemic control for type-2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs11598956 on chromosome 10 was shown to be associated with ectopic pregnancy with a significance of p=2.41×10−8. It was located between the ASB13 and TASOR2 genes, and an investigated candidate SNP at this locus indicated regulatory potential.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis supports association between MUC1 and ectopic pregnancy

finding: The variant rs61839660 was associated with decreased risk of type 1 diabetes (OR 0.70) and was demonstrated to colocalize with IL2RA expression levels.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs121965043 SNP in the OAT gene was significantly associated with 3-amino-2-piperidone, suggesting its potential role in the metabolic pathway involving ornithine aminotransferase.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: rs117896735 emerged as the top contributor to PD risk in model analyses, being an intronic variant of INPP5F, a known PD risk gene, highlighting its connection to disease pathology.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs11101546 was associated with cerebrospinal fluid microRNA signatures that served as diagnostic biomarkers in brain tumors. This finding related to the potential use of CSF protein profiling for insights into brain aging and diseases, linking genetic factors to neurodegenerative processes.
title: Sex and aging signatures of proteomics in human cerebrospinal fluid identify distinct clusters linked to neurodegeneration

finding: The study highlighted rs7097397 as a lead missense variant at the WDFY4 locus that had a significant role in rheumatoid arthritis (RA) etiology. It was part of a trans-ancestry analysis that indicated a reduction in size of the credible set as compared to single ancestry studies.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs224081 was part of a study that associated its genetic variations with responses to subconcussive impacts in athletes. The findings indicated a correlation between the SNP and cognitive impairments such as N400 delays and sensory deficits reflected in N100 amplitude reductions, which were consistent in both male and female high school athletes. This represented a vital original finding suggesting that genetic factors may influence susceptibility to subconcussive impairments resulting from repetitive head impacts in contact sports.
title: A brain vital sign study of subconcussion in female and male high school student athletes

finding: The SNP rs1171614, which mapped to SLC16A9, was involved in studies assessing its relationship with carnitine levels and showed significant associations with various traits, including inflammatory diseases and anthropometry. It displayed consistent findings with rs274567 across several traits identified at GWAS significance levels, although specific protective effects against Covid19 were not reported for this SNP alone.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses show that higher acetyl-carnitine and carnitine levels in blood protect against severe Covid19

finding: Analysis of rs11195272 revealed it as a tag eSNP that exhibited a significant association with gene expression changes in males (FDR = 0.046). This suggests its important role in the male-specific transcriptional response to the stress hormone, further establishing the potential impact of this SNP within stress-related psychiatric disorder research.
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: The SNP rs74494115 was associated with multiple phthalate metabolite ratios, particularly MECPP_MEHPP, linked to the CYP2C9 gene. This was noted as a positive original finding with an effect size of -0.309 and a very significant p-value of 1.45E-63.
title: Common genetic variants associated with urinary phthalate levels in children: a genome-wide study

finding: SNP rs10458657 in the VCL gene was significantly associated with PAPP-A levels at visit 1, highlighted by a P-value of 2.89×10^-8. This indicates a genetic influence on the protein's levels relevant to pregnancy outcomes.
title: Genetic Associations with Dynamic Placental Proteins Identify Causal Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs10997870 in the SIRT1 gene was positively associated with suicide behaviors in individuals with bipolar disorder. This finding indicated that genetic variation at this locus could influence the risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior in this population.
title: Investigating the relationship between DNA methylation, genetic variation, and suicide attempt in bipolar disorder

finding: In the female l-ARMSS analysis, rs1219732, which is intronic to CPXM2, approached genome-wide significance with a beta of 0.5693 (p=6.48×10^-8). It also approached significance in the l-MSSS analysis with beta 0.5447 (p=1.89×10^-7).
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: In males, rs7070182 was associated with l-MSSS-defined severity (beta =-1.11, p=3.65×10^-7), but did not surpass significance thresholds in the l-ARMSS analysis.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: As a newly identified intronic variant in GPR158, it was found significantly associated with VATadjBMI (P = 1.4 x 10^-8).
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: This SNP was associated with the AF-related heart failure subtype and is linked to the AGAP5 gene region, highlighting its relevance in this specific heart failure category.
title: Identifying subtypes of heart failure with machine learning: external, prognostic and genetic validation in three electronic health record sources with 320,863 individuals

finding: The 10p12.31 locus containing rs12246842 showed shared genetic influences on sleep duration, correlating with mean diffusivity (MD) of the fornix.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The 10q24.32 variant rs12411886 linked with multiple brain regions such as the basal forebrain, indicating genetic correlations with insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs12251016 variant located in the left/right lateral ventricle was found associated with sleep constructs.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1577857 was associated with the RP11-655H13.2 gene and had a genome-wide significant association with a p-value of 2.47×10−08. This SNP was part of the findings relevant to genetic predispositions to MaxAlc.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: Variant rs17747324 was significantly associated with Type 2 Diabetes (T2D), further supporting the metabolic disease theory related to AD. This SNP was also replicated in the study's analysis.
title: Cross-phenotype associations between Alzheimer’s Disease and its comorbidities may provide clues to progression

finding: The SNP rs34872471 was found to be associated with type 2 diabetes in both the African and European ancestry GWAS. This connection was consistent across both unweighted and weighted analyses.
title: Increasing Representativeness in the All of Us Cohort Using Inverse Probability Weighting

finding: The SNP rs35198068 was identified as a variant significantly associated with type 2 diabetes, observed in both the unweighted and weighted GWAS for diverse ancestries.
title: Increasing Representativeness in the All of Us Cohort Using Inverse Probability Weighting

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was recognized as a likely risk allele for type 2 diabetes, confirmed through multiple analyses, including both unweighted and weighted GWAS.
title: Increasing Representativeness in the All of Us Cohort Using Inverse Probability Weighting

finding: This SNP is located in an intron of the FAS gene and is a cis-eQTL for FAS and ACTA2 in various tissues, relating to T cell-mediated apoptosis.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP, lying upstream of the GATA3 gene, is associated with lymphocyte counts and plays a role in T cell lineage specification.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: Situated in intron 7 of IL2RA, this SNP associates with various autoimmune diseases and represents a link to immune dysregulation.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The common missense variant rs2234962 within the BAG3 gene was previously associated with BAG3's potential cardioprotective function in GWAS related to dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM), heart failure (HF), and ejection fraction. It influenced plasma levels of NT-proBNP and BNP and suggested a role in protecting against cardiomyopathies.
title: Circulating cardiovascular proteomic associations with genetics and disease

finding: The rs191757273 variant, found in the PYROXD2 gene, displayed significant association with LDL-c concerning LTST, contributing to the understanding of lipid variations linked to sleep patterns.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The variant rs7903146 at TCF7L2 showed significant effects in the marginal genetic effect test for T2D analysis in the youth group, with a p-value of 1.30×10−9. This SNP was previously associated with T2D in earlier studies.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: In the adult analysis, rs35198068 at TCF7L2 was noted as a known association with T2D and showed statistical significance in the marginal test, confirming previous associations.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs36229791 was identified at the novel locus on 10q24.31 associated with LUSC. It was linked with the mRNA expression levels of the oncogene BLOC1S2, consistent with previous findings and was associated with centrosome function.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The variant rs12771445 in the PLPP4 locus was reported as a potential novel PD risk variant with genome-wide significant association in the Swedish cohort. It was an intron variant with a beta of -0.44 and p-value of 1.30E-08. This association has not been reported in other cohorts, suggesting a possible population-specific effect.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Variant rs12772937 reached genome-wide significance with a beta of -0.40 and p-value of 2.48E-08 in this study, representing another significant finding in the context of PD risk related to the PLPP4 locus.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The variant rs77989396 showed a significant inverse association with PD status, illustrated by an odds ratio of 0.47 and a p-value of 2.64E-04, indicating a potential protective effect among carriers of this variant within the PLPP4 gene.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The SNP rs74466257 was found to be significantly associated with PD, with a p-value of 3.29E-04 and an odds ratio of 0.52, further suggesting a decreased risk of Parkinson's disease among carriers.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The haplotype including variant rs978854 was statistically significantly associated with PD risk (OR=0.69, p=2.54E-05), indicating a decrease in risk for carriers of this haplotype within the PLPP4 locus.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The variant rs7910507 was part of the haplotype showing an association with decreased PD risk (OR=0.69), underscoring its relevance in the genetic architecture of Parkinson's disease.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Variant rs10886711 was included in the haplotype which showed significance with PD, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors involved in Parkinson's disease risk.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The variant rs11199417 was also part of the significant haplotype associated with decreased risk for PD, reinforcing the need for further exploration of the PLPP4 locus.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: rs10886717 was noted in the context of a haplotype associated with lower PD susceptibility, indicating its importance in the genetic risk profile for Parkinson's disease.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Identified as a shared causal variant for total FAs and omega-3%, suggesting its pivotal role in these fatty acid pathways.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was part of the findings for novel loci linked to fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: It was associated with CD4+ memory stem T cells and had significant eQTL effects on the gene FAS, shedding light on its functional role in T cell apoptosis.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This SNP showed significant associations with immune cell distributions, contributing to the broader understanding of immunological genetics.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This SNP was identified in the EUR population with a significant GWAS p-value of 6.4E-13, showing association with schizophrenia. It represented one of two distinct significant SNPs corresponding with the gene CNNM2.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The SNP chr10:104657300:T:C was significant in the EAS population (GWAS p-value = 5.4E-12) and linked to the same gene CNNM2 as the chr10:104850632:G:A variant, indicating differences in genetic architecture between populations despite shared risk genes.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The SNP chr10:104654577:T:C associated with CNNM2 demonstrated strong enhancer activity as confirmed by dual luciferase assays. This eSNP was also found in high linkage disequilibrium with significant GWAS SNPs for the gene.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The analysis identified rs11187129 as an outlier that distorted the MR estimate regarding BMI's influence on MS during the birth epoch. The presence of this SNP contributed to bias in results, as its removal from the analysis led to a corrected estimate closer to the null (beta_corrected = -0.06, p=0.69), indicating that genetically-elevated BMI at birth may not significantly influence MS risk.
title: Age-specific effects of childhood BMI on multiple sclerosis risk: a Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The rs771100097 marker represented the p.Arg161His variant in the GRID1 gene, which segregated in an autosomal recessive manner among affected family members. It was predicted to be disease causing by Mutation Taster and involved in neurological conditions including intellectual disability and spastic paraplegia.
title: GRID1/GluD1 homozygous variants linked to intellectual disability and spastic paraplegia impair mGlu1/5 receptor signaling and excitatory synapses

finding: SNP rs866770710 was significant in eQTL analyses involving ECHDC3 in brain neurons and associated with AD, highlighting its role in neuronal processes.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The rs284585 SNP located in VEGF was associated with increased aortic diameter and higher risk of thoracic aortic aneurysm and dissection (TAAD). This indicated a role for insulin action in enhancing angiogenesis through VEGF, contributing to TAAD risk.
title: Mendelian randomization suggests a causal link between glycemic traits and thoracic aortic structures and diseases

finding: The rs7903146 SNP in the TCF7L2 gene demonstrated an inverse association with glucose measures (2hPG, FG, HbA1c, and T2DM) and was linked to a reduced risk of aortic phenotypes, reinforcing the association of TCF7L2 variants with decreased TAAD risk independent of diabetes status.
title: Mendelian randomization suggests a causal link between glycemic traits and thoracic aortic structures and diseases

finding: The SNP rs11200638 was identified as the RPD risk lead variant within the ARMS2/HTRA1 locus on chromosome 10, with a beta of 0.26 and a p-value of 3.73e-15, reaching genome-wide significance in relation to age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and reticular pseudodrusen (RPD). This SNP was associated with the extent of RPD in various cohorts, showing a significant association with higher RPD extent, suggesting its role in retinal microstructure.
title: Genetic Risk of Reticular Pseudodrusen in Age-Related Macular Degeneration: HTRA1/lncRNA BX842242.1 dominates, with no evidence for Complement Cascade involvement

finding: The rs7903146 SNP was part of the newly established PRP-5, showing a significant association with polyvascular coronary artery disease in T2DM patients, contributing to an odds ratio (OR) of 5.2.
title: Complexity of Coronary Disease and a Genetic Risk Profile in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes in Colombia

finding: The SNP rs1799853, associated with the CYP2C9 *2 allele, was found to correlate strongly with plasma levels of ibuprofen and was classified with the highest evidence level (Level 1A) by PharmGKB, indicating its significant role in affecting ibuprofen metabolism, particularly in different racial populations.
title: Exploration of interethnic variation in the ibuprofen metabolizing enzyme CYP2C9: a genetic-based cautionary guide for treatment of COVID-19 symptoms

finding: The SNP rs1057910, related to the CYP2C9 *3 allele, showed strong correlation with ibuprofen plasma concentrations and was also assigned Level 1A evidence by PharmGKB, suggesting its critical involvement in pharmacogenetics regarding ibuprofen treatment efficacy.
title: Exploration of interethnic variation in the ibuprofen metabolizing enzyme CYP2C9: a genetic-based cautionary guide for treatment of COVID-19 symptoms

finding: The SNP rs6481586 was identified as the lead variant in the association analysis for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM). The study revealed that this variant had effect and non-effect alleles, with observed opposite directions of effect when comparing HCM and dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM). This indicated complex interactions within the genetic architecture of heart diseases.
title: Large scale genome-wide association analyses identify novel genetic loci and mechanisms in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

finding: The mannose-binding lectin 2 rs11003123 polymorphism was found to be associated with the development of hepatocellular carcinoma in patients with hepatitis B-related cirrhosis within the Chinese population.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: This SNP was part of the super variants chr7_43 and related to pulmonary function as indicated by its association with COVID-19 mortality.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The SNP rs61843241, near NRP1, became borderline significant in the sensitivity analysis, with NRP1's role suggesting involvement in cardiac hypertrophy and potentially myocardial fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs1343094 was identified as an eQTL for PLCE1, a gene that encodes phospholipase C ε. The expression prediction suggested that decreased expression of PLCE1 correlated with increased aortic diameter, which was also associated with decreased strain and distensibility, highlighting a complex relationship at this locus.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: SNP rs35247409 was associated with the NOC3L gene as an eQTL. The genetic prediction indicated that lower expression of NOC3L was linked to increased aortic diameter, corroborating a complex relationship between this SNP and aortic phenotypes.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: The lead SNP rs7921574, located in an intron of CNNM2, was associated with a 6% increase in global brain arterial diameter (P=1.54×10^-8), indicating its significant role as a genetic determinant of this phenotype.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs10748839 near NT5C2 showed a genome-wide significant association with global brain arterial diameter (P=2.54×10^-8), highlighting its potential influence on cerebrovascular traits.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: SNP rs10786721, associated with AS3MT, also demonstrated a genome-wide significant relationship with global brain arterial diameter (P=4.97×10^-8), suggesting genetic contributions from this locus.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs7897654 co-localized with expression of CNNM2 and was associated with a decrease in brain arterial diameter (β=-0.06, P=6.17×10^-7), confirming its functional relevance to this gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The study indicated that the genotype of CYP2C19*2 (rs4244285) was associated with clopidogrel resistance, which led to a higher risk of major adverse cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events (MACCEs) among patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). The findings revealed that patients with this specific SNP who were guided by the genotype-driven plan showed a reduced incidence rate of ischemic events compared to those receiving standard care.
title: Implementing a Pharmacogenomic-driven Algorithm to Guide Antiplatelet Therapy among Caribbean Hispanics: A non-randomized prospective cohort study

finding: The study reported that pregnant women with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) who carried the risk allele (T) in TCF7L2 rs7903146 displayed significantly lower fasting insulin levels compared to non-carriers. This finding indicated that the presence of the T allele was associated with impaired insulin secretion among GDM mothers, suggesting a role of genetic factors in insulin secretory defects contributing to GDM.
title: Fasting C-peptide in Gestational Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The rs10736933 variant was identified as a significant genetic locus associated with social isolation in the total scale of the Lubben Social Network Scale (LSNS-6) in a Japanese population. It was located near the genes ACADSB and HMX3, with ACADSB linked to metabolic disorders and HMX3 involved in neuronal functions.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Social Isolation in 63 497 Japanese Individuals from the General Population

finding: The rs6413432 (7632T>A) SNP was found to significantly affect isoniazid (INH) bioavailability. Heterozygote participants (n=10) exhibited a 23% (2.2-50%) higher bioavailability compared to wild type patients (p=0.0008), indicating its relevance in the metabolism of isoniazid.
title: A Nanopore sequencing-based pharmacogenomic panel to personalize tuberculosis drug dosing

finding: The nonsense variant rs41292634 in DCLRE1A was significantly associated with menopause timing, with a p-value of 7.5 x 10^-11, marking it as an important variant in the studied cohort.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: Associated with estimated mid-trimester cervical length, rs73591716 is located in the CACNB2 gene, which encodes a subunit of a calcium voltage-gated channel. This gene has roles in controlling calcium ion influx and has been linked with cardiac arrhythmias and uterine contractions during labor.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Cervical Length is Shared with Spontaneous Preterm Birth Risk

finding: The SNP rs143282422 was noted as a missense variant in the gene CDH23, associated with hearing loss. This variant's identification contributed to understanding the genetic architecture of hearing loss.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs10901863 was identified as an intronic variant in the gene CTBP2. This variant was part of the analysis aimed at uncovering genetic variants associated with hearing loss, contributing to the study's overall findings.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs7090046 was associated with Raynaud's syndrome (RS) at a significant level (P = 3.93×10−47) across multiple cohorts. It was identified as a lead variant in functional models implicating adrenergic signaling through the ADRA2A gene, which showed tissue-specific expression in tibial arteries. Further analyses indicated that higher expression of ADRA2A gene correlated with increased risk for RS.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1343449 affected ADRA2A gene expression in the tibial arteries. It was noted for being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs7090046 and demonstrated significant eQTL effects, strengthening the connection between ADRA2A variants and Raynaud's syndrome.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The rs12247015 variant was found to influence mtDNA-CN, mapping to a 5' UTR variant in the TFAM gene, which has a potential regulatory role in mitochondrial function.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The rs4397793 variant was associated with mtDNA-CN and was identified as an intronic variant in the TFAM gene, indicating its involvement in mtDNA regulation.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The rs58678340 variant exhibited a significant association with mtDNA-CN (p=1.3×10^-39) near the TWNK gene, suggesting its involvement in mitochondrial processes.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The rs1049432 variant was significantly associated with mtDNA-CN (p=1.5×10^-21) in relation to the TFAM gene, impacting mtDNA regulation.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The intronic variant rs3934643:G>A in SFTPD was linked to increased risk of hospitalization (OR = 1.03, P = 5.3 × 10^-8) and decreased lung function, underlining its relevance in respiratory health.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The study identified that the variant rs12248560, associated with CYP2C19*17, impacted the metabolism of proton pump inhibitors (PPIs). This variant categorized users as rapid or ultrarapid metabolizers and was involved in the increased risk of influenza (HR 1.32) and pneumonia (HR 1.42) among PPI users, indicating a significant correlation between this SNP and respiratory infection risks.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The SNP rs17884712, identified as CYP2C19*9, also played a role in the categorization of PPI users. Its presence among certain metabolizer groups was linked to elevated risk factors for developing influenza and pneumonia, similar to rs12248560, thereby confirming its relevance in PPI metabolism and associated health risks.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: Variant rs4986893, classified as CYP2C19*3, was utilized to stratify PPI users into subgroups, emphasizing its involvement in altered PPI metabolism. The findings indicated a relationship between this SNP and increased susceptibility to respiratory infections, particularly influenza and pneumonia.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The SNP rs4244285, associated with CYP2C19*2, was included in the analysis to assess its impact on PPI metabolism. This variant contributed to the classification of users but was also linked to elevation in risks for influenza and pneumonia among PPI users, reinforcing its clinical significance in pharmacogenetics.
title: Associations of proton pump inhibitors with susceptibility to influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19: Evidence from a large population based cohort study

finding: The SNP rs10740129 near JMJD1C was found to be associated with AF and multiple cardiometabolic traits, suggesting it has universal effects but showed opposite influences on AF and most cardiometabolic traits.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The SNP rs1358030, located near SORCS1 at 10q25.1, also demonstrated an indirect association with time-to-diabetic retinopathy (DR) and time-to-diabetic nephropathy (DN) via its influence on the longitudinal trait HbA1c. Similar to rs10810632, this SNP was implicated in the development and progression of T1DC, thus supporting the genetic link between HbA1c levels and these complications in type 1 diabetes as observed in the DCCT study.
title: Characterization of direct and/or indirect genetic associations for multiple traits in longitudinal studies of disease progression

finding: The SNP rs281851 was identified as an intronic variant of the gene CCDC3 with a significant interaction effect with excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) impacting the apnea-hypopnea index (AHI). This interaction suggested that the presence of allele A for rs281851 elevated AHI in individuals experiencing EDS, indicating its relevance to obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). It was reported as previously unreported for OSA.
title: Gene-Excessive Sleepiness Interactions Suggest Treatment Targets for Obstructive Sleep Apnea Subtype

finding: The study identified a significant association between the rs11101439 SNP and diagnoses linked to pituitary gland hyperfunction. This SNP was among the seven likely pathogenic heterozygous variants detected in individuals with sporadic pituitary adenomas (PAs), specifically contributing to conditions characterized by hormonal dysregulation and tumorigenesis. The findings illuminated the potential role of this SNP in PAs through the genetic analysis performed on a large cohort.
title: Germline loss-of-function PAM variants are enriched in subjects with pituitary hypersecretion

finding: pgBoost linked rs12722502 to IL2RA, fine-mapped for both deep vein thrombosis (PIP 0.93) and eosinophil count (PIP 0.51). The SNP resides in an intronic enhancer of IL2RA, a key component in the interleukin 2 signaling pathway, critical for T cell proliferation and homeostasis. The link scored in the top 5% of distance-based links.
title: Linking regulatory variants to target genes by integrating single-cell multiome methods and genomic distance

finding: The SNP rs10901814 was associated with shape features in the hippocampus and was an eQTL for the genes EEF1AKMT2 and LHPP.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs4962691 was linked to specific shape features in the hippocampus and lateral ventricles, indicating genetic effects localized in areas like the hippocampal tail and CA1 region.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The variant rs3740066 was identified as the main variant in the interaction between the MRP2-ABCC2 genetic score and prenatal antiseizure drug use. It showed strong evidence of an interaction, with a <p-value> for interaction of 0.023. This variant was linked to lower birth weight in offspring exposed to antiseizure medication and was previously associated with poorer responses to antiseizure medication and other adverse pregnancy events.
title: Interaction between placental efflux transporters and use of antiseizure or antidepressant drugs during pregnancy on birth weight in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: This SNP, tagging LINC00841 and C10orf142, was identified in association with low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs1171614 was identified as the lead SNP for a co-localized cis-eQTL for SLC16A9, a gene involved in kidney monocarboxylate transport relevant to carnitine transport.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: SNP rs73592376 was noted as a trans-eQTL at the CUBN locus, which is connected to the regulation of protein uptake in the kidney.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: Identified in the LRMDA locus with an odds ratio of OR=2.39 (P=4.10×10^-9) for susceptibility in non-European participants, indicating increased risk related to this variant.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: Located at 10p14, the SNP rs10795668 also displayed a significant association with colorectal cancer risk, with an OR of 1.19 (95% CI: 1.015-1.393, P=0.03216). This SNP had been previously implicated in CRC susceptibility.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The SNP rs10795616 demonstrated a significant association with health satisfaction, being the only exception among the lead SNPs that were primarily linked to pain intensity. Its association was noted with a p-value of 2.21e-08, indicating a strong link to this aspect of somatoform traits.
title: Multivariate, Multi-omic Analysis in 799,429 Individuals Identifies 134 Loci Associated with Somatoform Traits

finding: Association with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD was reported for this SNP.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was identified as significantly associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs141447648 was used as a replacement for rs578069621, which was absent in the AMP PD dataset but was present in perfect LD with rs141447648. This indicates that while specific findings for this SNP were not elaborated on, it was considered relevant within the context of the adjusted mtDNA-CN analysis that facilitated the calculation of polygenic risk scores (PRS).
title: Unveiling Peripheral Immune Dysfunction in Parkinson’s Disease through Analysis of Blood-based Mitochondrial DNA Copy Number

finding: This variant was found to show an OR of 1.65 for T2D risk in the context of the studied population, highlighting its role as a susceptibility variant for the disease.
title: Rare variants of the glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor (GLP1R) gene are overrepresented in a severe obesity cohort and associated with type 2 diabetes in the UK Biobank

finding: With an OR of 1.39 for T2D risk, rs140242150 was identified as one of the susceptibility variants within TCF7L2 in conjunction with the analysis of rare GLP1R variants.
title: Rare variants of the glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor (GLP1R) gene are overrepresented in a severe obesity cohort and associated with type 2 diabetes in the UK Biobank

finding: A missense variant rs721917:A>G (p.Met31Thr) in SFTPD was found to confer risk for hospitalization, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.06 (95% confidence interval [CI] = 1.04, 1.08) and a significance of P = 1.7 × 10^-8. This SNP was previously associated with increased risk of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and decreased lung function.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19: an update

finding: The SNP rs7084454, which is intronic to MLLT10, was shared among substantial clusters for PCOS, endometriosis, and uterine fibroids, indicating a broad impact on reproductive conditions relating to BMI.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The T allele of rs2002042 from ABCC2 gene had lower frequency in LLIs, indicating a lower risk of biliary disorders, with survival chances reduced by 0.486 times when the risk allele was present.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: This common variant in TSPAN14 replicated in the cohort, pertaining to the amyloid processing pathway and possibly linking to its protective role in Alzheimer’s disease via its influence on ADAM10 maturation.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The SNP rs3740129 was linked to two CpGs, cg15093997 and cg20048045, located within regulatory elements for CHST3. In both cases, the OA effect allele A correlated with decreased DNA methylation. This finding highlighted its potential role in OA pathogenesis.
title: Epigenetic mechanisms of osteoarthritis risk in human skeletal development

finding: This BAG3 gene variant was enriched among patients with dilated cardiomyopathy and was linked to newly identified loci in the context of HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP tagged a missense variant in BAG3, linking it to HF through known associations in the genetic landscape.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: With a high likelihood of SNP-based harmful effects, rs1983864 was highlighted as a tag SNP in relevant studies indicating its involvement in cognitive function.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs10787516 emerged from the fine-mapping analysis as a putative causal variant, supporting its association with adiponectin levels in the study.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs10886863 was recognized as a putative causal variant related to adiponectin, included among the lead variants investigated during the analysis.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The ADRB1 variant rs7076938 was linked to increased risk of atrial fibrillation (AF) rehospitalization or cardiovascular death/transplant, showing a HR of 1.172 and a significant P value of 0.0031 in matched participants.
title: Combining Genetic Proxies of Drug Targets and Time-to-event analyses From Longitudinal Observational Data To Identify Target Patient Populations

finding: The BAG3 variant rs2234962 showed a protective effect against heart failure rehospitalization or cardiovascular death/transplant composite outcome within 10 years, with a HR of 0.96 and a significant P value of 0.033.
title: Combining Genetic Proxies of Drug Targets and Time-to-event analyses From Longitudinal Observational Data To Identify Target Patient Populations

finding: The CYP2C9 rs2860905 polymorphism was associated with the efficacy of losartan in hypertensive patients, indicating that genetic variation at this locus may influence individual responses to losartan treatment.
title: Impact of Losartan on Portal hypertension and Liver Cirrhosis: A Systematic Review

finding: For the rs603424 SNP near the SCD locus, a higher MUFA biosynthesis rate was associated with lower odds of coronary artery disease among the European population. This suggested a beneficial role of SCD activity in cardiovascular risk.
title: The impact of fatty acids biosynthesis on the risk of cardiovascular diseases in Europeans and East Asians: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The association between rs371858405, located near genes MRC1 and TMEM236 on chromosome 10, was linked to a reduced risk of hypothyroidism with an odds ratio of 0.94 and a p-value of 2.6e-11. This finding was significant in the context of the larger whole-genome sequencing data as it was uncovered when previous imputed array data had insufficient SNP coverage.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: The C allele of rs703972 near ZMIZ1 demonstrated a positive correlation with increased levels of active GLP-1 (p=1.6×10−5), suggesting its role in glucose metabolism related to T2D.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The T risk allele of rs7903146 in TCF7L2 was shown to influence higher total and active GLP-1 levels, further supporting its role in T2D risk through modulation of incretin action.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The SNP chr10:87957355:G:T was linked to the PTEN gene, which negatively regulates telomerase, thus influencing LTL.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The SNP chr10:109948435:A:G was significant only in African ancestry, suggesting its specific role in LTL within this population group.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The rs7090046 SNP was identified as a candidate causal variant strongly associated with Raynaud's phenomenon (RP), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.27. Higher expression of the ADRA2A gene in the tibial artery correlated with increased RP risk. This was supported by evidence of a shared genetic signal with a posterior probability (PP) greater than 96%.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies ADRA2A and IRX1 as novel risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The SNP rs11245366 emerged as the top finding in the multivariate analysis, linked with the gene EEF1AKMT2. Previous PheWAS reported associations of this SNP with phenotypes related to kidney function, such as cystatin C, creatine, and urate levels. This establishes a potential genetic relationship between CC volume alterations and kidney function issues, hinting at shared underlying genetic factors.
title: Distributed Genetic Effects of the Corpus Callosum Subregions Suggest Links to Neuropsychiatric Disorders and Related Traits

finding: Rs2342606 was tagged for the deletion of LOC642521 and LOC642538, and was shown to be associated with increased expression of TMEM252-AS1 in various tissues. In the eQTLGen phase I database, this SNP was linked to altered expression of genes including TMEM254, which may influence outcomes in liver transplantation.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: The BAG3 variant rs17099139 was associated with mitral valve annular diameter, suggesting a role in the contractile function of cardiomyocytes.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: The BAG3 missense variant rs2234962 resulted in functional implications linked with contractility, related to the variant rs17099139.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: Identified as a cis-eQTL for ADRA2A in artery tissue, rs1343449 was part of a sparse credible set of variants with a high posterior probability (PIP of 23.6%). Its association with higher ADRA2A expression reinforced the link to increased RP risk.
title: ADRA2A and IRX1 are putative risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The SNP rs4918722, located in the intronic region of GPAM, was associated with increased liver fat. GPAM is involved in phospholipid biosynthesis, and its overexpression in rat hepatocytes led to steatosis and insulin resistance. Knockout models showed protection against diet-induced liver fat by reducing triglyceride synthesis.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs182977703 was associated with both the COM_Norm and CDICT_Total phenotypes and was located within the gene SHTN1 (Shootin 1), which is implicated in neuronal polarization. This association has potential relevance to neurodevelopmental disorders like intellectual disability.
title: A genome-wide association study of Chinese and English language abilities in Hong Kong Chinese children

finding: This variant was characterized as a causal variant at the TCF7L2 locus with a high posterior probability, showing a key association with type 2 diabetes risk among different ancestry groups.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: SNP rs78656993 was discovered within the NRP1 gene from the GWAS of factor 27. It was noted to be located in an enhancer region.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: Identified from the GWAS of factor 27, rs1411924 is located at a transcription factor binding site within the NRP1 gene.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: SNP rs2234962 was associated with known cardiomyopathies, specifically linked to the BAG3 gene.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs71481792 was found to be associated with GATA3, which is part of the immune function and chromatin remodeling family, suggesting its relevance in the context of immunity and viral response.
title: Development and validation of a clinical and genetic model for predicting risk of severe COVID-19

finding: There was a genome-wide significant association found for rs6480922 (ZMIZ1) with p-S65-Ub levels as well, with a beta coefficient of -0.33 and a p-value of 1.42x10-8. This demonstrated that the presence of the ZMIZ1 variant was associated with lower levels of the p-S65-Ub marker, indicating a potential protective role against mitochondrial damage in LBD.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies APOE and ZMIZ1 variants as mitophagy modifiers in Lewy body disease

finding: The SNP rs7088974 at the VDAC2 locus exhibited a nominally significant association with both peripheral artery disease (PAD) and coronary artery disease (CAD) in a bivariate analysis (bivariate P=7.8×10−9). This finding indicated colocalization with VDAC2 mRNA expression in vascular tissues such as the aorta and tibial artery, where the C allele was associated with increased VDAC2 expression and also correlated with increased PAD and CAD prevalence.
title: Multi-trait GWAS of atherosclerosis detects novel pleiotropic loci

finding: The SNP rs11599236 at the SORCS3 locus indicated a nominal genome-wide significant signal with PAD and total cholesterol (bivariate P=2.4×10−8). This locus was previously noted for its association with mood disorders and demonstrated colocalization with SORCS3 mRNA expression in pituitary tissue, suggesting a direct influence on both PAD and total cholesterol.
title: Multi-trait GWAS of atherosclerosis detects novel pleiotropic loci

finding: The variant rs182341709 in LINC02661 was associated with risk increases later in life, with over 90% of the cases classified as mild showing the risk-increasing genotypes.
title: Meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis in 1,094,060 individuals identifies new risk loci, and sub-analysis characterizes the loci with disease severity and onset

finding: The SNP rs7900976, an intron variant in GAD2, exhibited significant association with depression risk. It was upregulated over time for major allele homozygotes and downregulated for heterozygous individuals, suggesting a role in depression vulnerability.
title: Sensitive period-regulating genetic pathways and exposure to adversity shape risk for depression

finding: The association of rs2505998 was confirmed with Hirschsprung’s disease, represented by phecode 750.214 'Hirschsprung’s disease and other congenital functional disorders of colon'. The PheWAS using Peds-Phecodes revealed a significant odds ratio (OR) of 2.23 at p = 6.02 x 10^-4, while the standard phecodes failed to replicate this association.
title: Developing and Evaluating Pediatric Phecodes (Peds-Phecodes) for High-Throughput Phenotyping Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs773949 was identified as one of the lead SNPs from the analysis, indicating its significance in the genetic overlap between anorexia nervosa (AN) and body mass index (BMI). This finding suggested that variants at this locus may influence both traits.
title: An Evolutionary Perspective on the Genetics of Anorexia Nervosa

finding: The SNP rs11200634, which mapped to the ARMS2 locus, was associated with age-related macular degeneration and risk of retinal detachments and breaks, reporting a beta of 0.05 with a p-value of 2.26×10^-10.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: At this locus, the SNP showed a strong link with strontium levels in maternal plasma.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: Association between the BORCS7-ASMT locus and 17-hydroxyprogesterone (17OHP) was confirmed.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CYP2C19 locus was shown to influence hormone metabolism significantly.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: At this locus, an association pointed to hormonal interactions under various physiological contexts.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This association confirmed its role in metabolic interactions involving steroid hormones.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The rs114598725 variant presented male-specific associations in the study and contributed to the understanding of genetic risk factors in primary open-angle glaucoma.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs11190559 variant was outlined as having significant associations with glaucoma in TWAS analysis, indicating its potential relevance in POAG through gene expression changes.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs4244285 SNP was associated with the CYP2C19*2 no function allele. This allele was found to be twice as common in individuals of Asian ancestry compared to those of European ancestry, demonstrating significant ancestry-specific prevalence. This SNP's association to altered drug metabolism has ethical implications for prioritizing genetic testing.
title: Evaluating the frequency and the impact of pharmacogenetic alleles in an ancestrally diverse Biobank population

finding: The rs12248560 SNP is a noncoding variant critical for identifying the CYP2C19*17 increased function allele, which enhances CYP2C19 gene expression.
