This allele contributes to various metabolizer phenotypes including RM (rapid metabolizer) and UM (ultra-rapid metabolizer) when present in certain combinations with other alleles.
title: Evaluating the frequency and the impact of pharmacogenetic alleles in an ancestrally diverse Biobank population

finding: The rs12777823 SNP was part of a set of 16 loci identified in the study that have gene-drug interactions. It was noted that all individuals in the analyzed cohort had at least one non-reference allele in the subset of loci including rs12777823, which confirmed its relevance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Evaluating the frequency and the impact of pharmacogenetic alleles in an ancestrally diverse Biobank population

finding: The AA homozygous genotype of rs7897633 was linked to increased mortality risk in European-Americans, emphasizing its role as a risk factor when combined with biomarkers of severe disease.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: This SNP demonstrated opposite effects between males (-0.33SD) and females (+0.18SD) regarding Aβ pathology, highlighting its potential role in sex-specific genetic risk profiles.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The variant rs111336312 located at the BMPR1A locus was associated with right ventricular ejection fraction (RVEF) in women, indicating a female-specific genetic influence on RV function.
title: Sex-specific genetic determinants of right ventricular structure and function

finding: The variant rs140745739, found in the promoter region of BMPR1A, was significantly associated with improved cardiac index in female patients with idiopathic or hereditary pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH), reinforcing its role in female-specific RV functionality.
title: Sex-specific genetic determinants of right ventricular structure and function

finding: The SNP rs12415800 was associated with major depression. It exhibited significant differences in allele frequencies between populations, being present in 45% of the Chinese population compared to only 2% in European populations, highlighting trans-ethnic genetic diversity.
title: Similarity and diversity of genetic architecture for complex traits between East Asian and European populations

finding: The SNP rs35936514 was also linked to major depression and showed a notable disparity in allele frequency, occurring in 28% of the Chinese population versus 6% in European populations, demonstrating significant ancestry-relevant heterogeneity.
title: Similarity and diversity of genetic architecture for complex traits between East Asian and European populations

finding: This intronic variant in the PLCE1 gene served as the lead SNP for descending aortic distensibility and was a strong eQTL for PLCE1 in arterial tissue.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was associated with asthma in the S2 subtype of preclinical-T2DM. This finding underscored the genetic distinction of S2 from S1, suggesting unique associations with respiratory conditions.
title: Identification of distinct trajectories in preclinical type 2 diabetes and their associations with outcomes

finding: The SNP rs559580 was associated with left/co-dominance at the CXCL12 locus in the 3,141 participant cohort from the Penn Medicine Biobank (PMBB). It had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.18, an odds ratio (OR) of 1.46, and a significance level of p=6.7x10^-5. In a larger multi-ancestry GWAS, this variant also showed consistent directionality with an OR of 1.25 and a p-value of 1.3x10^-28.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs1870634 emerged as a significant shared variant from co-localization analyses for both coronary dominance and coronary artery disease (CAD). It was identified in the middle peak of colocalization, suggesting that this SNP may contribute to both characteristics in individuals.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs7074248, when examined alongside rs1870634, also demonstrated a genome-wide significant association linked to increased expression of CXCL12, indicating it may play a role in cardiac development relative to dominance patterns.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs115213152 was identified as a top-ranking variant affecting regulatory element accessibility in the CXCL12 dominance locus. It was predicted to disrupt KLF transcription factor motifs, which are important for cellular responses in blood flow, implicating it further as a regulator of CXCL12 expression in cardiovascular tissues.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs649192 was highlighted for showing the highest H4 posterior probability in colocalization analyses with coronary dominance and CAD traits. It indicated a strong genetic relationship between these phenotypes within the CXCL12 genomic region.
title: CXCL12 drives natural variation in coronary artery anatomy across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs7903146 demonstrated a significant association with GDM at genome-wide significance (p=4.0×10^-16). This SNP has established ties to T2D susceptibility, reinforcing the notion of shared genetic pathways influencing both diseases.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The lead SNP rs9663238 at the HKDC1 locus was associated with GDM (p=2.9×10^-8) but presented weaker evidence for association with T2D (p=0.0083). This suggests that while it shares similarities with other loci in GDM, its relationship to T2D is less direct, highlighting its unique contribution to glucose regulation during pregnancy.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The lead variant rs61871747 in the HTRA1/ARMS2 locus demonstrated a significant effect on advanced age-related macular degeneration (AMD) with odds ratios (ORs) for the risk-increasing allele ranging from 2.03 to 2.92 across different ancestry groups, indicating no difference in effect between European (EUR) and African (AFR) ancestries.
title: Diverse ancestry GWAS for advanced age-related macular degeneration in TOPMed-imputed and Ophthalmologically-confirmed 16,108 cases and 18,038 controls

finding: This SNP was associated with the odds of missingness of N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine. It showed a mediating effect involving the gene HPS1, indicating its role in metabolic processes related to lysine derivatives.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The rs11189559 SNP was associated with the odds of missingness in N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine. Its association with PYROXD2 expression indicates role in mitochondrial function and metabolic regulation.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: This SNP showed a suggestive association with severe COVID-19, with an odds ratio of 3.47 and a P-value of 1.86e-4, indicating a strong correlation with disease severity.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: Associated with severe COVID-19, this SNP had an odds ratio of 1.76 and a P-value of 2.91e-4, supporting its role as an important genetic factor, particularly as part of a haplotype that also included rs10824844.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: This SNP was connected to severe COVID-19 with an odds ratio of 1.42 and a P-value of 3.47e-4, suggesting its involvement in the disease pathology.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: Identified within a haplotype associated with severe COVID-19, rs10824844 had an odds ratio of 1.88, indicating a significant increase in risk.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with both susceptibility and severity of COVID-19 symptoms with odds ratios of 4.11 for susceptibility and 7.91 for severity, highlighting its potential impact on disease outcomes.
title: Recognition and inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 by humoral innate immunity pattern recognition molecules

finding: The variant rs6586028 was identified at the TSPAN14 locus with a P-value of 2.33×10^-12 in stage 2, marking it as a novel risk factor for LOAD.

The rs11191660 variant, associated with the ATP5MK gene, was validated through a deletion experiment in HEK293 cells that demonstrated its significant impact on the expression level of isoform NM_032747.3. Individuals with the A/A genotype exhibited the highest expression of this isoform. The deletion led to significantly lower expression levels indicative of this variant's regulatory role in isoform expression, suggesting the functional importance of distant regulatory regions.
title: Long-read sequencing reveals novel isoform-specific eQTLs and regulatory mechanisms of isoform expression

finding: The SNP rs2104286, associated with the gene IL2RA, was identified as increasing the risk for rheumatoid arthritis (RA) based on its minor allele. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic susceptibility factors related to different RA clusters.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs1265005 was characterized as an exonic missense variant in the COL17A1 gene. Its association with FGT polyps highlighted its potential involvement in processes related to cellular proliferation. This signal was notably linked to previous findings related to uterine fibroids.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs193097753 was associated with the COL17A1 gene and linked to reproductive health traits, including uterine fibroids. This connection emphasized its potential importance in the mechanisms underlying FGT polyp development.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs11200630 was associated with higher RPD load, achieving genome-wide significance in the primary pure RPD GWAS with a p-value of 1.9e-09, indicating its relevance to reticular pseudodrusen phenomena.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs61871744 on chromosome 10 was significantly associated with pure drusen, reaching genome-wide significance with a p-value of 4.2e-20, corroborating its role in the genetics of age-related macular degeneration.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP located in VTI1A on 10q25.2 displayed associations in East Asians, signifying population-specific genetic impacts on lung cancer.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The intergenic variant rs7902587 near STN1-SLK was notably associated with adenocarcinoma risk in diverse population studies.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP was found to have associations with IBS, indicating its potential role in gastrointestinal disease entities, particularly with respect to traits linked to obesity and kidney stones.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The SNP rs184619214 located in the CCDC7 gene reached a GWAS significance level of p = 6.38 x 10^-9 in the study of diabetic retinopathy (DR) in patients with type 1 diabetes. It was replicated in subsequent analyses, showing statistical significance in the meta-analysis phase, where it reached a p-value of 4.47 x 10^-11. The study identified this locus as a novel genomic risk locus for DR.
title: Genome-wide association studies found CCDC7 and ITGB1 associated with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The SNP rs79853754 in the ITGB1 gene exhibited a significant association with diabetic retinopathy (DR) with a p-value of 3.24 x 10^-8. The analyses revealed that this SNP was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs184619214 (r^2 = 0.95), suggesting a strong genetic connection. ITGB1 was implicated in vital pathways affecting the progression of DR, underpinning its role in the disease.
title: Genome-wide association studies found CCDC7 and ITGB1 associated with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The SNP rs2497818 reached suggestive significance for right unilateral cleft lip and palate (RCLP), located at 10p12, with a p-value of 1.57 × 10-6. This finding points to its possible contribution to the genetic risk factors for RCLP.
title: FAT4 Identified as a Potential Modifier of Orofacial Cleft Laterality

finding: The rs61839660-T variant in IL2RA was associated with increased risk of melanoma skin cancer (MSC) by 11-20%, particularly showing an odds ratio of 1.11 with a 95% CI of (1.02, 1.21). This finding indicated a relationship between IL2RA and MSC.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The lead SNP for this significant novel locus, rs10762653, displayed a high posterior probability, suggesting its potential role in pneumonia susceptibility. However, it exhibited low LD with other nearby significant SNPs, indicating complexity in genetic architecture.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: The lead variant rs165527 from a novel locus on chromosome 10 was associated with total PUFAs but was marked as an intergenic variant without a directly associated gene.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The rs1172955 SNP was identified as part of a common variant signal associated with later puberty timing in girls, with a reported effect size of 0.04 years earlier for menarche. Additionally, there was a nominal association with earlier ANM of -0.04 years, P=6.6*10^-3. The study also found that identified protein-truncating variants in ZNF518A were associated with later age at menarche of 0.56 years, supporting the notion of ZNF518A's influence on reproductive lifespan.
title: Genetic susceptibility to earlier ovarian ageing increases de novo mutation rate in offspring

finding: SNP rs9804218 was linked to the verified chr10_57 super-variant in all three repeats, underlining its relevance in the context of COVID-19.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: SNP rs2399971 was reported in the literature to be significantly associated with HBsAg seroclearance in patients who had received antiviral treatment. Although it did not reach the significance threshold in the whole study population, it displayed significance with a p-value of 4.60×10^-5 during subgroup analysis.
title: A machine learning-based SNP-set analysis approach for identifying disease-associated susceptibility loci

finding: The SNP rs2308321-G, a missense variant in MGMT, was associated with decreased survival among glioma patients treated with temozolomide (TMZ). Specifically, it was reported that carriers of the G allele had a median survival decrease of 5.5 months compared to those with AA genotype (p=0.0065). The hazard ratio was 1.21 (p=0.019), indicating that this variant contributed negatively to survival.
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: The T allele of rs1414756 in the NRG3 gene was associated with an increased risk of IR, shown by an OR of 12.2 with a p-value of 0.0009. The codominant inheritance model indicated that the C/T and T/T genotypes presented higher risk compared to C/C.
title: Unveiling Genetic Associations: Investigating CLDN16, GRID2, NRG3, and CACNG4 Gene Polymorphisms with Insulin Resistance Risk Among Normal BMI Individuals in the Indian Population

finding: Fine-mapped for serum calcium levels and located 1.2 Mb downstream of <italic>GATA3</italic>.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This SNP was also labeled as an AMD risk-raising variant with a strong association to PS thinning. Its significance in this context reinforced its importance in AMD pathogenesis.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The SNP rs12217518 showed a high frequency of HRG in TN cases compared to controls, being reported at 41% in TN cases and 30% in controls. This SNP, while not detailed in specific comparisons to idiopathic cases, contributed to the overall genetic landscape associated with TN.
title: Role of common and rare genetic variants in the aetiology of trigeminal neuralgia

finding: This SNP was identified as the likely causal SNP for the GLUD1 excitatory neuron eQTL with a causal probability of 0.87. The GLUD1 gene has an important role in inhibitory synapse formation, implicating this SNP in the genetic basis of synaptic function and potentially neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: This SNP was located in a microglia enhancer linked to USP6NL and predicted to disrupt KLF5 binding, suggesting its role in the genetic regulation of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs7912495 was fine-mapped from previous studies with high credibility for its association with AD risk.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: was associated with the development of BCC and SCC, located near RAB11FIP2, which facilitates migration and metastasis in colorectal and gastric cancer. This SNP is a lead for skin low tanning response.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: was linked to BCC and SCC, also near RAB11FIP2 and implicated in cancer progression, showing high LD with other SNPs associated with pigmentation traits.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: was associated with IL2RA and implicated in regulating T-cell function relevant to autoimmune traits.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs2253202 was found to be related to the KCNMA1 gene, which is fundamental to neuronal excitability control. The findings highlighted that mutations in this gene could cause developmental delay and seizures, showing a significant connection with neurodevelopmental outcomes.
title: Early Childhood Reading for Pleasure: Evidence from the ABCD Study for Benefits to Cognitive Performance and Mental Health and Associated Changes in Brain Structure

finding: The SNP rs10999029 was associated with the COL13A1 gene, which is involved in neuromuscular synapses. This finding suggested a relationship with early Reading for Pleasure (RfP), indicating potential implications for cognitive and synaptic functions.
title: Early Childhood Reading for Pleasure: Evidence from the ABCD Study for Benefits to Cognitive Performance and Mental Health and Associated Changes in Brain Structure

finding: This SNP (OR = 0.92, p = 5 × 10^-9) was associated with EIF5AL1 and linked to interstitial pneumonia, indicating a connection to fibrotic diseases.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: Correlating strongly with rs11003011, this SNP was located in a candidate cis-regulatory element for SFTPA2 and was implicated in fibrotic processes.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP (p = 2.70 × 10^-26) was associated with FGFR2, a gene involved in skeletal abnormalities and potentially linked to DD.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: The SNP rs2234962 was associated with dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM), where it was identified as a risk allele. This finding was significant in the context of BAG3's multifunctional role in cardiomyopathies, particularly emphasizing its impact on the disease's molecular mechanisms.
title: Role of BAG3 protein interactions in cardiomyopathies

finding: The SNP rs72840788 was noted to be in tight linkage disequilibrium with rs2234962, being related to Parkinson's disease (PD). Interestingly, the risk allele for DCM that rs2234962 presented was protective against PD when considering rs72840788, highlighting an intriguing genetic relationship between the two conditions.
title: Role of BAG3 protein interactions in cardiomyopathies

finding: The SNP rs111245635 located in RBP3 was significantly associated (P = 8.41 x 10<sup>-10</sup>) with PRC thickness and is implicated in recessive retinal dystrophy and high myopia.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs60401382 in HTRA1 was significantly associated (P = 2.43 x 10<sup>-16</sup>) with the thickness of PRC layers, highlighting its relevance to AMD, a common retinal disease.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The locus rs55798570 in CDHR1 showed significant differences in effects on IS thickness across retinal fields, relating to inherited retinal dystrophies such as retinitis pigmentosa.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The locus rs17102399 in FGFR2 affected PRC thickness and was also related to breast cancer risk, highlighting the overlap between genetic determinants of different diseases.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs560595454 was found in gene INPP5A and showed a significant association with tuberculosis with a genome-wide significance (p<5E-08) in the FinnGen study, indicating its relevance as a genetic risk factor for the disease.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs562763274, located in the gene INPP5A, was identified as a significant genetic risk factor for tuberculosis with a genome-wide significance level (p<5E-08).
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: Identified with a significant p-value (p=7.7E-04), rs145176301 supported earlier findings that connected it with tuberculosis risk factors.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The variant rs1314013, located at the ZEB1 locus, was linked to weight with a p-value of 7.19 × 10^-11, and replicate evidence was noted in BBJ with a p-value of 2.7 × 10^-4. The variant's association highlighted the potential role of ZEB1 in adiposity regulation.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The SNP rs4918003 showed the most potent evidence of regulatory potential as identified by RegulomeDB, classified with a regulatory database score of 1b. This suggested it could significantly affect transcription factor binding, reinforcing its relevance in the pleiotropic context of eGFR and CVDs.
title: Disentangling shared genetic etiologies for kidney function and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs4284332 in CHST3 was found to be associated with LDH, showing a similar pattern of increased cumulative disease severity before age 30 among homozygous individuals for the effect allele.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis conducted in three large biobanks expands the genetic landscape of lumbar disc herniations

finding: The rs7922621 variant at the TSPAN14 locus displayed one of the top signals in both European and Black/African American ancestries, indicating its significant role in Alzheimer's disease etiology across these populations.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The rs10748818 variant at the GBF1 locus had the highest estimated PAR for the African/African Admixed population, suggesting its relevance in the genetic architecture of Parkinson's disease in this group.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: This SNP was found to be highly associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD). It was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with the structural variant SV10995 within the HGSVC sample set, with a g2 value of 0.94.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: Similar to rs11200638, this SNP was highly associated with AMD and was also in perfect linkage disequilibrium with SV10995, exhibiting a g2 value of 0.94.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was identified as being highly associated with AMD and was included among the SNPs in perfect linkage disequilibrium with SV10995.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was part of the group of five SNPs that showed a high association with AMD and were linked to SV10995.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP was also identified as being highly associated with AMD and was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with SV10995.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: This SNP showed a high association with AMD and was linked to SV10995, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in AMD.
title: Structural Variants in Linkage Disequilibrium with GWAS-Significant SNPs

finding: The variant rs121909241 was identified in the context of the PTEN gene within the POG041 sample, demonstrating allele-specific expression (ASE) with a major expressed allele frequency of 0.67. Specifically, a frameshift mutation was found on the minor expressed allele, while a missense mutation was observed on the major expressed allele. This finding was interpreted as indicative of a double hit knockout scenario, consistent with the PTEN gene's role in cancer pathogenesis.
title: Long-read sequencing of an advanced cancer cohort resolves rearrangements, unravels haplotypes, and reveals methylation landscapes

finding: The rs4244285 SNP is a loss-of-function allele (LoF) variant identified in the context of decreased clopidogrel metabolism. It was noted that individuals with this allele status showed an odds ratio (OR) of 0.84 for major adverse cardiac events (MACE) when treated with clopidogrel. This suggests reduced efficacy in this subgroup.
title: CYP2C19 and effect of clopidogrel for secondary prevention of major ischemic events: systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: Like the rs4244285, the rs4986893 SNP is also classified as a loss-of-function allele. Similar findings were reported, where the odds ratio (OR) for MACE with clopidogrel in LoF-carriers was 0.84, indicating lower clopidogrel metabolism and potential inefficacy in this group.
title: CYP2C19 and effect of clopidogrel for secondary prevention of major ischemic events: systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was prioritised for its role in down-regulating IL2RA expression, supporting a revised understanding of the AD genetic landscape.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: The common frameshift variant rs145843135 (MAF=5.4%) was associated with a decreased risk for rosacea (OR: 0.88). It has been shown to correlate with lower expression levels in skin tissues.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The variant rs10882555 (MAF=45%) was associated with rosacea (OR: 0.90) and is likely tagging a missense variant (rs591157) in C10orf129, which affects plasma levels related to lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: SNP rs10995566 located at locus 10q21.3, associated with the REEP3 gene, was found to significantly correlate with MacTel (P=4.8×10-08), reinforcing its genetic involvement.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs75935441 found in the 3' untranslated region of the prolactin-releasing hormone receptor gene (PRLHR) on chromosome 10 was significantly associated with astrovirus diarrheal infection. The analysis yielded a meta-analysis p-value of 1.33×10^-8 and an odds ratio (OR) of 4.17, indicating that children with at least one copy of the C allele had a fourfold increased risk of developing the infection.
title: Genetic Susceptibility to Astrovirus Diarrhea in Bangladeshi Infants

finding: The analysis revealed that rs10826861 showed a significant effect on methylation site cg20673407, with a beta value of -1.40 and a p-value of 4.15×10^-33. This finding highlighted the SNP's relevance in understanding the epigenetic contributions to osteoarthritis, particularly in the context of the infrapatellar fat pad.
title: Epigenomic profiling of the infrapatellar fat pad in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs10821936, which is linked to the meQTL for ARID5B, was identified as showing overlap between neutrophils and naive CD4+ T cells in lupus patients, indicating its relevance in epigenetic modifications related to lupus.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: SNP rs10822056 was shown to have significant associations with at least one trait linked to Ewing Sarcoma, which indicates its relevance in the disease's genetic basis as identified through the TraitScan algorithm.
title: Subset scanning for multi-trait analysis using GWAS summary statistics

finding: The rs965277670 variant was located at the NEBL locus with an associated MAF of 0.6% and an odds ratio of 1.65, further contributing to the multiple independent signals linked to atrial fibrillation.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: The variant rs201901902 at the NEURL1 locus had a MAF of 0.5% and showed an association with atrial fibrillation (OR = 1.68), adding to the evidence of independent variants linked to the condition.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: The variant rs1769758 was implicated in the regulation of cell adhesion pathways associated with attrial fibrillation through its nearest gene ZMIZ1, vital for vascular development.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: The variant rs1247117 was identified as a functional regulatory variant with a high geometric mean of differential transcription activity in 9 of 10 ALL cell lines. It was shown to disrupt a PU.1 binding motif, leading to variations in PU.1 binding affinity that were significant in determining sensitivity to vincristine. The G allele was linked to increased PU.1 binding and chromatin accessibility, demonstrating its role in vincristine resistance in ALL cells.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: Variant rs3824662, located at the GATA3 locus, was associated with ALL susceptibility. The risk A allele correlated with higher GATA3 expression and demonstrated significantly higher allele-specific activity as measured by MPRA, indicating its functional relevance.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: rs1312895 was in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs1247117 and associated with persistence of minimal residual disease (MRD) after induction chemotherapy, underscoring its relevance in treatment outcomes for ALL.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: This SNP was also in high LD with rs1247117 and related to the same outcomes regarding MRD presence post-chemotherapy. It confirmed the involvement of proximal loci in treatment efficacy.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: The SNP rs146800892, found in the PRKG1 gene, demonstrated a significant association with glycocholic acid (GCA) levels, with its minor allele frequency being particularly noted to be under 1% in most cohorts, indicating a likely cohort-specific impact from the CROATIA-Vis group where it had an increased frequency.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals loci with sex-specific effects on plasma bile acids

finding: The variant rs117834398 also within the PRKG1 locus was reported to have a larger effect size on GCA levels in females (beta = -0.79, p = 8.30×10^-11) compared to males (beta = -0.18). This indicated sex-specific differences in genetic contributions to bile acid levels, with significant associations detected only in female-specific analyses.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals loci with sex-specific effects on plasma bile acids

finding: The intergenic SNP rs7902587 was linked to the erythroblast-like enhancer sequence class, which contains enhancer histone marks. It was notably associated with regulatory effects in prostate cancer.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The p.Pro209Leu mutation (rs121918312) in the BAG3 gene was identified as the genetic cause of Myofibrillar Myopathy 6 (MFM6), a severe condition characterized by muscle weakness and cardiomyopathy. Since the mutation is dominant, it primarily occurred as either a de novo mutation or was inherited from a parent who was a genetic mosaic for the mutation.
title: Personalized allele-specific CRISPR-Cas9 strategies for myofibrillar myopathy 6

finding: Located in the intergenic region of NUTM2A and NUTM2D, rs190759626 achieved significance in relation to Long COVID, marking an additional locus of interest in the genetic landscape of the condition.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: The SNP rs11191548 was associated with systolic blood pressure's influence on schizophrenia risk. The leave-one-out analysis demonstrated that the removal of this SNP considerably reduced the effect size and weakened statistical evidence, highlighting its significance in the examined genetic correlations.
title: Exploring the relationship between schizophrenia and cardiovascular disease: A genetic correlation and multivariable Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs792212 was associated with the RNLS locus at 10q23.31, which surpassed the genome-wide significance threshold with a P-value of 1.91x10-9 in the positive control study for endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs2981578 was located on chromosome 10q26 within an intron of the FGFR2 gene. It was associated with breast cancer risk, exhibiting a hazard ratio of 1.25 and a P-value of 1.7 × 10^-51 in the initial UK Biobank analysis. In the context of rare haplotypes, it was shown to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with patterns that were significantly associated with breast cancer risk.
title: Potential Misrepresentation of Inherited Breast Cancer Risk by Common Germline Alleles

finding: The SNP rs9419958 in OBFC1 gene showed colocalisation with lung adenocarcinoma risk, indicating it may serve as a novel susceptibility locus related to lung cancer and LTL.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs139122544 in OBFC1 demonstrated evidence of colocalisation with both leukocyte telomere length and lung adenocarcinoma, supporting its role as a novel susceptibility locus.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs373205748 was also identified as significant in the multi-ancestry analysis of the heart failure study. Its relevance was noted particularly due to the allele frequency of 0.08% in South Asians, indicating a potential contribution to heart failure predisposition in diverse ancestry groups.
title: Polygenic risk score from a multi-ancestry GWAS uncovers susceptibility of heart failure

finding: The locus rs2031617 was linked to the role of ZEB1 in pancreatic cancer, suggesting its involvement in epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition, a key feature in cancer metastasis.
title: Graph Attention Networks for Drug Combination Discovery: Targeting Pancreatic Cancer Genes with RAIN Protocol

finding: Evidence suggested that rs3011351 influences mechanisms of action of cisplatin as an anti-tumor agent in pancreatic cancer contexts.
title: Graph Attention Networks for Drug Combination Discovery: Targeting Pancreatic Cancer Genes with RAIN Protocol

finding: At 10q24.32, the female-specific lead SNP rs72845653 was identified, which was implicated in the main genetic generalized epilepsy (GGE) meta-analysis. This signal indicated a different direction of effect for females compared to males.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of over 29,000 people with epilepsy reveals 26 loci and subtype-specific genetic architecture

finding: The lead SNP rs11191156 was associated with genetic generalized epilepsy and represented a significant finding in the GGE meta-analysis, showing a connection with the KCNIP2 gene.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of over 29,000 people with epilepsy reveals 26 loci and subtype-specific genetic architecture

finding: Variants in GPAM, including rs10787429, were associated with elevated serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, liver fat, and other lipid concentrations, with a p-value of 2.8×10^-39 indicating strong evidence for this association.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: Variants such as rs11446981 in GPAM showed significant association with liver fat levels, with a p-value of 3.6×10^-13, further reinforcing the association of GPAM with liver-related phenotypes.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: Previously reported to be connected to high myopia (HM), rs7100474 was confirmed through cross-population meta-analysis, yielding a P-value of 2.02 × 10^-8.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: The SNP rs11191580 was linked to autism spectrum disorder in the Chinese Han population, suggesting its involvement in the risk profile for the condition. This association reinforced the importance of genetic analyses in identifying variants related to autism and their potential implications for clinical diagnosis.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: The SNP rs2476491, located within the IL2RA gene, was identified as a risk factor for pernicious anemia and had previously been associated with several autoimmune disorders, including multiple sclerosis and vitiligo.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies five risk loci for pernicious anemia and implicates the role of HLA-DR15 haplotype

finding: The SNP rs982764 was identified as a significant pQTL for plasma soluble FAS levels. The major allele, rs982764:T, was associated with higher levels of soluble FAS and an increased risk of severe COVID-19. This finding was linked to a genetic mechanism involving alternative splicing, where the presence of the risk allele led to an increased proportion of transcripts lacking exon 6, thereby elevating soluble FAS which acts as a decoy receptor inhibiting apoptosis. This mechanism highlighted a novel pathway contributing to severe COVID-19 risk.
title: Mendelian randomisation identifies alternative splicing of the FAS death receptor as a mediator of severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs7918269 was associated with Alzheimer's Disease susceptibility, demonstrating a highly significant p-value of 1.600000e-09. This result indicated that rs7918269 was not only a noteworthy finding but also contributed significantly to the understanding of genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's Disease, thereby highlighting its relevance in ongoing genetic research regarding this complex neurodegenerative disorder.
title: Enhanced Data Pre-processing for the Identification of Alzheimer’s Disease-Associated SNPs

finding: Near the genes PBLD and ATOH, this locus is thought to play a role in retinal ganglion cell and optic nerve formation, impacting retinal thickening.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: The rs4309079 locus was associated with single-layer positive global efficiency in functional connectivity. It was located adjacent to the INPP5A gene, which is involved in calcium signaling. This mechanism was expected to play a crucial role in various neurological pathways related to functional connectivity. The findings indicated that changes in functional connectivity, as explained by brain age, were linked to the INPP5A gene, supporting the association observed in previous research.
title: Sex differences in functional network topology over the course of aging in 37543 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs2152237 locus was found near the ADARB2 gene, which is involved in the ATP/ITP metabolic pathway. This finding was significant for understanding genetic influences on functional connectivity within the brain. The research highlighted connections between genetic architecture and functional changes that occur during healthy aging, though no colocalization evidence was found in gene expression QTL datasets.
title: Sex differences in functional network topology over the course of aging in 37543 UK Biobank participants

finding: rs10882283 in the RBP4 gene was selected as a single instrument variable (IV) for estimating the effect of retinol on various clinical outcomes, demonstrating its strong association with serum retinol levels and its specific role in retinol transport.
title: Genetic influences on circulating retinol and its relationship to human health

finding: SNP rs4919626, an intronic variant in GBF1, was replicated in the MTAG analysis of CUD.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs10884186 was identified as an intergenic variant near SORCS3, revealed to be associated with smoking.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The variant rs9332172 in the CYP2C9 gene was identified as significant for the same putative novel oxylipin, indicating its relevance in oxylipin metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The analysis indicated that the mannose binding lectin gene 2 (MBL2) missense variant rs1800450 was associated with an increased susceptibility and severity of COVID-19 infections. This finding was significant in understanding the role of immune response in the pathophysiology of COVID-19, as it linked genetic variation directly to clinical outcomes.
title: Precise blood proteome profiling in an undiagnosed population with COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs2644520 reached genome-wide significance (p = 3.06e-08, FDR = 0.122) for its association with aripiprazole-induced triglyceride changes. It is located in an intergenic region near the SORCS1 gene, implicating it in metabolic response to SGAs.
title: Pharmacogenetic Study of Antipsychotic-Induced Lipid and BMI Changes in Chinese Schizophrenia Patients: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs11597285 was associated with the <italic>Collinsella</italic> genus, which was identified among the eight gut bacterial taxa related to high-grade immune-related adverse effects (irAEs). The study indicated that <italic>Collinsella</italic> predisposed to high-grade irAEs, while the connection of rs11597285 also linked it to allergic diseases like allergic rhinitis and eczema. However, despite this association with allergic conditions, the finding for <italic>Collinsella</italic> regarding irAEs was not influenced by the removal of rs11597285 in leave-one-out analysis.
title: Appraising the causal association between gut microbiota and immune-related adverse events: perspectives from a bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1126545 was part of a set of four index SNPs previously identified in a GWAS related to clozapine metabolites. It was included as a covariate in analyses assessing plasma concentrations of active clozapine and norclozapine.
title: Rare Variants in Pharmacogenes Influence Clozapine Metabolism in Individuals with Schizophrenia

finding: Similar to rs9271375, this SNP also functioned as an eQTL for HLA-DQB1 in B cells, demonstrating state-dependent effects with the strongest influences noted in plasma cells and plasmablasts.
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The rs7903146 variant was highlighted for having strong evidence of association with type 2 diabetes (T2D). Its inclusion in the polygenic risk score (PRS) model, which was trained using a mixed-ancestry cohort, emphasized its relevance in identifying undiagnosed cases of diabetes. The PRS which leveraged this SNP, among others, was found to significantly increase the identification rate of individuals with undiagnosed diabetes in a large population study.
title: A polygenic risk score identifies undiagnosed cases of diabetes

finding: The SNP rs12247015 located in the 5’ UTR of TFAM was also significant in the EUR cohort with (βA allele = 0.039, p = 1.14 × 10^-5), confirming it as a relevant finding for mtCN.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of mtDNA copy number in a multi-ancestry cohort

finding: The SNP rs1271351 led to a significant association with UGIT and was noted as previously reported in other studies, reaffirming its relevance in the context of chronic pain.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The variant rs9419958 was found to be associated with lung cancer in the most recent meta-analysis. It was located near the OBFC1/STN1 gene, indicating a role in lung cancer risk.
title: Machine learning-based proteogenomic data modeling identifies circulating plasma biomarkers for early detection of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs7903146, mapped to the TCF7L2 locus, was one of the seven shared SNPs identified between type 2 diabetes and self-reported depression (PHQ-9), indicating a significant relationship between these conditions.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs11817236 located at the ANK3 locus was hypothesized to impact atopic dermatitis immune pathogenesis by altering keratinocyte function, given its expression variation in keratinocytes and T-cell populations, thus marking a novel genetic association with AD.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The rs12722497 SNP was associated with increased IL2RA levels while contributing to its variability, linking it to effects on regulatory T cell function.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs2104286 SNP was found to correlate with decreased IL2RA levels, affecting regulatory T cell behavior and potentially contributing to immunodeficiency contexts.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs12722489 SNP was noted for its previous association with both eQTLs and pQTLs for IL2RA, marking its importance in immune response and disease susceptibility studies.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The variant rs1800544 associated with ADRA2A displayed a significant allele frequency difference of 0.312 between European and Asian populations, indicating its relevance in pharmacogenomic studies across different ancestries.
title: Diversity and level of evidence evaluation of commercial pharmacogenomic testing for mental health

finding: The variant rs1799853 correlated with normal CYP2C9 function was more prevalent in European populations compared to African and East Asian groups, reflecting significant variation that could affect drug response in diverse ancestries.
title: Diversity and level of evidence evaluation of commercial pharmacogenomic testing for mental health

finding: The SNP rs12248560 associated with CYP2C19*17, which results in enhanced transcription, was frequently reported in European populations but was less common in Asian populations, a clear indication of how genetic variability can influence treatment efficacy.
title: Diversity and level of evidence evaluation of commercial pharmacogenomic testing for mental health

finding: The SNP rs4933752 was reported as a proxy variant for rs34350548 and was nominally significant with respect to the gene EXOC6 in the replication analysis with a p-value less than 0.05.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs55897648 was found within the duplication CNVR associated with cognitive impairment. It was reported with a p-value of 0.06 in the GWAS of general intelligence, suggestive of its potential influence on cognitive performance.
title: The copy number variant architecture of psychopathology and cognitive development in the ABCD® study

finding: The rs1133400 SNP was identified as a missense variant in the phospholipase C epsilon 1 (PLCE1) gene, where the G allele carrier status was associated with lower system segregation. This SNP has also been linked to higher body fat percentage and higher blood pressure.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs138004790 SNP was noted as being likely regulatory and was linked to the INPP5A gene, contributing to the understanding of system segregation through calcium signaling.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs9645539 SNP, also related to the INPP5A gene, was classified as likely regulatory with a role in system segregation regulation.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs2274224 SNP, related to the PLCE1 gene, was significant as a top hit in the gene-based analysis and was associated with lower system segregation.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs11596664 SNP was indicated as a linked LD proxy of rs9645539 connected to frontal cortex connectivity.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: This SNP was part of the four novel anxiety loci identified in the meta-analysis but no specific functional details were mentioned regarding its location within the PLEKHA1 gene.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: This SNP was identified as exonic within its associated novel anxiety locus, with no further details on its potential implications.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs2015583 was discovered as a novel leprosy susceptibility locus at 10q24.32, showing a combined p-value of 8.81 × 10-9 with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.51, indicating that this variant was protective against leprosy. The finding suggested the locus was associated with reduced ACTR1A expression in CD4+ T cells, and displayed pleiotropic effects with known risk loci for inflammatory bowel disease and atopic diseases.
title: ACTR1A has pleiotropic effects on risk of leprosy, inflammatory bowel disease and atopy

finding: The SNP rs780668, a missense variant in SLC29A3, demonstrated statistical significance with a p-value of 0.034 and an odds ratio of 1.28 (95% CI 1.02 - 1.60) in relation to leprosy susceptibility.
title: ACTR1A has pleiotropic effects on risk of leprosy, inflammatory bowel disease and atopy

finding: The SNP rs137998089 was identified in the LRMDA gene on chromosome 10 specifically within the female-specific GWAS, achieving a significant p-value of 4.04 x 10^-8, indicating its association with widespread pain in females.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Widespread Pain in the UK Biobank (N=172,230)

finding: This intronic variant in ENO4 was associated with male infertility, showing an odds ratio of 0.388, and knockout mice demonstrated infertility and abnormal sperm characteristics.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs61872084 decreased NKX2-5 DNA binding when the alternate allele was expressed. It was associated with differential expression of the gene METTL10 in cardiac tissue, which has been connected to kidney dysfunction and CVD in certain populations.
title: Prioritizing Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Variants Altering NKX2-5 Binding through an Integrative Computational Approach

finding: Ranked highly in the IBI analysis, this SNP was found to be influential in explaining hypertension, supporting its relevance in the study's context.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: Identified in the MALRD1 loci, it was deemed significant in the IBI model, highlighting its importance in the context of hypertension.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs603424 near the SCD gene was associated with 24 different lipid species/classes, highlighting its role in lipid metabolism. The evidence for its involvement with CAD was also strong, suggesting its potential significance in cardiovascular health (0.936<H3+H4<0.998; 16<H4/H3<1.8×10^3).
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of the human lipidome identifies novel loci controlling lipid homeostasis with links to coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs10553596 in the CASP7 gene was found to potentially facilitate resilience against late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) specifically in APOE-ε4 carriers. This finding related to the ability of certain genetic variants to moderate the effects of known risk factors for the disease.
title: Polygenic resilience scores capture protective genetic effects for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs11511253 was associated with the expression of ZNF25 and ZNF33A, along with several pseudogenes and long non-coding RNAs in lipoedema-relevant tissues. The meta-analysis suggested its significant association with lipoedema, with a P-value of 4.07 x 10^-5.
title: Investigation of clinical characteristics and genome associations in the ‘UK Lipoedema’ cohort

finding: The SNP rs10993994 in the MSMB gene was identified as a genome-wide top-most predictive gene distinguishing benign regions from high-grade cancer regions. It was found that MSMB expression was five-fold lower in high-grade cancer regions compared to benign regions. An inverse association was confirmed between MSMB and prostate cancer overall, with an Odds Ratio (OR) of 0.81, indicating that higher MSMB levels were correlated with decreased risk of prostate cancer including aggressive and early onset disease.
title: Identifying proteomic risk factors for overall, aggressive and early onset prostate cancer using Mendelian randomization and tumor spatial transcriptomics

finding: The rs2506030 SNP was identified as a predisposing haplotype associated with an increased risk of Hirschsprung disease (HSCR). This variant particularly elevated disease risk when present in homozygous combinations, thereby confirming its significant role in the genetic predisposition to HSCR.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: The SNP rs7069590 was confirmed to be part of a predisposing haplotype that substantially increased the risk of Hirschsprung disease (HSCR), particularly in homozygous individuals. This finding underscored its importance in influencing HSCR penetrance.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: The rs2435357 SNP's involvement as a predisposing haplotype significantly contributed to the risk of Hirschsprung disease (HSCR), especially in homozygous combinations, affirming its role in the genetic landscape of HSCR.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: The missense variant rs189569984 in RBM20 demonstrated significant associations with CMR traits, including left and right ventricular end-systolic volumes (LVESV and RVESV). The effect sizes were -3.77 mL (P = 9.1 × 10^-16) and -3.37 mL (P = 2.1 × 10^-11), respectively, reinforcing RBM20's relevance in cardiovascular disease mechanisms.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The C allele at the TCF7L2 locus demonstrated a significant increase in allele frequency, from 0.013 in Chinese populations to 0.488 in African populations. This marked variation was associated with a correspondingly higher predicted risk of type 2 diabetes in the African populations compared to East Asian populations, indicating a clear genetic contribution to the disease risk disparities observed among these populations.
title: Polygenic adaptation is not a major driver of disparities in disease mortality across global populations

finding: This SNP was associated with asthma through a meta-analysis across a large cohort, suggesting a link between asthma and the autosomal recessive nephrotic syndrome gene PLCE1. Its association with lower blood pressure in previous studies further supports its relevance in atopic disorders like asthma.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: The SNP chr10:11678309:A:C related to the gene ECHDC3 was identified as a damaging variant that completely co-segregated with common variants within EFIGA families, indicating its potential significance in the research of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP on chromosome 10 at locus 10p12.31 was associated with connectivity between the precuneus regions, showing a z-score of -5.58, and provided new insight into neural connections.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs1555839, previously associated with rapid automatized naming, yielded a significant signal in the analysis related to spelling (p=3.33 × 10^-4) in the GenLang cohorts, making it a notable finding in this context.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of individual differences in quantitatively assessed reading- and language-related skills in up to 34,000 people

finding: Identified as newly FDR significant among the 12 SNPs that were shown to have high GenoCanyon scores supporting their functionality.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The rs2789313 SNP, located in the MALRD1 gene on chromosome 10, was identified as a genome-wide significant variant associated with early age at onset major depression compared to controls, showing a Z-score of 5.56 and a P-value of 2.74 x 10^-8. This gene, which had not been previously linked to depression, is involved in hepatic bile acid metabolism and lipid homeostasis, indicating a potential genetic connection between early onset major depression and metabolic processes.
title: Genetic comorbidity between major depression and cardio-metabolic disease, stratified by age at onset of major depression

finding: The SNP rs1799853 was identified as the causative exonic missense SNV for the CYP2C9*2 haplotype. It displayed allele frequencies of 8-15% in European and admixed American populations, suggesting its significant impact on drug metabolism in those groups.
title: Archaic introgression and variation in pharmacogenes and implications for local adaptation

finding: The SNP rs41291556 was identified as the causative exonic missense SNV for the CYP2C19*8 allele, with a frequency of 1.5% in Central Europeans and 0.5% in Telugu populations.
title: Archaic introgression and variation in pharmacogenes and implications for local adaptation

finding: The rs12777823 SNP in CYP2C9 was associated with decreased warfarin dose requirement specifically in African Americans (AAs). This finding highlighted the importance of including minority populations in genomics studies for understanding drug metabolism and tailoring personalized medicine.
title: Uncovering the role of admixture in disease and drug response: Association of hepatocyte gene expression and DNA methylation with African Ancestry in African Americans

finding: The rs7085104 SNP located at the 10q24.32 locus was associated with altered expression of the AS3MT gene, which had been previously implicated in schizophrenia (SCZ). This finding represented an original discovery in the context of its function within the disorder.
title: Decoding the multimorbidities among psychiatric disorders and cognitive functioning

finding: Associated with TAA, this SNP in CTNNA3 showed a significant p-value of 1.82x10^-8 and an OR of 4.268, suggesting a strong effect on TAA prevalence.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: Moonen et al. (2019) investigated this SNP's association with pulmonary neuroendocrine tumors, suggesting its potential diagnostic value and the possibility of molecular interactions that could impact disease progression.
title: Druggable Growth Dependencies and Tumor Evolution Analysis in Patient-Derived Organoids of Neuroendocrine Cancer

finding: The SNP rs145580445 in the UPF2 gene was significantly associated with type 2 diabetes risk based on genome-wide association studies (GWAS). Investigations into UPF2's role revealed that knocking down this gene in EndoC-βH3 cells significantly reduced NMD activity in both untreated and cytokines-treated cells. Importantly, UPF2 knockdown prevented cytokine-induced cell death and increased insulin content, although it had no effect on glucose-stimulated insulin secretion.
title: Proinflammatory Cytokines Suppress Nonsense-Mediated RNA Decay to Impair Regulated Transcript Isoform Processing in Pancreatic β-Cells

finding: Similarly, rs12762089 presented a P value of 7.0 x 10-9, reinforcing its association with neurobiological traits connected to schizophrenia as deduced from the multivariate genomic associations.
title: Linking the genetic structure of neuroanatomical phenotypes with psychiatric disorders

finding: Variant rs1902660 was analyzed as an eQTL and was associated with higher expression of TSPAN14, which was putatively causal for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD). This finding helped identify genetic variations that influence gene expression levels relevant to the etiology of this neurodegenerative condition.
title: EMO: Predicting Non-coding Mutation-induced Up- and Down-regulation of Risk Gene Expression using Deep Learning

finding: The eQTL rs11191419 controlled expression of the gene AS3MT in both fetal and adult cortex, demonstrating its critical role in ASD mechanisms.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: Similar to rs11191419, rs7085104 was linked to the regulation of AS3MT across cortical tissues, underscoring its significance in ASD pathology.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: The SCZ-associated GWAS SNP rs11191557 was shown to connect to the promoter of INA, which is highly expressed in neurons. This connection established INA as a potential novel target gene for this SNP and relates to its identification as an eQTL.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: Similar to rs11191557, rs11191558 was associated with enhancer-promoter interactions connecting SCZ-associated loci to the promoter of INA, further supporting INA as a potential target gene.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: The interaction with the promoter of INA was also confirmed for SNP rs11191559, thereby reinforcing its association as a potential target gene related to SCZ.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: SNP rs10883832 was part of multiple enhancer-promoter interactions connecting SCZ loci to INA, solidifying the gene’s status as a potential target.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: Lastly, rs12413046 was also associated with enhancer-promoter connections to INA, which further established this gene as a significant target concerning SCZ-associated genetic variants.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: The SNP rs649339, associated with SYT17, was marked as significantly enriched and expressed in dopaminergic neurons, indicating its possible functional role in Parkinson's disease pathology.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: This SNP was linked to multiple sclerosis and was included within GC-specific chromatin, highlighting its relevance in immune regulation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Detected within B cell specific-accessible chromatin, this SNP was associated with multiple sclerosis, emphasizing its effect on transcriptional regulation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Linked with multiple sclerosis, this SNP was noted for its regulatory potential through interactions within chromatin related to immune responses.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Investigations again highlighted rs2981579, associated with FGFR2 gene variants, as a notable SNP contributing to breast cancer susceptibility.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The FGFR2 gene variant rs2981427 was highlighted as a new significant finding related to breast cancer risk.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Historically associated with breast cancer risk, rs1219648 was reaffirmed through multiple studies as a significant SNP in FGFR2.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Associated with several autoimmune disorders, rs61839660 indicated a broader impact beyond T1D, linking it to multiple candidate genes affecting Treg functioning.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This SNP was identified in interactions involving T1D and other autoimmune diseases, reflecting its relevance in immune regulation.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: Similar to rs12722496, this SNP was part of the regulatory network that connects T1D to other autoimmune diseases.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This variant was noted for its possible regulatory impact in Tregs, linking it to T1D susceptibility.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: ANXA11 rs1049550 was related to chemotherapy sensitivity in patients treated with bevacizumab, detailing its role as a pharmacogenomic marker.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs10886471 was identified as being associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) susceptibility within the Chinese population. Specifically, the T allele of this SNP displayed a higher frequency in individuals with T2D compared to healthy subjects. Those carrying the TT genotype exhibited resistance to treatment with the insulin secretagogue repaglinide, indicating they had lower reductions in fasting plasma glucose and reduced postprandial serum insulin levels compared to those with CC and CT genotypes. This finding demonstrated that GRK5, which the SNP influences, plays a critical role in regulating beta cell mass and/or function, a relationship that was supported by previous findings in mouse models.
title: Type 2 diabetes susceptibility gene GRK5 regulates physiological pancreatic β-cell proliferation via phosphorylation of HDAC5 in mice

finding: The SNP rs2388595 in the PFKP gene demonstrated a strong positive association with lactate levels and a negative association with hypoxanthine levels in RBCs. This SNP was related to improved glycolytic fluxes and lower levels of hemolysis, and the findings were consistent across different donor ancestries, indicating its critical role in glycolysis in stored RBCs.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs11101587 was linked to histone deacetylase expressions in hepatocellular carcinoma cells. A study demonstrated that HDAC inhibitors had functional effects on liver cancer cells, suggesting a potential relationship between this SNP and acetylation processes involved in cancer pathology.
title: Exogenous and endogenous HDAC inhibitor effects in Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome models

finding: For the rs41290536 variant, it was reported that its alteration of a PAS motif could lead to a shortened 3' UTR for the BLOC1S2 gene, and it was in complete LD with variants linked to squamous cell lung carcinoma predisposition.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The study correlated SNP rs11101618 with the mitogen activated protein kinase (MAPK) pathway, highlighting its role in mediating hearing loss due to cisplatin and noise exposure. The inhibition of MAPK components, as indicated by this SNP, was associated with protective effects against hearing loss in mouse models, marking it as a significant finding in understanding genetic contributions to hearing loss phenotypes.
title: FDA-Approved MEK1/2 Inhibitor, Trametinib, Protects Mice from Cisplatin and Noise-Induced Hearing Loss

finding: The SNP rs7080018 was found to be associated with four resting-state networks (RSNs) mainly covering prefrontal regions. This association was reported in the GWAS conducted by Elliott et al., 2018, indicating its relevance to cognitive performance in relation to BOLD amplitude.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: Similar to rs7080018, the SNP rs11596664 was associated with four RSNs primarily focused on prefrontal regions, as stated in the findings of the GWAS by Elliott et al., 2018. This highlighted its contribution to the genetic basis of brain function.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: The SNP rs67221163 was also discovered to be linked with four RSNs encompassing prefrontal regions. Its association was part of the same GWAS conducted by Elliott et al., 2018, further strengthening the understanding of genetic influences on brain activity.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: The SNP rs11101440 was linked to endometrial cancer risk through promoter-associated chromatin interactions. This finding was derived from evolutionary studies that highlighted its relevance to maternal-fetal communication and pregnancy-related pathologies, underlining the importance of such genetic variations in the context of adverse pregnancy outcomes.
title: Evolutionary transcriptomics implicates new genes and pathways in human pregnancy and adverse pregnancy outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1335540 was identified as a key variant affecting the expression of the APBB1IP gene, which was shown to interact with the transcription factor IKZF1. This interaction was observed across three tissues, namely the pituitary gland, thyroid, and tibial artery. rs1335540 is located 15 bases upstream of the APBB1IP transcription start site and was highly correlated with top TF-eQTL and GWAS variants (r^2 > 0.85). The regulation by IKZF1 suggests that rs1335540 could influence blood cell traits, as the APBB1IP eQTLs showed colocalization with GWAS signals for red and white blood cell traits, highlighting its role in immune response and blood cell adhesion.
title: Transcription factor regulation of eQTL activity across individuals and tissues

finding: This SNP was investigated for its functional polymorphism effects regarding colorectal cancer risk, indicating a potential association with increased susceptibility.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs1531550 was indicated in a GWAS for elite sprinter status, suggesting a potential role in athletic performance and possibly in related metabolic pathways.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: rs11257655 was linked to type 2 diabetes and reported to reside in the regulatory region of CDC123. This SNP exhibited ASB for FOXA1 (alternative allele preference), ESR1 (reference allele preference), and three other transcription factors. FOXA1 is involved in liver and pancreas development, as well as glucose homeostasis, while polymorphisms in ESR1 are associated with type 2 diabetes and fasting plasma glucose.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: Similar to rs6670984, corrections regarding strand orientation were made in the published genotypes for this SNP, which also confirmed a positive finding in the assessments.
title: The FORCE panel: An all-in-one SNP marker set for confirming investigative genetic genealogy leads and for general forensic applications

finding: The SNP rs11101533 was related to findings that showed 17beta-estradiol activating heat shock factor 1 via MAPK signaling in estrogen receptor alpha-positive breast cancer cells, highlighting its importance in hormonal signaling pathways in breast cancer.
