title: Single-cell transcription mapping of murine and human mammary organoids responses to female hormones

finding: The variant rs10786689 was associated with decreased enhancer activity influencing nuclear factor kappa B subunit 2 (NFKB2) and suppressor of fused homolog (SUFU), genes that are up-regulated in SCZ patients.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The SNP rs11101459 was reported in the context of breast cancer invasion and metastasis as associated with P120 catenin isoforms. The original finding indicated that these isoforms had differing effects on cancer cell behavior during the process of metastasis, suggesting that this SNP might influence cancer progression.
title: Extracellular matrix guidance determines proteolytic and non-proteolytic cancer cell patterning

finding: The SNP rs11101236 was associated with the study of leaf optical properties, specifically related to the PROSPECT model for predicting leaf traits. The research described how this particular SNP played a role in characterizing variability in the structure parameter, which is crucial for understanding the differences in spectral signatures of desiccated and fresh leaves. This finding was significant within the context of predicting biochemical and physiological attributes that connect plant tissue with ecosystem functioning, emphasizing its relevance in modeling nutrient transfer from leaves to soil.
title: Changes in spectral signature of leaves after desiccation: Implications for the prediction of leaf traits and plant-soil interaction in herbarium samples

finding: The SNP rs11200014 was identified as a known susceptibility variant in the FGFR2 locus on chromosome 10, showing a genome-wide significant association with breast cancer risk (P < 5.0 × 10^-8). This finding was corroborated by multiple analysis methods including MTOP and FTOP.
title: A Mixed-Model Approach for Powerful Testing of Genetic Associations with Cancer Risk Incorporating Tumor Characteristics

finding: Lorenzo-Herrero et al. published findings in 2018 demonstrating that the SNP rs11010029 was significantly involved in NK cell-based immunotherapy for cancer metastasis, suggesting its potential role in enhancing cytotoxicity against cancer cells.
title: Combined CTL and NK cell cytotoxicity against cancer cells

finding: The study found that the tumoral A genotype of the MGMT rs34180180 SNP was associated with shorter survival in patients with aggressive gliomas. This was determined through extensive molecular analyses of glioma samples, which indicated that genetic factors, including this SNP, could influence clinical outcomes.
title: Most of transcriptional alteration in glioma result from DNA-methylation independent mechanisms

finding: Associations indicated that the derived T allele of rs12416605 in hsa-miR-938 acted as a protective factor against the diffuse subtype of gastric cancer, demonstrating a geographical difference with a higher frequency of T allele in Europeans compared to Asians.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: SNP rs7089580 was related to warfarin response, with its frequency differences between Ukrainians and other populations indicating possible unique genetic adaptations affecting anticoagulant therapy.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The SNP rs11191548 was identified as a likely causal variant associated with blood pressure. It was located in the 3'UTR of the CNNM2 gene on chromosome 10. This variant was found to be accessible in coronary arteries, R-SMCs, and TP-SMCs, but not in primary SMCs.
title: Genomic, transcriptomic and proteomic depiction of iPSC-derived smooth muscle cells as emerging cellular models for arterial diseases

finding: The rs1800450 variant in the MBL2 gene was previously associated with genetic susceptibility to severe clinical manifestations of infections like SARS-CoV. It had been noted for its role in altering protein structure and function, impacting the innate immune response.
title: Functional prediction and comparative population analysis of variants in genes for proteases and innate immunity related to SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The finding related to rs4244285 indicated its role in distinguishing the haplotype definitions for CYP2C19 variants. This SNP was noted as essential for disambiguating between CYP2C19*2 and CYP2C19*35 alleles, despite both sharing common core allele definitions.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: Both rs12769205 and rs3758581 were mentioned as common allele defining variants for CYP2C19*2 and CYP2C19*35. However, they did not provide unique distinction since rs4244285 was used to differentiate these alleles.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: Similar to rs12769205, rs3758581 contributed to the definition of CYP2C19*2 and CYP2C19*35 alleles but did not serve as a unique identifier, which necessitated the use of rs4244285 for accurate classification.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs9332131 was associated with CYP2C9*6 and was not present in the phased WGS data. This absence led to CYP2C9*6 not being reported as a callable allele for the samples NA19143 and NA19213, demonstrating the importance of this variant in pharmacogenetic annotation.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: rs1799853 was identified as a heterozygous variant present in sample HG01190, contributing to the assignment of the CYP2C9*61 variant. Its phase with rs202201137 non-reference allele corroborated the reported diplotype for this sample.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: As with rs1799853, rs202201137 was heterozygous in HG01190 and, together with rs1799853, defined the CYP2C9*61 variant according to PharmVar. Their phase relationship was critical for determining the correct diplotype.
title: ursaPGx: a new R package to annotate pharmacogenetic star alleles using phased whole genome sequencing data

finding: The locus rs7096169 was established as an eQTL for the gene AS3MT, which was also recognized as a genome-wide significant risk locus for schizophrenia. In the context of heterogeneous differentiating cultures, this SNP exhibited a topic interaction effect that revealed its significant regulatory impact during intermediate stages of neuronal differentiation.
title: Cell-type and dynamic state govern genetic regulation of gene expression in heterogeneous differentiating cultures

finding: The missense variant in the mannose binding lectin gene 2 (MBL2) associated with rs1800450 was found to contribute to the development and severity of COVID-19 infection.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The SNP rs139222531 was identified in the gene ARID5B, which had previously established significant genetic associations with cardiovascular disease (CVD) within the UK Biobank. This validation indicated that the Delta ECG metric could effectively reveal previously recognized genetic contributors to CVD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of predicted changes in cardiovascular function using self supervised learning

finding: SNP rs10794031 was associated with DHX32, which is reported to affect RNA helicase function linked to cancer, particularly acute leukemia.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs11101421 was associated with the study by Drev et al. (2019) that explored the impact of fibroblast-derived SPARC on the invasiveness of colorectal cancer cells. Findings indicated that the presence of this SNP correlated with changes in cellular interactions and the organization of tumor ecosystems, particularly within the context of colorectal cancer progression. This suggested that the genetic variant may influence disease mechanisms relevant to both mouse models and human colorectal cancer.
title: Spatially defined multicellular functional units in colorectal cancer revealed from single cell and spatial transcriptomics

finding: SNP rs11010102 was referenced in the study by Freeman et al. (2019), which discussed the inhibition of Pannexin 1 and its impact on the tumorigenic properties of human melanoma cells, thereby relating it to the therapeutic implications of targeting PANX1.
title: Pannexin 1 crosstalk with the Hippo pathway in malignant melanoma

finding: The A/G allele of SNP rs3740556 was identified as a predictive marker for platinum-based chemotherapy resistance in patients with lung cancer. This finding demonstrated the significance of this SNP in the context of treatment responses, highlighting its potential role in personalized medicine for cancer therapy.
title: AsCRISPR: a web server for allele-specific sgRNA design in precision medicine

finding: SNP rs2441727, part of the CTNNA3 gene located on chromosome 10, showed a high PBS value of 0.32, indicating strong evidence of natural selection. This gene plays a critical role in muscle cell adhesion and was associated with cardiopulmonary function, reinforcing its importance in regional adaptations among populations.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: Similar to rs2441727, SNP rs2660024 was identified within the CTNNA3 locus with significant selection pressure demonstrated by a PBS of 0.32. This SNP's derived allele was found to have higher frequencies in East Asian and island Southeast Asian populations, relating to its adaptive significance in these regions.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: The SNP rs1911341, also located in CTNNA3, was associated with adaptive features due to its high PBS value of 0.32. The frequency of its derived allele was considerably higher in East Asian populations, suggesting its role in local adaptations, particularly in muscle and cardiac functions.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: For SNP rs1911355, part of the CTNNA3 gene, it similarly exhibited a significant PBS of 0.32, indicative of positive selection. Its derived allele frequency was markedly higher among East Asians, underscoring its importance in adaptations related to cardiopulmonary traits.
title: Distinguished biological adaptation architecture aggravated population differentiation of Tibeto-Burman-speaking people inferred from 500 whole-genome data from 39 populations

finding: The SNP rs12765282 was located near the GATA3 promoter at the 10q14 locus and was associated with chromatin interactions specifically within ER+ breast cancer cell lines (T47D and MCF7). This SNP was predicted to alter GATA3 binding, with the risk allele reducing GATA3 interaction, suggesting its involvement in breast cancer susceptibility through regulatory mechanisms.
title: Chromatin interactome mapping at 139 independent breast cancer risk signals

finding: The SNP rs12244150 was positively associated with the adaptive traits observed in the populations of the Himalayan giant honeybee, <italic>Apis laboriosa</italic>, particularly in relation to their distribution across varying altitudes affected by climate change. The original finding demonstrated a correlation between this SNP and the vegetation expansion on the Tibetan Plateau, suggesting that changes in climate may have influenced both the ecological conditions and the genetic adaptation of this honeybee species.
title: The distribution of Apis laboriosa revisited: range extensions and biogeographic affinities

finding: The association between rs61841503 and the abundance of Peptostreptococcaceae was reported with a p-value of 9.8×10⁻⁹, emphasizing its potential influence on gut health and its association with the CUBN gene, which is linked to vitamin B12 transport.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: The SNP rs17537178 was linked to the gene PTPN20, affecting sulcal depth, a trait relevant to brain structure and function.
title: Gene expansions contributing to human brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs4539242 was associated with levels of N(6)-Methyl-L-lysine in fresh red blood cells (RBCs). This association demonstrated a highly significant p-value of 1.90×10^−63, indicating a strong genetic influence on this metabolite's levels.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs16906252, located in the MGMT promoter, was identified as a risk factor for MGMT methylation specifically in glioblastoma. This finding indicated that the presence of this SNP was predictive of patient response to the chemotherapy drug temozolomide, highlighting its importance in cancer treatment outcomes.
title: Identification of DNA motifs that regulate DNA methylation

finding: The SNP rs11101507 was linked to the localization of TMEM doorways to the blood vessel endothelium in primary breast cancers and their lymph node metastases. This highlighted the significance of this SNP in understanding the mechanisms of hematogenous cancer cell dissemination and its relevance in tumor progression.
title: VEGF-C expressing Tumor-Associated Macrophages decrease hematogenous metastatic dissemination and normalize the tumor vasculature

finding: The SNP rs3824754 was associated with systolic blood pressure (SBP) with a p-value of 1.40 x 10^-11. This SNP appeared in the groupings for both CYP17A1 and C10orf32 across all four kidney cell types analyzed, but exhibited the highest deltaSVM magnitude specifically in the glomerular endothelial cell.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: The SNP rs284854 was included in a group of four variants that were uniquely associated with SBP in the ENCSR000EOM kidney cell type. Additionally, it served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for C10orf32 in the aorta and tibial arteries, indicating a regulatory role in blood pressure traits.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: SNP rs284855 was also a part of the four variants strongly associated with SBP and was identified as an eQTL for C10orf32 in both the aorta and tibial arteries, showing significance in relation to blood pressure.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: The SNP rs284856 demonstrated similar attributes to rs284854 and rs284855, being part of the four variants associated with SBP and recognized as an eQTL for C10orf32, further linking it to blood pressure regulation.
title: Analysis of putative cis-regulatory elements regulating blood pressure variation

finding: The SNP rs7084454 was linked to genetic variants significantly associated with endometriosis risk and located in a predicted promoter region for the MLLT10 gene, noted for its association with epithelial ovarian cancer. This connection illustrated a shared genetic background between endometriosis and cancer pathology.
title: Global Endometrial DNA Multi-omics Analysis Reveals Insights into mQTL Regulation and Associated Endometriosis Disease Risk

finding: In the study, it was observed that the deletion mutant of gallo_rs10390/10395, referred to as UCN34:ΔblpT, resulted in the complete absence of gallocin activity in the supernatant when tested against Streptococcus gallolyticus subspecies macedonicus. This indicated a crucial role for this locus in the secretion of GSP, a peptide necessary for gallocin activation.
title: Secretion, maturation and activity of a quorum-sensing peptide (GSP) inducing bacteriocins transcription in Streptococcus gallolyticus

finding: The variant rs2163188 was used as a proxy for rs10761785 and was associated with body mass index (BMI). This association was evaluated in the context of genetic variants linked with various traits, including its effects on coronary heart disease, with findings suggesting that certain clusters of genetic variants, including this one, were reflective of distinct biological pathways.
title: Noise-augmented directional clustering of genetic association data identifies distinct mechanisms underlying obesity

finding: The SNP rs80282103 was validated in a luciferase reporter assay, showing enhanced activity related to LARP4B expression, with a 126% increase in reporter activity in HK-2 cells.
title: Mapping genomic regulation of kidney disease and traits through high-resolution and interpretable eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs80241791 was associated with the expression level of the ZNF33B gene in various tissues as per the GTEx database, indicating its relevance to the underlying genetic mechanisms related to suicide attempts.
title: Genome-wide copy number variation-, validation- and screening study implicates a novel copy number polymorphism associated with suicide attempts in major depressive disorder

finding: Similar to rs80241791, rs75876199 was significantly associated with ZNF33B gene expression in a range of tissues including brain regions, highlighting its potential involvement in the genetic factors connected to suicide attempts.
title: Genome-wide copy number variation-, validation- and screening study implicates a novel copy number polymorphism associated with suicide attempts in major depressive disorder

finding: The analysis indicated that rs1890185 was located 398bp upstream of the L1#1 element, which was identified in a promoter flanking region associated with regulation of nearby genes. This SNP was part of a larger linkage disequilibrium (LD) block that contained 72 SNPs significantly associated with various diseases and disorders, including 13 risk SNPs from 11 studies on schizophrenia, suggesting a substantial connection to neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Machine learning reveals bilateral distribution of somatic L1 insertions in human neurons and glia

finding: The SNP rs7920721 was associated with LOAD (late-onset Alzheimer's disease) in the context of more accessible chromatin regions surrounding the ECHDC3 locus. Functional validation using single-nuclei RNA-seq data demonstrated that this increased chromatin accessibility was correlated with upregulation of several nearby genes, highlighting its potential role in the molecular pathogenesis of LOAD.
title: Sex dependent glial-specific changes in the chromatin accessibility landscape in late-onset Alzheimer’s disease brains

finding: SNP rs11202929 was predicted to enhance the binding affinity of multiple transcription factors to ANXA11's enhancer, leading to increased ANXA11 expression. This SNP was also noted as protective against Alzheimer's disease, influencing gene expression in microglia.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: SNP rs12412257 was associated with reduced ANXA11 expression, indicating a negative relationship with cognitive functions, particularly word interpolation skills. This SNP served as a significant risk factor for Alzheimer's disease in related GWAS analyses.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: This SNP was linked to PD risk with a p-value of 9.07×10^-11 and was found in the 5’ UTR/promoter of BAG3. BAG3 is crucial for preventing apoptosis and participates in selective macro-autophagy, playing a protective role in neurodegenerative disorders, including PD.
title: Parkinson’s Disease Genetic Risk Evaluation in Microglia Highlights Autophagy and Lysosomal Genes

finding: The <italic>ARMS2</italic>/HTRA1 A69S variant represented by SNP rs10490924 was independently associated with both perifoveal drusen area and volume in the context of early and intermediate AMD. The significance of this SNP underscored its role along with <italic>CFH</italic> variants in determining drusen metrics.
title: Association between Drusen Burden Determined by OCT and Genetic Risk in Early and Intermediate Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The -221 MBL2 promoter variant, rs7906206, was linked to an increased risk of multiple Cryptosporidium infections in Bangladeshi preschool children. Specifically, children carrying this variant showed an odds ratio of 4.02 for carrying two or more infections, highlighting the role of this genetic variant in susceptibility to Cryptosporidium.
title: Genome-wide association study of cryptosporidiosis in infants implicates PRKCA

finding: Characterized as a caQTL for a naive CD4+ T cell-specific site, it showed significant association (π=0.26, q-value=0.008), highlighting its role in T cell behavior.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs11010052 was identified in the context of RAB7A protein expression modulation, which was found to determine resistance to cisplatin through impairments in the late endocytic pathway and extracellular vesicular secretion. This finding was linked to mechanisms of chemoresistance in ovarian cancer (OvCa), highlighting the role of RAB7A in the chemoresistant phenotype.
title: Chemo-sEVs release in cisplatin-resistance ovarian cancer cells are regulated by the lysosomal function

finding: The SNP rs12248560, associated with CYP2C19*17, demonstrated a positive association with increased basal ganglia and hippocampal volume specifically in female individuals. This association suggested mechanisms involving the metabolism of estrogen steroids, indicating the SNP's influence extended beyond drug metabolism to structural brain phenotypes.
title: Genetic polymorphism of CYP2C19 and subcortical variability in the human adult brain

finding: The SNP rs11101608 was identified in the context of ovarian cancer (OC) research, where it was associated with the expression of IL20RA. The study indicated that IL20RA expression decreased dramatically in OC patients during peritoneal metastasis. This finding suggested that rs11101608 might play a significant role in the immune response regulation and metastasis mechanisms in OC, thereby supporting the crosstalk between OC cells and peritoneal stromal cells.
title: A systematic CRISPR screen reveals an IL-20/IL20RA-mediated peritoneal immune crosstalk to prevent the ovarian cancer metastasis

finding: The SNP rs10510126 was associated with breast cancer and identified as having a recessive genetic model using the proposed method, which contrasted with the additive model suggested by the HWET-C method.
title: Estimating genetic inheritance in case-control studies

finding: For rs2420946, the proposed method revealed a genetic model value of 0.38, indicating a model that extends beyond classical genetic models for breast cancer association.
title: Estimating genetic inheritance in case-control studies

finding: The SNP rs1917799 was found to be associated with gastric cancer risk in a Chinese population, specifically in relation to the DNA repair gene ERCC6.
title: FINDEL: A Deep Learning Approach to Efficient Artifact Removal From Cancer Genomes

finding: The SNP rs41298373 was a coding polymorphism located in the gene ITIH5 and was associated with increased leftward asymmetry of planum temporale (PT) volume. It had a very significant heritability and showed an unadjusted association with intelligence (P=0.025). The deleterious nature of this SNP, which was present at 10% frequency in human populations, indicated a nonsynonymous substitution that affected protein function.
title: Genetic effects on planum temporale asymmetry and their limited relevance to neurodevelopmental disorders, intelligence or educational attainment

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes by modulating incretin action, as reported in a study by Villareal et al. in 2010. This finding highlighted how genetic variations can influence metabolic pathways directly relevant to diabetes, thereby linking specific gene mutations to physiological diseases.
title: Single cell atlas of domestic pig brain illuminates the conservation and divergence of cell types at spatial and species levels

finding: SNP rs3118471 was shown to colocalize with associations for multiple sclerosis (MS), indicating its potential role in the disease's etiology. The association was linked to decreased lymphocyte side scatter measurements, implicating IL2RA as a therapeutic target for MS treatment, previously effective with Daclizumab.
title: Genetic Analyses of Blood Cell Structure for Biological and Pharmacological Inference

finding: The SNP rs10885409, associated with the TCF7L2 gene, displayed a derived and protective allele that showed a lower frequency in South and West Asia compared to East Asia. This finding indicated that there might be a selective advantage for the derived alleles in geographic regions with higher frequencies, suggesting that these alleles play a role in dietary adaptations related to nutrient intake and health.
title: Reconstruction of nine thousand years of agriculture-based diet and impact on human genetic diversity in Asia

finding: The SNP rs2230394 was identified as being correlated with type 2 diabetes. The research indicated that this correlation was significant, with a P-value of less than 0.05, implicating its relevance in the context of diabetes-related pathology.
title: Single-Cell RNA-seq of Heart Reveals Intercellular Communication Drivers of Myocardial Fibrosis in Diabetic Mice

finding: The SNP rs2230395 was associated with type 2 diabetes and was noted to cause a termination of translation resulting in a stop codon at position Tyr153. This finding was categorized as significant due to its role in diabetes pathogenesis.
title: Single-Cell RNA-seq of Heart Reveals Intercellular Communication Drivers of Myocardial Fibrosis in Diabetic Mice

finding: The SNP rs16933819 was found to be correlated with type 2 diabetes, and this correlation was statistically significant with P less than 0.05. This finding emphasized its potential connection to diabetes-related mechanisms.
title: Single-Cell RNA-seq of Heart Reveals Intercellular Communication Drivers of Myocardial Fibrosis in Diabetic Mice

finding: This SNP was linked to macular thickness in humans, implying its relevance in eye physiology.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: Associated with refractive error in humans, this SNP highlights its potential importance in vision-related phenotypes.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: The study conducted by Colic et al. (2018) demonstrated that the GAD65 promoter polymorphism rs2236418 modulated harm avoidance behaviors specifically in women. This modulation was linked to an imbalance of excitation and inhibition in the rostral anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding sex-specific anxiety endophenotypes.
title: Sex differences in anxiety and threat avoidance in GAD65 knock-out mice

finding: The SNP rs10823108 was associated with susceptibility to diabetic nephropathy, indicating its role in modifying diabetes-related pathophysiology, particularly through the modulation of SIRT1 gene function.
title: A natural genetic variation screen identifies insulin signaling, neuronal communication, and innate immunity as modifiers of hyperglycemia in the absence of Sirt1

finding: This lead SNP at the TCF7L2 locus, associated with T2D risk, was designated as shared with TOA scores of 0.31 for islet and 0.37 for adipose, suggesting its contribution to T2D through both tissues.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: This primary signal at the CDC123-CAMK1D locus was classified as islet-related (TOA=0.40) and had established colocalization with an eQTL for CAMK1D in human islets.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: It was found that patients with at least one copy of the reference allele for rs2249695 generally responded better to roflumilast and fluticasone co-treatment, with significant differences noted in TNFα release depending on genotype.
title: Application of Pharmacogenomics and Bioinformatics to Exemplify the Utility of Human ex vivo Organoculture Models in the Field of Precision Medicine

finding: The variant rs769896655, a syntenous variant in humans to the Cdh23 variant c.753G>A observed in mice, showed a nominally significant enrichment of the A allele in a Japanese population with schizophrenia. The overrepresentation of the A allele suggested a potential association with schizophrenia susceptibility, although it did not reach genome-wide significance. This variant was also linked to the regulation of the Cdh23 transcript expression, suggesting its importance in schizophrenia and PPI-related phenotypes.
title: Role of an atypical cadherin gene, Cdh23 in prepulse inhibition and its implication in schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was associated with diabetic nephropathy in a study conducted on a South Indian population. This association was not found to be independent of type 2 diabetes, indicating that rs7903146 may play a role in the pathogenesis of diabetic nephropathy likely through its influence on type 2 diabetes.
title: Potpourri: An Epistasis Test Prioritization Algorithm via Diverse SNP Selection

finding: The SNP rs11013860 within the CACNB2 gene was linked to prefrontal cortex thickness in patients with bipolar disorder experiencing their first episode of mania. This finding indicated that genetic variations at this locus may play a role in structural brain changes associated with bipolar disorder.
title: Altered astrocytic and microglial homeostasis characterizes a decreased proinflammatory state in bipolar disorder

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), being located in an enhancer of the IPMK gene with a P-value of 1.0 × 10^-6.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), located in intron 1 of the IPMK gene with a P-value of 8.0 × 10^-9.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: This SNP was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), located in intron 4 of the IPMK gene with an IBD P-value of 2 × 10^-11 and a minor allele frequency of 0.40.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: This SNP was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), being an intergenic variant with an IBD P-value of 5 × 10^-11 and a minor allele frequency of 0.40.
title: Loss of PI3-kinase activity of inositol polyphosphate multikinase impairs PDK1-mediated AKT activation, cell migration and intestinal homeostasis

finding: This SNP displayed an association with liver fat accumulation (p=1.6e-13, beta=-0.064) and colocalised with serum cholesterol levels indicating potential roles in fat metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs11101618 was identified in the context of the MAPK signaling pathway, which has been implicated in various cancer types. Research indicated that this SNP might correlate with susceptibility or resistance to cancer therapies, thereby suggesting its potential as a biomarker for treatment outcomes in cancer patients.
title: Intrinsically disordered membrane anchors of Rheb, RhoA and DiRas3 small GTPases: Molecular dynamics, membrane organization, and interactions

finding: The rs35837782 polymorphism was located in an intronic open chromatin region of the LHPP gene. It was part of an open chromatin region covering multiple genes associated with BCP ALL, which express increased levels in pro-B and pre-B cells.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The variant rs1250567, located in the ZMIZ1 locus, exhibited strong EBNA2 allele-dependent binding in EBV^EBNA2+ Ramos cells. This region was noted to loop to the promoter of the short isoform of ZMIZ1. Additionally, ZMIZ1 expression levels were reported to be three-fold lower in EBV^EBNA2+ Ramos cells compared to uninfected Ramos cells. This finding was in line with earlier reports by Fewing et al., which indicated decreased ZMIZ1 protein expression in blood samples from multiple sclerosis patients.
title: Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 (EBNA2) extensively rewires the human chromatin landscape at autoimmune risk loci

finding: The rs9337951 SNP was mapped to the JCAD/KIAA1462 locus, also identified within endothelial cell peaks related to CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The rs1320496 SNP was located in a strong macrophage-specific peak, significant for its role in CAD through modulation of transcription factor binding.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs11010119 was associated with platinum resistance in ovarian cancer as detailed in a study by Damia and Broggini (2019). This finding related specifically to the impairment of DNA damage repair mechanisms, which are critical in determining the effectiveness of platinum-based chemotherapy in treating high-grade serous carcinoma (HGSC).
title: Coordinated protein modules define DNA damage responses to carboplatin at single cell resolution in human ovarian carcinoma models

finding: The IBD risk variant rs1250566 was predicted to regulate the expression of PPIF, a gene located near the variant in the ZMIZ1 locus. Despite being an intronic variant of ZMIZ1, it was linked to PPIF due to closer 3D contact with its promoter.
title: Genome-wide maps of enhancer regulation connect risk variants to disease genes

finding: The missense variant rs140790046, which encodes the p.Asn309Ser change, was found within the MKX locus and was identified in one AD case. This finding highlighted a novel homozygous variant that potentially contributes to the recessive genetic mechanisms implicated in AD.
title: Autosomal Recessive Alzheimer’s disease (arAD): homozygosity mapping of genomic regions containing arAD loci

finding: The SNP rs9664184 was reported as a shared eQTL/pQTL associated with the gene MYOZ1, indicating a genetic variant that influenced both mRNA and protein abundance across the OMICs levels.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs2070594 was classified as an independent eQTL affecting the ATP5C1 transcript, demonstrating its regulation on mRNA levels without observable effects on protein expression.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs11101544 was reported to be associated with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML), as detailed in the study conducted by Flis et al. (2019). The study highlighted the synergistic effects of simultaneous inhibition of BCR-ABL1 tyrosine kinase and PAK1/2 serine/threonine kinase on CML cells, implicating this SNP as a relevant genetic alteration.
title: NSC348884 cytotoxicity is not mediated by inhibition of nucleophosmin oligomerization

finding: Islets from homozygous carriers of the T2D-risk allele (G allele) at rs703972 displayed significantly lower insulin content compared to noncarriers. Furthermore, there was a notable reduction in insulin secretion in response to high glucose (16.7 mM) in T2D risk allele carriers.
title: Zmiz1 is required for mature β-cell function and mass expansion upon high fat feeding

finding: Homozygous carriers of the T2D-risk allele (A allele) at rs12571751 exhibited significantly decreased insulin content in their islets when compared to noncarriers. Similar to findings with rs703972, a reduction in insulin secretion was observed in response to high glucose levels.
title: Zmiz1 is required for mature β-cell function and mass expansion upon high fat feeding

finding: Allelic imbalance in chromatin accessibility was identified for rs703977, where the T2D-risk allele (T) showed more open chromatin, which suggested increased expression of ZMIZ1 at the locus, consistent with findings supporting a role for ZMIZ1 in increased diabetes risk.
title: Zmiz1 is required for mature β-cell function and mass expansion upon high fat feeding

finding: The rs45575338 variant in FAM208B, implicated in increasing melanoma risk, was shared by three families - UF1, UF19, and UF20. Its significance was previously supported in literature.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The SNP rs11189671, located in a region associated with increased schizophrenia risk, was identified to carry a noncoding variant about 70bp from the ZNF274 identified motif. This variant's dosage correlated with the expression of multiple PCDH genes in the adult frontal cortex, highlighting its potential influence on mental health outcomes.
title: Clusters of lineage-specific genes are anchored by ZNF274 in repressive perinucleolar compartments

finding: The variant rs2234962 (Cys151Arg) was associated with BAG3 levels and confirmed as a secondary cis pQTL. This variant had previously been reported in genome-wide association studies (GWAS) for cardiomyopathies, indicating its role in heart failure biomarkers.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs721917 variant was associated with the SFTPD gene and exhibited significant colocalization with a COVID-19 hospitalization association, supporting the relevance of SFTPD in respiratory diseases.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs1005277 was identified as the sole variant associated with Hannum-based epigenetic age acceleration (Hannum-EAA). This association implicated 12 genes, notably those involved in the innate immune system and metabolic functions.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The SNP rs1663689 was identified as a noncoding SNP that repressed the expression of the ADGRG6 gene through interchromosomal interactions. This repression contributed to a reduction in lung cancer progression. The finding underscored the significance of interchromosomal interactions in regulating gene expression and highlighted the role of this specific SNP in cancer biology.
title: Interchromosomal Colocalization with Parental Genes Is Linked to the Function and Evolution of Mammalian Retrocopies

finding: The SNP rs11101552 was positively associated with EGF receptor activation and implicated in cancer mechanisms. Specifically, previous studies suggested that ligand-independent activation of EGFR could lead to cancer cell proliferation and resistance to treatments like cetuximab, indicating a potential role of this SNP in cancer-related processes involving ErbB3 phosphorylation.
title: Inhibition of EGFR/ErbB does not protect against C. difficile toxin B

finding: The AD risk variant rs7922621 was linked to down-regulation of two genes, ANXA11 and TSPAN14, specifically in microglia. This variant diminished chromatin accessibility in a microglia-specific cis-regulatory element (CRE) affecting these genes, and suppression of both genes impaired microglia phagocytosis, thus highlighting its significance in Alzheimer’s disease pathology.
title: Deconvolution of polygenic risk score in single cells unravels cellular and molecular heterogeneity of complex human diseases

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was identified as the largest-effect common variant associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in Europeans. It accounted for significant genetic variance in the study, contributing to the understanding of T2D risk.
title: Evaluation of Bayesian Linear Regression Models as a Fine Mapping tool

finding: The SNP rs34855922 was found to be associated with T2D and was highlighted as a significant finding in conjunction with rs7903146, showcasing the effectiveness of the BayesR model in uncovering multiple signals within the TCF7L2 locus.
title: Evaluation of Bayesian Linear Regression Models as a Fine Mapping tool

finding: The SNP rs145034729, an intronic variant at the TCF7L2 locus, was identified but its effect remained uncertain. It might function as an enhancer element influencing the expression of distal genes, contributing to the regulatory network involved in T2D.
title: Evaluation of Bayesian Linear Regression Models as a Fine Mapping tool

finding: The SNP rs7912495 was identified as a lead QTL SNP associated with the gene USP6NL. Its genotype was shown to significantly increase USP6NL expression across all four microglia regions examined. Notably, it was proposed to contribute to Alzheimer’s disease risk through this upregulation.
title: Atlas of genetic effects in human microglia transcriptome across brain regions, aging and disease pathologies

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was found to be both a well-known type 2 diabetes (T2D) associated SNP and was also identified as a body mass index (BMI) associated hit within the GIANT consortium. Specifically, its estimated effect on BMI was -0.016 with a p-value of 1.4 x 10^-14, while for T2D, the effect was 0.319 with a p-value of 1.7 x 10^-204. This highlights its significant role in both phenotypes in the context of the study.
title: A Hierarchical Approach Using Marginal Summary Statistics for Multiple Intermediates in a Mendelian Randomization or Transcriptome Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11101618 was associated with the MAPK pathway, which has been recognized as a promising therapeutic target in cancer. This linkage highlighted the potential role of the genetic variation in influencing treatment responses and cancer progression, confirming its relevance for therapeutic strategies involving pathways connected to biofilm-related chronic diseases.
title: Designing peptide drug with archaeal antimicrobial peptides against multidrug resistant bacterial biofilms and human diseases: an in silico approach

finding: The variant rs3824662, located in intron 3 of the GATA3 gene, was found to be strongly associated with Philadelphia chromosome-like acute lymphoblastic leukemia (Ph-like ALL) with a p-value of 1.2×10^-8. This variant appeared to function as a key regulatory enhancer, significantly increasing GATA3 expression in cells with the risk A allele compared to those with the C allele. The mechanism included enhancing transcriptional activity, reshaping chromatin accessibility, and promoting oncogene activation.
title: Non-coding germline GATA3 variants alter chromatin topology and contribute to pathogenesis of acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs11156567 was linked to a significant region on chromosome 10 overlapping with the gene CLVS1, in relation to principal component PC1_WHITE.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The SNP rs9419569 located in a significant region on chromosome 10 also related to principal component PC1_WHITE.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This SNP contributed to the phenome-wide significance regarding type 2 diabetes in East Asians.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP's association with type 2 diabetes highlights its significance in metabolic health.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The SNP rs12779790, located in the CDC123/CAMK1D gene, was associated with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) in women. This finding contributed to the understanding of the genetic predisposition for GDM.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: This SNP was linked to Type 2 diabetes and psoriasis through LD with GWAS peaks and was found to disrupt several AP1 TF binding motifs, showing hypermethylation on the ALT allele in T cells relevant to psoriasis.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Identified in association with breast cancer, this SNP was shown to disrupt a regulatory motif, pointing to its role in cancer pathogenesis.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Associated with breast cancer, this SNP showcased significant impacts on transcriptional regulation linked to the disease.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs17094222 in the HIF1AN gene locus was identified as associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in a Genome-Wide Association Study. This association highlights the potential role of HIF1A in influencing body weight and adiposity, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could contribute to obesity by affecting thermogenic processes.
title: Regulatory Modules of Human Thermogenic Adipocytes: Functional Genomics of Meta-Analyses Derived Marker-Genes

finding: The SNP rs10883761 was identified as disrupting potential binding sites for transcription factors, which was crucial because its alteration contributed to the associated risk variants for neurodevelopmental diseases such as schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Bridging between mouse and human enhancer-promoter long-range interactions in neural stem cells, to understand enhancer function in neurodevelopmental disease

finding: In contrast to the previous SNPs, the SNP rs7907645 was associated with the acquisition of a potential novel transcription factor binding site. This change was relevant to risk variants connected to neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Bridging between mouse and human enhancer-promoter long-range interactions in neural stem cells, to understand enhancer function in neurodevelopmental disease

finding: This SNP exhibited contacts with TSPAN14, reinforcing its role in Alzheimer's genetics.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The surfactant protein D polymorphism rs2243639 was correlated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) susceptibility, indicating its potential role as a genetic biomarker in the disease.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The deletion of a 37 bp sequence surrounding rs725861 decreased GATA3 expression in Th2 cells from two different donors. This indicated that this distal sequence functions as an enhancer in Th2 cells, suggesting that risk variants for allergic diseases and asthma likely affect GATA3 expression in this cell type.
title: Deletion mapping of regulatory elements for GATA3 reveals a distal T helper 2 cell enhancer involved in allergic diseases

finding: The SNP rs11101569 was implicated in breast cancer chemoresistance, as discussed in the research by De Angelis et al. (2019). This SNP was associated with breast cancer stem cells that contribute to tumor dormancy and the ability to survive chemotherapy, highlighting its importance in understanding tumor behavior and treatment challenges.
title: Neutrophils exposed to a cholesterol metabolite secrete extracellular vesicles that promote epithelial-mesenchymal transition and stemness in breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs4746023 was identified to have an eQTL in RGC1 cell types. In individuals with POAG, each additional copy of the A allele resulted in an increase of approximately 1.4 transcripts per cell, which was about twice as high compared to healthy controls. This demonstrated a significant interaction between the SNP allelic effect and disease status.
title: Retinal ganglion cell-specific genetic regulation in primary open angle glaucoma

finding: The rs7085433 variant, located in the TIMM23 gene, was associated with ΔTT changes in time trial performance. Its non-coding nature suggested that it could disrupt mitochondrial import function, thus impairing exercise potential.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The SNP rs2234962 was identified as one of the most significant novel loci (P<5×10^-54) and was related specifically to the Q-R upslope feature in the ECG, showing implications for dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) risk.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: The SNP rs12264666 located in the KIAA1217 gene demonstrated a distribution of the ancestral allele that was significantly higher in North West Indian and South West coastal populations relative to Gangetic plain populations, reinforcing the idea of a distinct genetic lineage stemming from ancient migration events.
title: Genetic affinities and adaptation of the South West coast populations of India

finding: The SNP rs73310256 in the HTR7 gene was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding linked genetic variations in HTR7 to the disease, emphasizing the potential of HTR7 as a relevant target for therapeutic interventions.
title: GuiltyTargets: Prioritization of Novel Therapeutic Targets with Deep Network Representation Learning

finding: This SNP was confirmed to be associated with increasing adenoma count at colonoscopy, which signifies its importance in evaluating colorectal cancer risk.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: Identified as an intronic variant related to serum urate levels, this SNP also contributed to raising the risk of gout as indicated by MR Corge estimates.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The SNP rs73349121 was identified as having a significant association with blood-derived mitochondrial DNA copy number (mtDNA-CN), with a p-value of 0.0001 in the Blacks-only meta-analysis involving 4770 individuals. This finding was noteworthy as it supported the direction of effect observed in the larger Whites-only GWAS, thereby suggesting similar genetic influences on mtDNA-CN across different ancestries.
title: Genome-wide analysis of mitochondrial DNA copy number reveals multiple loci implicated in nucleotide metabolism, platelet activation, and megakaryocyte proliferation

finding: This T1D and IBD-associated intronic variant located in IL2RA downregulated IL2RA expression while upregulating IL15RA and RBM17, thereby impacting T cell proliferation and homeostasis.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: This emVar was significantly associated with RBPJ, a regulatory protein involved in WNT signaling pathways critical for T cell function, indicating a broader role in immune response.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: This variant was associated with hypertension and essential hypertension during the second PheWAS, indicating its relevance to blood pressure-related phenotypes as well as BMI.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The investigation indicated that the promoter polymorphism rs12770170 (−184C/T) of the Microseminoprotein, Beta was identified as a risk factor for benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) specifically in the Korean population. This finding underscored the potential genetic influence on the susceptibility to BPH.
title: TIAM1 signaling drives prostatic budding and branching phenotypes and is a potential therapeutic target for BPH

finding: The variant rs12722502 was found to co-localise with DNase footprints and enhancer RNA (eRNA) at the IL2RA locus. It was identified as an intronic variant that exhibited a five-fold reduction in binding of the ELF1 transcription factor in leukemic T-cells, impacting immune cell function.
title: DNA-binding factor footprints and enhancer RNAs identify functional non-coding genetic variants

finding: Lead SNP rs2274224 showed increased interhemispheric connectivity in minor allele carriers (C). This variant resided in an exonic region of PLCCE1:PLCE1-AS1, indicating its significance in connections across the two hemispheres related to language processing.
title: Imaging genetics of language network functional connectivity reveals links with language-related abilities, dyslexia and handedness

finding: A meta-analysis revealed significant associations between polymorphisms in FGFR2, including rs2981582, and breast cancer susceptibility.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was associated with risk factors pertaining to breast cancer within certain populations as outlined in relevant literature.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Identified in studies as having an association with breast cancer and was considered among risk variants for analysis.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP rs2234962 in the BAG3 gene has also been reported in association with DCM in prior findings, and was included in the genetic risk score for DCM in the study.
title: Genome wide association analysis in dilated cardiomyopathy reveals two new key players in systolic heart failure on chromosome 3p25.1 and 22q11.23

finding: Associated with DCM, rs61869036 was connected to BAG3, with substantial evidence from earlier research contributing to its validation in the genetic landscape for DCM.
title: Genome wide association analysis in dilated cardiomyopathy reveals two new key players in systolic heart failure on chromosome 3p25.1 and 22q11.23

finding: This SNP was previously shown to be an important RET enhancer variant associated with Hirschsprung disease risk, contributing to significant readouts in enhancer activity assays.
title: A multi-enhancer RET regulatory code is disrupted in Hirschsprung disease

finding: This SNP also displayed significant enhancer activity in prior analyses and contributed to the risk associated with Hirschsprung disease.
title: A multi-enhancer RET regulatory code is disrupted in Hirschsprung disease

finding: As with rs2506030 and rs7069590, this SNP was confirmed as a RET enhancer variant, playing a role in increasing the risk for Hirschsprung disease.
title: A multi-enhancer RET regulatory code is disrupted in Hirschsprung disease

finding: In the study, rs701873, an intronic variant near the MYOF gene, was identified with a significant association to nightmares (p=2.18e-8). This finding indicated a unique genetic risk factor for the frequency of nightmares, observed after excluding individuals with heavy alcohol use.
title: Nightmares share strong genetic risk with sleep and psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs7916271 was associated with the disruption of KLF16 binding motifs, which indicated a role in regulatory functions within the ASC gene network related to neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Age-specific gene signatures underlying the transcriptomes and functional connectomes of human cerebral cortex

finding: Identified as a functional variant, rs34416841 perturbed motifs for retinoid transcription factors (TFs). This SNP was associated with strong perturbations in retinoid receptor TF motifs, highlighting its potential role in the regulatory landscape influencing MDD.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: The SNP rs79269275 was found to perturb an RARA (or RARB) motif, indicating its involvement in modulating the regulatory effects of retinoid pathways, relevant to MDD risk loci.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: The SNP rs17731, located on chromosome 10, formed part of a CC-GWAS-specific locus comparing SCZ and MDD. This locus lies in an exon of the KLF6 gene. Although preliminary analyses suggested an effect on SCZ, it did not achieve significance in the case-control data examined. KLF6 is another transcription factor that could influence mechanisms involved in schizophrenia, specifically relating to synaptic pruning.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: The SNP rs11101439 was positively associated with differential splicing profiles in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors (PanNETs). The study highlighted that distinct spliceosomic groups (SPN1, SPN2, SPN3) exhibited unique clinical and molecular characteristics. Specifically, the splicing machinery related to this SNP was found to correlate with clinical outcomes and activated key biological processes such as mTOR signaling, which suggests its potential role as a biomarker for identifying therapeutic targets in PanNETs.
title: An integrative RNA spliceosomic landscape of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors unveils novel clinicomolecular associations

finding: The SNP rs11101514 showed a predictive role in the response and outcome for advanced lung adenocarcinoma patients undergoing treatment with first-line Bevacizumab and platinum-based chemotherapy. This highlighted its potential as a biomarker for treatment efficacy in this patient cohort.
title: Bioinformatic Analysis Linking Genomic Defects to Chemosensitivity and Mechanism of Action

finding: The SNP rs11187837 located in the 10q23.33 genomic region was associated with multiple amplitude traits related to intrinsic brain activity, illustrating its significance in affecting brain function.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: Associated with multiple amplitude traits, rs10781575 in the 10q26.3 genomic region contributed to the understanding of intrinsic brain activity and its genetic underpinnings.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: The em-Var rs306587 was prioritized among LD-linked variants, including GWAS SNP rs1042058, indicating a notable finding.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: This SNP was associated with a leftward shift of surface area asymmetry in two lateral temporal regions, a rightward shift in two medial temporal regions, and a leftward shift in cortical thickness asymmetry in the inferior temporal gyrus. This finding related to the brain's language function.
title: The genetic architecture of structural left-right asymmetry of the human brain

finding: The rs17095355 polymorphism in the X-prolyl aminopeptidase 1 gene was found to be associated with biliary atresia in Thai children, further underscoring the genetic factors linked to this condition.
title: Efemp1 modulates elastic fiber formation and mechanics of the extrahepatic bile duct

finding: The SNP rs117885390, although exhibiting a lower association strength with schizophrenia (SCZ) compared to rs150721234, was identified as a positive finding. It was located in an enhancer region of the ITGB1 gene, which plays a potential role in the development of schizophrenia.
title: Convolutional neural network model to predict causal risk factors that share complex regulatory features

finding: CRISPRa targeting at the CNNM2 locus with rs78260931 induced a significant transcriptional senescence signature without differential expression of nearby genes, suggesting a locus-specific impact.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: In the LNCaP cell line, the risk allele of rs10795917 displayed significantly lower transcriptional activity compared to the normal allele, indicating a decrease in gene expression.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: The SNP rs9420907 on chromosome 10 co-localized with an eQTL affecting the expression of the gene STN1 in seven tissue types, including skin (sun exposed), transverse colon, and EM. This SNP was part of the TL-associated loci that regulate telomere length through gene expression.
title: Determinants of telomere length across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs7903146 located in the TCF7L2 locus was confirmed as the most significant association for T2D with a p-value of 7.288 x 10^-13 and consistent across multiple studies, reinforcing its role in T2D risk.
title: A Novel Type 2 Diabetes Locus in sub-Saharan Africans, ZRANB3, is Implicated in Beta Cell Proliferation

finding: The variant rs4348791, related to SLC39A12, identified associations in caudate and sub-regions of the putamen and pallidum. This gene's expression is crucial for neural development.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The genetic variant rs11012783, associated with CACNB2, was noted for its involvement in regulating calcium influx, linked to psychiatric conditions such as autism and schizophrenia.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs1905542 was associated with upregulation of SHTN1 expression due to the creation of a CEBP binding motif, which showed predicted epistatic interactions with nearby blood-specific motifs (IRF1/2, SPI1/B) in the context of GTEx 'Whole Blood' RNA sequencing data.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs564819152 mapped to several cancer-related genes and was associated with traits linked to WM-BAG. The gene DNAJC1, related to this SNP, plays a role in cellular stress response and was implicated in various cancer types.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs1054399 was significantly associated with the HIF1AN gene and displayed a p-value of 6.9E-10, suggesting a strong link to metabolic disease traits in the examined population.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: The SNP rs17134592, found at 10:5,260,682, was shown to be a non-synonymous mutation in the AKR1C4 gene, linked with increased serum bilirubin levels. This mutation also affected enzyme activity by introducing a Leucine to Valine change (L311V), severely reducing the catalytic activity of the enzyme responsible for metabolizing steroids.
title: The lingering effects of Neanderthal introgression on human complex traits

finding: The rs3829125 SNP was associated with the AKR1C4 gene and identified as a tightly linked variant to rs17134592. While it was noted that the single amino acid change (S145C) in this variant did not significantly alter enzyme activity alone, it was inferred to work in concert with rs17134592 in impacting overall catalytic efficiency of the corresponding enzyme.
title: The lingering effects of Neanderthal introgression on human complex traits

finding: The rs7903146 SNP in the TCF7L2 gene was identified as a significant genetic polymorphism associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), highlighting its role in glucose metabolism.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs1801157 SNP in the SDF-1β gene was found to be significantly linked with T2DM risk, suggesting a role in the migratory and homing function of stem cells and possibly in the pathology of diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs1268974 on chromosome 10 was identified as having the highest estimated probability of being an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene ACAP3, which was associated with breast cancer risk in individuals of European ancestry. It contributed to the trans-eQTL effects that predominantly drove the association of ACAP3.
title: Cis- and trans-eQTL TWAS of breast and ovarian cancer identify more than 100 risk associated genes in the BCAC and OCAC consortia

finding: The SNP rs704010, also on chromosome 10, was identified as a top predictor for ACAP3 with an estimated probability of 0.0394. It was noted for its association with overall breast cancer risk in European ancestry and Han Chinese populations, as well as with ER-/PR-breast cancer in an African American cohort.
title: Cis- and trans-eQTL TWAS of breast and ovarian cancer identify more than 100 risk associated genes in the BCAC and OCAC consortia

finding: Stewart et al. established that rs11192209 was significant in the quantitative phenotyping of Northern Leaf Blight using UAV images fortified by deep learning techniques.
title: Automatic late blight lesion recognition and severity quantification based on field imagery of diverse potato genotypes by deep learning

finding: A significant association was found between the rs1536828 genotype and the average percent methylation of the CYP2E1 DMR, with samples homozygous for the minor allele (G/G) displaying the lowest methylation. This finding was tested and validated using ANOVA with a p-value of 0.03, indicating its relevancy in relation to methylation differences associated with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).
title: Placental DNA methylation levels at CYP2E1 and IRS2 are associated with child outcome in a prospective autism study

finding: The SNP rs11595168 (c.1539A>C) was heterozygous in all tested samples and was associated with an Alu insertion in the intronic region of UPF2 (c.3408+98_+111insAlu). The c.1539C allele was very rare and not detected among available control samples, suggesting its potential relevance in genetic studies related to breast cancer.
title: A systematic screen of breast cancer patients’ exomes for retrotransposon insertions reveals disease associated genes

finding: The SNP rs11202088 was identified in a neuronal open chromatin region through a merged analysis of caQTL regression and ASCA, which predicted that it disrupts an ERG3 transcription factor binding site. This finding underscored its potential role in genetic regulation mechanisms within neurons.
title: Genetic regulation of cell-type specific chromatin accessibility shapes the etiology of brain diseases

finding: The SNP rs4751995 in the PNLIPRP2 gene was associated with levels of a specific faecal choline derivative (1-palmitoyl-2-linoleoyl-digalactosyl glycerol), with a meta-analysis p-value of 5.68e-10. This finding contributed to the wide genomic variants linked with metabolite levels.
title: The faecal metabolome and its determinants in inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs2040023 was positively associated with liver disease phenotypes in the study by de la Rosa et al. (2022). The research indicated a significant role of oxidative stress related to this SNP, particularly in the context of liver disorders, highlighting the impact of oxidative stress mechanisms in isolated liver sinusoidal endothelial cells.
title: Hydrogen peroxide damage to scavenging function and ultrastructure of liver sinusoidal endothelial cells is prevented by n-acetyl-cysteine but not GSH

finding: The SNP rs6584555 was identified as contributing to postoperative atrial fibrillation in a study involving a Chinese population. This finding suggested a significant association with the cardiac phenotype, demonstrating its relevance in the context of mTOR and cardiac remodeling.
title: Muscle specific translational control of Cand2 by mTORC1 regulates adverse cardiac remodeling

finding: The SNP rs12766939 in the CUBILIN gene was significantly associated with mortality during the observation period, with a hazard ratio for the minor homozygote genotype of 1.17 (1.06 – 1.29), P < 0.002, although this finding was cautioned against due to the SNP not being in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.
title: Polymorphisms in the vitamin D system and mortality - The Tromsø study

finding: The rs1885301 polymorphism of the ABCC2 gene significantly increased the risk of anti-TB drug-induced MPE compared with homozygous wild-type genotype, with an odds ratio of 3.39.
title: Association of variants within the GST and other genes with anti-tubercular agents related toxicity: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs2804400 polymorphism of the ABCC2 gene also significantly increased the risk of anti-TB drug-induced MPE compared to homozygous wild-type genotype, with an odds ratio of 3.47.
title: Association of variants within the GST and other genes with anti-tubercular agents related toxicity: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs11523871 (Thr42Pro) was shown to correlate significantly with SRCR domain copy numbers in the DMBT1 gene. Specifically, C-haplotypes carried fewer SRCR repeats than A-haplotypes, influencing gene expression particularly in the colon, where higher DMBT1 expression levels were associated with each C allele, reinforcing its role in the signal of balancing selection.
title: Maintenance of copy number variation at the human salivary agglutinin gene (DMBT1) by balancing selection driven by host-microbe interactions

finding: The SNP rs11101575 was identified as a significant marker in the study of lung cancer metastasis, specifically related to the overexpression of CD44 in metastatic cancer cell clusters (MCCCs). This finding offered insights into potential drug targets for anti-metastatic therapies, as the metastatic clusters were found to be more tumorigenic and could be selectively isolated from patient blood using a novel methodology that utilized immunoaffinity based on this SNP.
title: Selective capture of circulating metastatic cancer cell clusters from lung cancer patients reveals a unique genomic profile that identifies anti-metastatic molecular therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs11191352 was noted as a cis-eQTL for nearby genes and had a significant association with SmokingInitiation, with a P-value of 2.12 x 10^-7. It was among the candidates that may influence addiction-associated traits.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: The SNP rs12220909 was found to have a strong impact, being responsible for the loss of 95% of the targets of miR-4293, and was associated with diminished cancer susceptibility, highlighting its relevance in cancer genetics.
title: Impact and evolutionary determinants of Neanderthal introgression on transcriptional and post-transcriptional regulation

finding: The SNP rs11257655 was associated with type 2 diabetes at the CAMK1D locus, co-localising with the eQTL signal rs11257658. The G allele of rs11257658 correlated with decreased CAMK1D expression in human islets, which is pivotal as CAMK1D encodes calcium/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase 1D.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs11257658, through its G allele, was linked to lower human islet expression of CAMK1D, thereby elucidating its role in type 2 diabetes at the CAMK1D locus, along with being in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs11257655.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs7903146 at the TCF7L2 locus was tied to increased expression of TCF7L2 in islets with significant chromatin interactions, despite showing reduced chromatin accessibility in the EndoC-βH1 cells.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The rs11101437 SNP was associated with changes in glioma stem cell state dynamics, particularly in relation to the modulation of Chi3l1 expression. This SNP-related finding indicated a correlation with the reduction of CD133+/SOX2+ cells and an increase in CD44+/Chi3l1+ cells, implicating rs11101437 in the regulation of GSC phenotypes that are influenced by Chi3l1, marking it as significant in glioblastoma pathology.
title: Chi3l1 is a modulator of glioma stem cell states and a therapeutic vulnerability for glioblastoma

finding: This progenitor sSNP was associated with an unannotated splicing event for the AS3MT gene and colocalized with the SCZ GWAS index SNP rs11191419. The risk allele T enhanced usage of this splicing site, revealing a mechanism influencing schizophrenia risk.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: As the index SNP for schizophrenia, rs11191419 colocalized with the progenitor sSNP rs3740400. The T allele was found to increase the usage of an exon skipping event related to AS3MT, linking it to neurodevelopment and susceptibility to schizophrenia.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: It was noted in linkage disequilibrium with rs3740400 and was related to a transcript regulated in the adult brain. This provided a developmental basis for the association of the splicing event influenced by progenitor-specific variants.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: The SNP rs61835134 was identified as the top genetic predictor of ATP levels associated with hemoglobin increments in transfusion recipients. This SNP highlighted a significant positive association with ATP levels and a corresponding reduction in bilirubin levels, indicating decreased hemolysis in patients receiving units from donors with high storage ATP levels, thereby emphasizing its relevance in transfusion practices.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Red Blood Cell Glycolysis

finding: The SNP rs11813268, located in an intergenic region at 10q24.33, was associated with both melanoma and prostate cancer. This finding introduced a new association for this intergenic region, which had been previously linked to other cancers but not specifically to melanoma or prostate cancer.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The rs1129555 SNP in GPAM was found to be associated with serum lipid profiles in certain populations, which linked this genetic variation to lipid metabolism. This finding was significant as it supported the role of GPAM in lipid metabolism disturbances, relevant to the observed hypomyelination of the corticospinal tract in the CP patient with normal intelligence.
title: In-depth analysis reveals complex molecular etiology of idiopathic cerebral palsy

finding: The intergenic SNP rs11255841 was replicated in this study with an odds ratio of 2.2, surpassing earlier findings where it had shown an odds ratio of 1.1-1.2 in a Japanese study and larger meta-analyses. This SNP was linked to colorectal cancer and was consistent across various populations.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: The study by Wu et al. (2013) established an association between the rs2227564 polymorphism in the urokinase-plasminogen activator gene and Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This research indicated that certain genotypes at this locus were linked to increased susceptibility to AD, highlighting the genetic influence on microglial function and potential pathways involved in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: Epigallocatechin Gallate Modulates Microglia Phenotype to Suppress Pro-Inflammatory Signalling Cues and Inhibit Phagocytosis

finding: This SNP was associated with human melanoma cell line responses in a study that reported that the inhibition of Pannexin 1 (PANX1) reduced the tumorigenic properties of these cells. The findings highlighted the role of PANX1 in melanoma cancer biology.
title: Novel Pannexin 1 isoform is increased in cancer

finding: The rs11257655 variant was identified as a predominant SNP within the CDC123/CaMK1D locus on chromosome 10, which was strongly associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in both European and Asian populations. The C to T change in the enhancer region of the rs11257655 allele led to DNA hypomethylation and facilitated the binding of transcription factors FOXA1/FOXA2, resulting in enhanced transcription of the CaMK1D gene. Ultimately, increased expression of CaMK1D may contribute to the development of T2D.
title: CaMK1D signaling in AgRP neurons promotes ghrelin-mediated food intake

finding: The SNP rs603424 was associated with significant changes in circulating lipid metabolite levels, particularly phospholipids and palmitoleate. This association correlated with the activity of the SCD gene, which encodes Stearoyl-CoA 9-desaturase, an enzyme crucial for fatty acid metabolism, particularly in the formation of monounsaturated fatty acids involved in membrane phospholipids. The findings suggested that the mutation represented by the SNP could lead to a loss of SCD enzyme activity, resulting in altered lipid profiles observed in metabolic studies.
title: Genome scale metabolic network modelling for metabolic profile predictions
