finding: The intronic variant rs3814637 within CYP2C19 was reported to be significantly associated with warfarin maintenance dose, as confirmed by a p-value of less than 1.0 × 10−46 in a two-sided Jonckheere-Terpstra test. It was found that normal metabolizers of CYP2C19 had an average daily warfarin dose of 4.8 mg, which was lower compared to 5.3 mg for other metabolizer classes. This underlined the impact of the pharmacogenetic association, establishing that genetics plays a role in drug response variability, particularly influencing maintenance dosing for warfarin.
title: Drug Response Pharmacogenetics for 200,000 UK Biobank Participants

finding: The SNP rs3824662, associated with the GATA3 gene, was identified as an ATAC-QTL linked to increased chromatin accessibility in B-ALL. This variant was also confirmed in ALL patient-derived xenograft (PDX) samples, indicating its relevance in the chromatin landscape of B-ALL.
title: Epigenomic mapping in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia identifies transcriptional regulators and noncoding variants promoting distinct chromatin architectures

finding: Wang et al. indicated that SNP rs11010112 was tied to hypoxic radioresistance, which plays a critical role in how glioblastoma tissues respond to radiotherapy. The presence of this SNP could inform strategies aimed at overcoming therapy resistance linked to oxygen deprivation in tumors.
title: How to use transcriptomic data for game-theoretic modeling of treatment-induced resistance in cancer cells? A case study in patient-derived glioblastoma organoids

finding: The SNP rs2001389 was significantly associated with pancreatic cancer risk. It was reported to weaken the binding activity of the transcriptional repressor CCCTC-binding factor (CTCF) and was linked to lower expression of MFSD13A/TMEM180. Furthermore, the study highlighted that siRNA-mediated knockdown of MFSD13A/TMEM180 promoted proliferation of pancreatic cancer cell lines. This finding contributed to the understanding of TMEM180's role in cancer pathology, though it was noted that findings concerning TMEM180's relationship with cancer proliferation could be controversial.
title: Topological analysis of TMEM180, a newly identified membrane protein that is highly expressed in colorectal cancer cells

finding: rs7072776 was associated with ER and grade in case-case analyses and showed an opposite association with risk of luminal A-like disease and TN disease, with an OR of 1.10 for luminal A-like and 0.96 for TN.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Variants at 10q26.13, including rs2981578, demonstrated strong associations with luminal A-like subtypes, having ORs of 1.29 and P=2.01×10^-231.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Similar to rs2981578, rs35054928 was strongly associated with luminal A-like subtypes (OR=1.35, P=5.00×10^-300) in case-control analyses.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: rs45631563 was not associated with HER2-enriched subtypes but showed evidence for associations with ER and grade, providing important details about its risk relationship.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Found primarily in studies concerning associations with ER-positive disease contexts.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Reported to be alone in links with HER2 associations, requiring follow-up for confirmation.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP served as a cortical expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene INA and associated with schizophrenia candidate genes AS3MT, NT5C2, and WBP1L. It had a P-value of 1.7 x 10^-13 and was replicated with a P-value of 1.0 x 10^-17, highlighting its relevance in cortical thickness and potential implications in schizophrenia.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The analysis revealed that the <italic>ARS1529.5</italic> origin, characterized by its need for the conserved FKH binding site (5'-FKH-T site), was crucial for optimal functioning in yeast. It was established that this particular origin required Fkh1's FHA domain for effective ORC-origin binding. Additionally, when mutations were introduced into the ORC site of <italic>ARS1529.5</italic>, these alterations could compensate for the necessity of the 5'-FKH-T site, demonstrating that enhanced ORC binding could bypass the dependency on the FHA domain. Importantly, the 5'-FKH-T site was identified as a critical accessory element that influenced ARS activity, particularly under conditions of limited ORC function, thereby validating the significance of this locus in origin activation and interaction with ORC.
title: The Fkh1 Forkhead Associated Domain Promotes ORC Binding to a Subset of DNA Replication Origins in Budding Yeast

finding: The allele A of the rs2770197 variant was associated with increases in vacuole size and cell membrane deterioration in subcutaneous adipose tissue, indicative of tissue degradation. Pathway analysis suggested involvement in adipogenesis and fatty acid metabolism.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI-enabled Framework for Automated Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes in Histology Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs11200385 (gene TACC2) was found to be associated with an increased risk of treatment-related mortality (TRM), with a hazard ratio of 3.05 and a p-value of 0.02 in recipients with HLA-DRB1*15:01. This finding pointed to the mHA's role in influencing the survival of patients post-transplant.
title: Associations of Minor Histocompatibility Antigens with Clinical Outcomes Following Allogeneic Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation

finding: The lead SNP rs1412444 was established as a significant CAD risk variant, residing in an intronic enhancer region that showed strong interaction with the LIPA promoter. Carriers of the risk allele had increased LIPA mRNA and enzyme activity in human monocytes, linking it directly to elevated coronary artery disease risk.
title: Decoding the Variant-to-Function Relationship for LIPA, a Risk Locus for CAD

finding: SNP rs1412445, in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs1412444, demonstrated independent effects on LIPA expression and CAD risk. It was also associated with increased LIPA mRNA levels in individuals carrying the risk alleles, supporting the findings of enhanced expression in macrophages.
title: Decoding the Variant-to-Function Relationship for LIPA, a Risk Locus for CAD

finding: The risk allele of rs1320496 increased LIPA enhancer activity by creating a binding site for PU.1, indicating that this SNP functionally contributes to the elevated expression of LIPA in myeloid cells and is a CAD risk variant.
title: Decoding the Variant-to-Function Relationship for LIPA, a Risk Locus for CAD

finding: In the context of breast cancer risk, rs35054928 was found to be in linkage disequilibrium (D' = 0.82) with a significant deletion in the region upstream of FGFR2. The deletion associated with a larger effect size (OR = 1.42; CI, 1.21 to 1.67; P = 0.00015) than the common SNPs previously reported, indicating its potential importance in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Rare copy number variants (CNVs) and breast cancer risk

finding: Similar to rs35054928, rs2981578 was also in linkage disequilibrium (D' = 0.88) with the deletion found upstream of FGFR2. The deletion was identified as a significant factor for breast cancer risk, with an odds ratio of 1.42, showing that these SNPs might contribute to the risk through their association with CNVs.
title: Rare copy number variants (CNVs) and breast cancer risk

finding: The VCL gene variant rs4746172 was associated with hypertension in southern Han populations, connecting cardiovascular risks often seen in GDM through genetic predisposition.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The variant rs3758581 also exhibited a high MAF of 95.1% in HKG and was associated with the drug response for fluoxetine, fluvoxamine, and voriconazole based on three in vitro studies. This finding emphasized its relevance in determining effective treatment plans in the HKG population.
title: HKG: An open genetic variant database of 205 Hong Kong Cantonese exomes

finding: The causal T2D variant rs7903146, located at TCF7L2, was fine-mapped to beta cell cREs that showed reduced accessibility in the context of increased BMI (PIP=0.99). This finding reinforced the connection between genetic risk factors and their physiological impact on diabetes.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: SNP rs12263497 mapped to gene Inpp5f, relevant to several genetic conditions.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The minor allele (C; frequency 0.16) of rs2486758 was associated with higher plasma corticosterone and corticosterone:cortisol ratio but not with plasma cortisol. In both ORCADES and ET2DS, this association was consistent, indicating an enhancement in corticosterone levels relative to cortisol. The study showed a replication of these findings in independent cohorts, supporting the association between this SNP and indicators of metabolic syndrome.
title: Associations of ‘Relative corticosterone deficiency’ with genetic variation in CYP17A1 and metabolic syndrome features

finding: The study identified that the rs1801157 SNP in the cxcl12 gene was linked to breast cancer within the Pakistani population. This finding underscored the biological regulatory network associated with cxcl12–cxcr4, which is essential in the context of cancer metastasis. The association highlighted the potential role of this SNP in influencing breast cancer progression and could serve as a marker for understanding metastatic behavior in breast cancer.
title: Pan-cancer study on transition of signaling systems from primary to metastatic tumors

finding: The intronic SNP rs117896735, located in the gene encoding Sac2/INPP5F, was identified as a risk locus for Parkinson's disease (PD) through GWAS studies. This SNP was associated with PD given its implication in the endocytic pathway and interaction with Rab5, similar to synaptojanin 1 (SJ1), and suggested a potential overlapping functional role of Sac2 and SJ1 in synaptic processes.
title: Absence of Sac2/INPP5F enhances the phenotype of a Parkinson’s disease mutation of synaptojanin 1

finding: rs72846714 was found to be associated with lower levels of erythrocyte thioguanine nucleotide (TGN) during 6-mercaptopurine (6-MP) treatment in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). This finding was based on analyses conducted on both discovery and validation cohorts, confirming its robustness across different chemotherapy regimens and patient populations.
title: Effects of NT5C2 germline variants on 6-mecaptopurine metabolism in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The novel variant rs58700372 was identified as independently associated with reduced levels of TGN in patients undergoing treatment with 6-MP. Functional studies indicated that the variant allele led to higher transcriptional activity of the NT5C2 gene, thus resulting in lower drug metabolism and lower TGN levels.
title: Effects of NT5C2 germline variants on 6-mecaptopurine metabolism in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The study by Papandreou et al. (2019) indicated that the TCF7L2-rs7903146 polymorphism was associated with metabolites related to purine catabolism which were linked to the risk of type 2 diabetes incidence. The findings suggested that the SNP modified the effects of these metabolites, highlighting its relevance in metabolic conditions often observed in states of glucose intolerance related to diseases such as ALS.
title: Dysregulated expanded endocannabinoid system as therapeutic targets of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs11101513 was identified as a significant marker related to matrisome alterations in ovarian cancer. It was part of a broader study by Mitra et al. (2019), which indicated that transcriptomic profiling could reveal changes in the extracellular matrix indicative of cancer progression. This finding highlighted the role of specific genetic variations in influencing the cellular environment within tumors.
title: Extracellular matrix gene expression signatures as cell type and cell state identifiers

finding: Leading stress-interactive eQTL for the PRKCQ eGene in the MeA, this SNP was shown to fall within a YY1 binding motif in iGABA open chromatin, linking it to the gene's expression regulation under stress.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: SNP rs2675662 was associated with psoriasis and impacted transcriptional regulation through the alteration of TF binding motifs, underlining its potential as a regulatory SNP related to immune response.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: As a linked SNP for Type 2 diabetes, rs2633310 showed a mechanistic relationship involving disrupted TF motifs that may affect metabolic pathways, hence linking it to cardiometabolic disease susceptibility.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The IL2RA rs2104286 variant was associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) onset and severity in patients from Serbia.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs1046747 was observed to have medium to high pleiotropy with a PVS score of 0.543, associated with asthma, leukemia, lymphoma, lymphopenia, and cardiovascular diseases.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was identified as affecting the risk of type 2 diabetes by modulating incretin action, according to the findings of Villareal et al. in 2010. This discovery highlighted the role of this variant in influencing metabolic processes relevant to diabetes, showcasing its significance in the context of phenotype related to diabetes susceptibility.
title: Disentangling genetic feature selection and aggregation in transcriptome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs35339173 was associated with monocyte count, having a PIP of 10.4%. It was found within predicted enhancers specific to PPIF in granulocyte-monocyte progenitors.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The variant rs1250546 was linked to lymphocyte count with a fine-mapping PIP of 12.3%. It was observed to overlap with predicted enhancers associated with PPIF in natural killer (NK) cells.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs7903146 in TCF7L2 was reported to be associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes. Individuals carrying the T risk allele exhibited impaired insulin secretion and responses to the incretin hormone GLP-1, highlighting its role in glucose metabolism and pancreatic beta cell function.
title: Reduced expression of TCF7L2 in adipocyte impairs glucose tolerance associated with decreased insulin secretion, incretins levels and lipid metabolism dysregulation in male mice

finding: The context noted that rs6585195, an intronic variant in TCF7L2, was identified as having significant expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) influence on TCF7L2 expression. This suggested a potential connection to alterations in incretin and insulin levels, implicating this variant in metabolic processes relevant to type 2 diabetes.
title: Reduced expression of TCF7L2 in adipocyte impairs glucose tolerance associated with decreased insulin secretion, incretins levels and lipid metabolism dysregulation in male mice

finding: The study reported that the effect on chromatin accessibility of the HDR allele at rs12269414 was normalized to the WT allele, showing significant changes in chromatin accessibility. The presence of small deletions around the SNP was highlighted, with the study showing the effect size of these deletions compared to the WT allele, indicating that specific deletions could influence the regulatory landscape and chromatin architecture, particularly through elements related to the CTCF binding site.
title: Screening for functional regulatory variants in open chromatin using GenIE-ATAC

finding: The variant rs2234962 in the BAG3 gene was identified as a missense variant associated with dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) and progression to heart failure (HF). It demonstrated a high linkage disequilibrium (r2 = 0.99) with the sentinel variant rs17617337, indicating a strong genetic connection.
title: Genome-wide association study provides new insights into the genetic architecture and pathogenesis of heart failure

finding: The sentinel variant rs17617337 was connected to heart failure through its linkage with the missense variant rs2234962 in the BAG3 gene, which was implicated in DCM and progression to HF.
title: Genome-wide association study provides new insights into the genetic architecture and pathogenesis of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs34163229 was identified as a missense variant in the SYNPO2L gene and showed a strong linkage (r2 > 0.9) with the sentinel variant rs4746140. This association contributed to understanding the genetic basis of heart failure.
title: Genome-wide association study provides new insights into the genetic architecture and pathogenesis of heart failure

finding: Variant rs3812629, also a missense variant in SYNPO2L, was linked (r2 > 0.9) with the sentinel variant rs4746140, reinforcing its role in genetic predisposition to heart failure.
title: Genome-wide association study provides new insights into the genetic architecture and pathogenesis of heart failure

finding: The rs60632610 SNP, another missense variant in the SYNPO2L gene, exhibited a high linkage (r2 > 0.9) with the sentinel variant rs4746140, highlighting its potential involvement in heart failure mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide association study provides new insights into the genetic architecture and pathogenesis of heart failure

finding: The variant rs2209972:C was specifically linked to increased body mass index, heightened fasting insulin levels, and insulin resistance in women with polycystic ovary syndrome within a Chinese population. This genetic variant was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with other variants within the lncRAP2 locus, thereby confining its phenotypic associations to that region. Furthermore, phenome-wide association studies corroborated rs2209972's associations with various metabolic traits, particularly emphasizing its role in type 2 diabetes risk in individuals of European ancestry.
title: An adipocyte-specific lncRAP2 – Igf2bp2 complex enhances adipogenesis and energy expenditure by stabilizing target mRNAs

finding: The SNP rs7903146 near TCF7L2 was associated with age at diagnosis of type 2 diabetes (T2D) in South Asians. It showed a genome-wide significant association (p = 2.4 × 10^-12, Beta = -0.436), indicating that its presence was linked to an earlier onset of T2D compared to Europeans.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: The SNP rs3011366 located near WDR11 was specifically associated with age of onset of T2D in the South Asian cohort with a p-value of 2.4 × 10^-8 and Beta = 1.44. This variant was notable for not showing association in European populations.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: SNP rs570193324 near TCF7L2 was identified as a novel variant linked to age of diagnosis of T2D, exclusively in South Indians, demonstrating significant evidence (P < 3.2E-05, Beta 9.8) with rare frequency in Europeans.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: The SNP rs1775555 was identified as a fibroblast-specific <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL for <italic>GATA3</italic> (p=7.4×10<sup>−70</sup>) and a lincRNA gene <italic>GATA3-AS1</italic>, as well as a <italic>trans</italic>-eQTL for <italic>MSTN</italic> (p=1.8×10<sup>−45</sup>). This finding had significant implications for muscle growth and immune traits, showing a colocalization with associations for multiple immune traits.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The minor allele (T) of rs147706369, located intronically in TLL2, was associated with increased total cholesterol (CHOL) in both Africans (β 0.34, p=1.5×10⁻⁴) and in AA (β 0.28, p=2.6×10⁻⁵). This variant affected a regulatory motif for sterol regulatory element-binding proteins (SREBPs), important in lipid biosynthesis.
title: GWAS in Africans identifies novel lipids loci and demonstrates heterogenous association within Africa

finding: The variant rs2387397 was found to be associated with Celiac Disease (PP = 0.32). Observations indicated chromatin accessibility gains at this locus within the natural killer (NK) and T-cell clusters during stimulation, highlighting its potential role in immune responses.
title: Droplet-based combinatorial indexing for massive scale single-cell epigenomics

finding: The SNP rs12775208 was associated with RBA and situated in the NKX6-2 gene on chromosome 10. NKX6-2 encodes a transcription factor involved in myelin sheath formation and maintenance in the central nervous system, which may underscore its relevance to overall brain health and aging.
title: Improving brain age estimates with deep learning leads to identification of novel genetic factors associated with brain aging

finding: The low-frequency coding variant rs41274050 located in the gene A1CF demonstrated an association with both triglycerides and total cholesterol in over 300,000 individuals of diverse ancestries. This association was confirmed through experimental validation in a mouse model, highlighting its significance as a positive original finding.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs11010102 was linked to the inhibition of Pannexin 1, which reduced the tumorigenic properties of human melanoma cells. This original finding highlighted the potential of targeting this SNP for therapeutic strategies in melanoma.
title: Global Pannexin 1-deletion increases tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes in the BRAF/Pten mouse melanoma model

finding: The rs10993994 variant was strongly associated with prostate cancer susceptibility, indicating its relevance in cancer genetics. In a cell-line assay, this SNP demonstrated preferential binding to the CREB transcription factor, which resulted in lower expression levels of MSMB. Higher expression of MSMB was correlated with decreased recurrence of prostate cancer after surgical intervention, suggesting that the rs10993994 variant could potentially influence cancer progression by modulating MSMB expression through CREB.
title: Diagnostic Evidence Gauge of Spatial Transcriptomics (DEGAS): Using transfer learning to map clinical data to spatial transcriptomics in prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs2146192 was found to be highly correlated with blood levels of SFTPD, with a reported r² value of 0.67, indicating a significant association with lung function.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: This SNP, rs55855057, demonstrated a strong correlation with blood levels of Cystatin C (r² = 0.64), showcasing its relevance in immune responses.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: SNP rs61859980 was associated with decreased haemoglobin and decreased haematocrit (r² = 0.98 for both), indicating its importance in erythropoiesis.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: This variant, rs61863508, was found to correlate with decreased haemoglobin levels as well, holding a perfect correlation (r² = 1.0).
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: The SNP rs36073865 showed a strong association with increased levels of blood urea, with a perfect correlation (r² = 1.0), reflecting its potential role in renal function.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: SNP rs55838345 was found to correlate with increased levels of blood urea, with an r² value of 0.62, indicating its significance in metabolic processes.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: This SNP, also associated with increased levels of blood urea, had a correlation of r² = 0.6, suggesting its role in metabolic pathways.
title: The length of haplotype blocks and signals of structural variation in reconstructed genealogies

finding: The SNP rs304447 was found to be linked to lower expression of the IFIT5 gene, suggesting an association between this variant and enhanced immune response variability among Prakriti types.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: SNP rs11101533 was found to activate HSF1 in ERα-positive breast cancer cells through MAPK signaling pathways, thus highlighting its role in the estrogen signaling cascade involved in breast cancer cell proliferation.
title: Heat Shock Factor 1 (HSF1) as a new tethering factor for ESR1 supporting its action in breast cancer

finding: The GATA3 SNP (rs3824662) was reported to closely associate with Ph-like B-ALL, suggesting its potential role in the predisposition to this leukemia subtype.
title: An instructive role for IL7RA in the development of human B-cell precursor leukemia

finding: In the context of prostate cancer susceptibility, rs10993994 was associated with a consistently replicated susceptibility signal. This finding indicated significant implications for understanding the genetic predisposition to prostate cancer within the studied population.
title: Inverted genomic regions between reference genome builds in humans impact imputation accuracy and decrease the power of association testing

finding: The palindromic SNP rs10763546 was tested for its association with prostate cancer in a case-control study and showed only marginal evidence of association due to poor imputation. However, after correcting the strand flip using the proposed method, the imputation accuracy improved, resulting in a more robust association signal with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 and a P-value of 2.86×10^-7, indicating a significant association with prostate cancer.
title: Inverted genomic regions between reference genome builds in humans impact imputation accuracy and decrease the power of association testing

finding: The analysis of rs3011351 highlighted its role in cellular mechanisms regarding cisplatin activity, drug resistance, and side effects, indicating that SAM gene deletions could influence these responses through methylation processes.
title: Profiling The Compendium Of Changes In Saccharomyces cerevisiae Due To Mutations That Alter Availability Of The Main Methyl Donor S-Adenosylmethionine

finding: The rs2981579 variant mapped to the transcription start site of the FGFR2 gene and was associated with its regulation in breast cancer. The variant formed interaction peaks with several distal fragments co-localizing with important regulatory elements in breast tissues.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs4752575 variant was closely connected to the regulation of FGFR2 in breast cancer, interacting with a chromatin fragment harboring FOXA1, a master regulator of FGFR2 expression.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs2234962 variant, which results in the BAG3<C151R> amino acid change, was associated with a protective effect against heart failure. It altered the protein interaction profile of BAG3, leading to enhanced recruitment of factors that maintain myofibrillar integrity in cardiomyocytes, thereby increasing their resilience to proteotoxic stress. Furthermore, it was demonstrated that cardiomyocytes expressing this variant showed improved responses to stress in a dose-dependent manner, indicating a functional change that could underlie the cardioprotective effects observed in association studies.
title: Functional analysis of a common BAG3 allele associated with protection from heart failure

finding: At the RET locus, rs2435357 showed a very strong association with HSCR, having an OR of 4.0 (P=1.1×10^-123), with frequencies of 60% in cases compared to 27% in controls.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The variant rs2506030 was also significantly linked to HSCR, with an OR of 2.0 (P=2.8×10^-30) and was correlated with rs788261 (r²=0.98), showing an allele frequency of 56% in cases.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs7069590 showed significant association with HSCR, having an OR of 1.5 (P=1.8×10^-7) with allele frequencies of 84% in cases vs. 77% in controls.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs17476364 was identified as an intronic variant in the hexokinase 1 (HK1) region on chromosome 10. It linked 11 of 12 analyzed red blood cell-related clinical traits with average SpO2 during sleep, establishing a genome-wide significant association to minimum and average SpO2, relevant to Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) pathophysiology.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy to discover and interpret GWAS results for sleep-associated traits

finding: This SNP was discussed in the context of LiDAR utility for natural resource managers, highlighting its significance in improving data collection and management in ecological monitoring.
title: Terrestrial 3D Laser Scanning for Ecosystem and Fire Effects Monitoring

finding: The SNP rs10490924 in the ARMS2/HTRA1 region exhibited a significantly stronger association with polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy (PCV) compared to neovascular age-related macular degeneration (AMD). This finding linked the genetic risk of PCV more closely with the ARMS2/HTRA1 locus, highlighting its potential role in the pathology of PCV.
title: Hyaluronidase-1-mediated glycocalyx impairment underlies endothelial abnormalities in polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy

finding: The study demonstrated that the enhancer variant rs2506030 was part of a haplotype (S, susceptible) that led to significantly lower RET gene expression in human fetal guts compared to the complementary haplotype (R, resistant), highlighting its role in the risk of Hirschsprung disease (HSCR).
title: RET enhancer haplotype-dependent remodeling of the human fetal gut development program

finding: Similar to rs2506030, the enhancer SNP rs7069590 was included in the susceptible haplotype that contributed to a significant decrease in RET gene expression during fetal gut development, implicating its involvement in HSCR risk.
title: RET enhancer haplotype-dependent remodeling of the human fetal gut development program

finding: The enhancer variant rs2435357 was identified as another component of the S haplotype that lowered RET gene expression in fetal guts, supporting its association with an increased risk of Hirschsprung disease (HSCR).
title: RET enhancer haplotype-dependent remodeling of the human fetal gut development program

finding: The SNP rs55710213 was identified as a regulator of SCD1 expression by modulating HNF4A binding, suggesting its involvement in lipid metabolism through the HNF4A pathway.
title: HNF4α regulates acyl chain remodeling and ether lipid accumulation in hepatic steatosis

finding: Similar to rs55710213, rs56334587 was also found to regulate SCD1 expression by modulating HNF4A binding, indicating its critical role in coordinating lipid metabolic pathways.
title: HNF4α regulates acyl chain remodeling and ether lipid accumulation in hepatic steatosis

finding: The SNP rs11101445 was associated with NF-κB dependent chemokine signaling in pancreatic cancer. This finding indicated a connection between this SNP and the pathways involved in metastatic processes, particularly linked to pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). The research underscored the role of NF-κB signaling in tumor proliferation and metastasis, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus might influence the disease progression and response to therapies.
title: Adaptation to ARF6-depletion in KRAS-driven PDAC is abolished by targeting TLR2

finding: The SNP rs185932673 was found near the gene CAMK1D on chromosome 10 with a significant association with OSA at a P-value of 2.4 x 10^-8, highlighting its association within the context of genetic risk factors for OSA.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The lead SNP rs576289 on chromosome 10 was identified as significant for the vertical component of brain asymmetry. It showed an additive effect of increasing A alleles with a t-value of 5.51 and a p-value of 3.64e-08. The minor allele frequency was 3.36%.
title: Handedness and Other Variables Associated with Human Brain Asymmetrical Skew

finding: The study found that the risk allele (C) associated with coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) exhibited an inverse relationship with the expression of the MICU1 gene in both tibial and coronary artery tissues. This finding was based on analysis of eQTL data from the GTEx database, highlighting the significance of rs9416017 in influencing MICU1 expression which correlated with cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Endothelial MICU1 protects against vascular inflammation and atherosclerosis by inhibiting mitochondrial calcium uptake

finding: Fricker et al. (2019) explored the significance of SNP rs11192326 in their work on a Convolutional Neural Network classifier that identified tree species in mixed-conifer forests using hyperspectral imagery.
title: Influence of Temperate Forest Autumn Leaf Phenology on Segmentation of Tree Species from UAV Imagery Using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs72840788 was the lead SNP associated with both right ventricular end systolic volume (RVESV) and left ventricular end systolic volume (LVESV) at genome-wide significance. The BAG3 locus was identified as strongly associated with these phenotypes, underlying its potential role in cardiac structure.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs2234962 was reported as being nearly perfectly correlated with rs72840788, leading to a missense change p.Cys151Arg in the BAG3 protein, linking it to cardiac phenotypes of RVESV and LVESV.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs11190870 was identified as the most commonly associated variant with an increased risk of adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS). It was located in a highly conserved enhancer element downstream of the transcription factor gene LBX1. Guo et al. (2016) demonstrated that the presence of the risk allele (T) led to enhanced activity of the associated DNA fragment, suggesting that this SNP disrupts the normal function of the enhancer element, resulting in upregulation of LBX1 transcription and increased susceptibility to AIS.
title: Deletion of a conserved genomic region associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis leads to vertebral rotation in mice

finding: The SNP rs1800450, associated with the mannose binding lectin gene 2, was found to potentially contribute to the development and severity of COVID-19 infection. This finding was derived from a study by Medetalibeyoglu et al. (2021), indicating its relevance in the immune response to SARS-CoV-2.
title: Antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 control complement-induced inflammatory responses to SARS-CoV-2

finding: The peak eSNP rs11000765 was identified as the NK cell-specific eQTL for FUT11, which colocalised with genetic loci associated with asthma and lung function, highlighting its importance in respiratory diseases.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The rs7068821, identified at chr10:90051035, was the most likely candidate causal variant associated with T1D and linked to expression changes in both PTEN and LIPJ within an adult whole pancreas context.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The rs10509540 was previously reported in association with a T1D risk locus and its relation to RNLS; the analysis suggested a link with other regulatory genes based on LD.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs2274224, nearest to the PLCE1 gene, was significantly associated with amplitude traits in several functional brain regions, which were crucial for cognitive functions.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: Rs1133400, located near the INPP5A gene, showed significant associations with multiple amplitude traits relevant to brain activity, indicating its role in cognitive processes.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: Found within the PWWP2B gene, rs7083220 demonstrated significant replication in both populations, indicating strong associations with brain connectivity traits.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: An association with amplitude traits was observed for rs11187838, which is nearest to the PLCE1 gene, highlighting its impact on brain activity.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs7904973 was established as an apaQTL related to increased usage of an intronic PAS in the C10orf88 gene. This SNP was previously associated with increased LDL cholesterol, highlighting its role in linking genetic variation through alternative polyadenylation to organismal phenotypes.
title: Alternative polyadenylation mediates genetic regulation of gene expression

finding: The SNP rs290487 in TCF7L2 was reported as contributing to risks of hypertension in a study of the Thai elderly population, indicating its relevance in the context of hypertension. This finding is particularly significant given that TCF7L2 is already established as a susceptibility gene for type 2 diabetes mellitus, and there is a recognized comorbidity and potential shared pathophysiology between diabetes and hypertension.
title: Prediction of drug targets for specific diseases leveraging gene perturbation data: A machine learning approach

finding: The SNP rs545425011 identified in the DNAJC12 locus was associated with the composition of the tongue dorsum microbiome, specifically negatively correlating with Leptotrichia A sp000469505 and Prevotella saccharolytica while positively correlating with dominant species like Rothia mucilaginosa.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: Variant rs2257129, located between WDR11 and FGFR2 on chromosome 10q26, was associated with traditional CAD risk factors like body mass index and triglyceride levels, although no direct eQTLs were identified.
title: Transethnic meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies three new loci and characterizes population-specific differences for coronary artery disease

finding: The top SNP rs10883083 at the PYROXD2 locus on chromosome 10 was the strongest association with CSF levels of N(epsilon)-Dimethyl-L-lysine and other inter-correlated metabolites, achieving a range of significance <italic>P</italic>=5.03e-181 - 3.58e-214.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: DeepSNP rs12768537, identified on chromosome 10, was highlighted in association with differential TF binding in the K562 cell line and contributed to the regulatory landscape relevant to MS risk.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The deepSNP rs11000015 on chromosome 10 correlated with PSAP gene expression and had a substantial impact on MAZ binding, linking it to MS susceptibility through regulatory mechanisms.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The T genotype of the MGMT C>T (rs16906252) enhancer SNP was associated with promoter methylation and longer survival in glioblastoma patients, suggesting a genetic mechanism that impacted treatment outcomes.
title: Long-range gene regulation network of the MGMT enhancer in modulating glioma cell sensitivity to temozolomide

finding: In association with weight, body fat percentage, and heart-related health issues, this SNP was linked to metabolic factors prevalent in the study.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP was implicated in Alzheimer’s disease and related cognitive impairments; it showed a broad correlation with various metabolic and familial health issues.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: An eQTL of INPP5A, linked to neuronal DNA methylation and aging, this SNP was associated with cognitive measures and depression.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Twins carrying the G allele of rs263429 near GATA3-AS1 reported significantly more liking for potato chips compared to those with the alternative allele, with a p-value less than 1x10^-5. This finding highlighted a genetic influence on the perception of dietary fat.
title: Studies of human twins reveal genetic variation that affects dietary fat perception

finding: The finding related to rs11101422 was identified in the context of the TOR pathway's importance in regulating male germline differentiation in Drosophila. It was observed that downregulation of the Tor kinase via RNAi led to significant phenotypic changes, including blocked differentiation and the accumulation of germ cells exhibiting GSC-like characteristics, correlating with enhanced mTORC1 activity in neighboring cells.
title: mTORC1 is required for differentiation of germline stem cells in the Drosophila melanogaster testis

finding: The SNP rs11012732 was identified as pleiotropic for breast cancer; however, inverse relationships remained consistent even when this variant was excluded from analyses, supporting its role in the broader context of physical activity's impact on breast cancer risk.
title: Physical activity and risks of breast and colorectal cancer: A Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The SNP rs11101405 was associated with neuroendocrine differentiation in prostate cancer as reported in the study by Patel et al. (2019). This study highlighted the dynamics of tumor evolution in neuroendocrine prostate cancer, providing a positive context for this SNP's involvement in malignancy.
title: A novel role for Neurog2 in MYCN driven neuroendocrine plasticity of prostate cancer

finding: This SNP was the most significantly associated with J-gene trimming of non-productive TCRs, showing a P-value of 3.18 × 10^-37. It was also significantly associated with both J-gene trimming of productive TCRs (P = 1.99 × 10^-29) and V-gene trimming of productive (P = 6.23 × 10^-23) and non-productive TCRs (P = 2.81 × 10^-21). This finding focused on nucleotide trimming related to the <italic>DCLRE1C</italic> gene locus.
title: Combining genotypes and T cell receptor distributions to infer genetic loci determining V(D)J recombination probabilities

finding: This SNP was identified as a second independent signal within the <italic>DCLRE1C</italic> locus for J-gene trimming primarily affecting non-productive TCRs, demonstrating the complexity of trimming associations in TCRs.
title: Combining genotypes and T cell receptor distributions to infer genetic loci determining V(D)J recombination probabilities

finding: This SNP was part of the three associations discovered related to the number of nucleotide N-insertions and was significant at a Bonferroni-corrected P-value threshold of 1.94 × 10^-9. The association was particularly concentrated on its role as part of the <italic>DNTT</italic> gene locus, which encodes the TdT protein.
title: Combining genotypes and T cell receptor distributions to infer genetic loci determining V(D)J recombination probabilities

finding: This SNP was also part of the N-insertion associations found within the <italic>DNTT</italic> gene locus, contributing to the understanding of TdT's role in adding non-templated nucleotide insertions during V(D)J recombination.
title: Combining genotypes and T cell receptor distributions to infer genetic loci determining V(D)J recombination probabilities

finding: This non-synonymous SNP within the <italic>DCLRE1C</italic> gene was significantly associated with V-gene trimming (productive P = 2.16 × 10^-14; non-productive P = 7.21 × 10^-14) and J-gene trimming (productive P = 1.23 × 10^-11; non-productive P = 6.62 × 10^-12) across both primary and validation cohorts, linking it to TCR nucleotide trimming processes.
title: Combining genotypes and T cell receptor distributions to infer genetic loci determining V(D)J recombination probabilities

finding: The SNP rs17095355 was associated with biliary atresia (BA) in a study involving Thai children. This association indicates a potential genetic risk factor for developing BA, suggesting that genetic variations in genes like X-prolyl aminopeptidase 1 could influence susceptibility to this pediatric liver disease.
title: Exome Sequencing in Individuals with Isolated Biliary Atresia

finding: The rare variant rs148641196 exhibited the highest allele-specific enhancer activity in reporter assays, restoring a functional IRF (interferon regulatory factor) binding site, which could potentially contribute to inflammation-induced dysregulation during disease development. This variant's presence indicated a higher risk factor in the context of ischemic heart disease (IHD) and heart failure (IHF).
title: Cardiovascular disease causes proinflammatory microvascular changes in the human right atrium

finding: Identified as the top candidate variant in EpiMap analysis with a significant association (p=1e-17) to ischemic heart disease (IHD). Perturbation through CRISPR-mediated deletion of regulatory elements resulted in a 50-70% decrease in JCAD expression, highlighting its crucial regulatory role.
title: Cardiovascular disease causes proinflammatory microvascular changes in the human right atrium

finding: Along with rs9337951, it was noted to exhibit allele-specific enhancer activity, affirmatively linking it with regulatory functions important for the etiology of ischemic heart disease (IHD).
title: Cardiovascular disease causes proinflammatory microvascular changes in the human right atrium

finding: This rare variant was found to be one of the SNPs exhibiting allele-specific enhancer activity, suggesting a potential regulatory role in the context of cardiovascular diseases.
title: Cardiovascular disease causes proinflammatory microvascular changes in the human right atrium

finding: Also demonstrated allele-specific enhancer activity as part of the examined haplotypes, reinforcing its significance within the JCAD/SVIL locus in relation to IHD.
title: Cardiovascular disease causes proinflammatory microvascular changes in the human right atrium

finding: Noted for allele-specific enhancer activity, indicating its potential influence in the regulation of associated genes within the context of ischemic heart disease mechanisms.
title: Cardiovascular disease causes proinflammatory microvascular changes in the human right atrium

finding: The SNP rs11101474 was associated with the effectiveness of photodynamic therapy (PDT) in human colorectal cancer. This association was evidenced by the robust photocytotoxic effects exhibited by the PS-arene-Ru complexes after activation in HCT116 and HT-29 cell lines, suggesting a potential role of this SNP in mediating the therapeutic response to PDT. Moreover, the study highlighted the mechanisms including apoptosis, which were observed to be influenced by this SNP in the context of CRC treatment.
title: Photodynamic therapy in colorectal cancer using photosensitizers functionalized by arene-ruthenium complexes

finding: This SNP was noted for its association with pulse pressure and identified eQTL for the PRKG1 gene, demonstrating its relevance in cardiac regulation.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs61839660 was identified as being highly associated with T1D in multiple GWAS studies, with a posterior probability greater than 0.70. This SNP exhibited specific looping interactions with the gene IL15RA and RBM17, suggesting a possible pleiotropic effect. The association between rs61839660 and T1D may primarily be mediated via IL2RA, as rs61839660 is located within an intron of this gene. However, the SGL analysis highlighted significant chromatin loops connecting rs61839660 to IL15RA, which has been noted for its role in T1D, particularly with its interaction with the cytokine IL-15.
title: Loop Catalog: a comprehensive HiChIP database of human and mouse samples

finding: The SNP rs10993994 was confirmed as the lead susceptibility variant for prostate cancer risk, associated with lower plasma levels of the clinical biomarker MSMB. An odds ratio (OR) of 0.758 was reported for prostate cancer risk per standard deviation change in MSMB levels, with a high level of statistical significance (P = 7.81 x 10^-13).
title: Phenome-wide Mendelian randomization mapping the influence of the plasma proteome on complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs61847070, used alongside rs10993994 as a second conditional independent instrument, also supported the association with prostate cancer risk, showing an OR of 0.766, with a P value of 4.48 x 10^-14 for prostate cancer per standard deviation change in MSMB levels.
title: Phenome-wide Mendelian randomization mapping the influence of the plasma proteome on complex diseases

finding: The variant rs10994278, an intronic variant within Ankyrin-3 (ANK3), was associated with any psychotic experience, demonstrating a significant odds ratio (OR=1.16) and p-value (p=3.06×10^-8). This finding suggested a potential role of ANK3 in the development of psychotic experiences.
title: Genetic association study of psychotic experiences in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs118137427, which exhibited a 3.7% allele frequency in Europeans, was associated with expanded repeat sequences at the FRA10B fragile site. This genetic marker was linked to the acquisition of terminal 10q mosaic deletions in normal blood. Moreover, in an analysis of the PCAWG resource comprising 94 chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) samples, rs118137427 was identified in 2 out of 4 (50%) CLLs with deletions at the 10q24.32 locus, compared to 6 out of 90 (6.7%) CLLs with an intact 10q (P=0.035; Fisher's exact test). This finding suggested a potential link between the germline genetic variant at FRA10B and somatic structural variants in CLL, indicating a direction for further investigation.
title: Haplotype-aware single-cell multiomics uncovers functional effects of somatic structural variation

finding: The SNP rs2274224 was identified as an exonic nonsynonymous SNP located in exon 19 of the PLCE1 gene. It showed significance with a p-value of 1.771×10^-10 and was associated with limbic network-FC. The CADD score of 17.35 indicated a potentially deleterious effect of this SNP, reflecting its role as a risk factor for alterations in brain connectivity related to limbic functions.
title: Specificity and overlap in the genetic architectures of functional and structural connectivity within cerebral resting-state networks

finding: The SNP rs2274223 was also an exonic nonsynonymous SNP located in exon 25 of the PLCE1 gene that presented an association with limbic network-FC, evidenced by a p-value of 1.22×10^-5. This SNP had a CADD score of 17.48, further suggesting its deleterious nature and reflecting its potential implications in cellular processes affecting limbic network connectivity.
title: Specificity and overlap in the genetic architectures of functional and structural connectivity within cerebral resting-state networks

finding: rs72782676 was located within a UNICORN and had fine-mapping evidence for multiple traits including eosinophil count, asthma, eczema, and respiratory diseases. It exhibited a high PIP score greater than 0.99 across all GWAS analyzed. This variant is significant due to its proximity to GATA3, a gene known for its regulatory role in inflammatory diseases.
title: Leveraging Base Pair Mammalian Constraint to Understand Genetic Variation and Human Disease

finding: The variant rs2815403 exhibited a high MpraVAE score of 0.683 and was located in an open chromatin region that was consistent across several immune cell types. It was linked to the promoter region of the NFKB2 gene, which is involved in inflammation and immune response, thereby validating its role as a causal variant related to immune functionality.
title: In silico generation and augmentation of regulatory variants from massively parallel reporter assay using conditional variational autoencoder

finding: The SNP rs61839660 was associated with protection against Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) and had been convincingly shown to influence autoimmunity risk, particularly in promoting the risk of Crohn's Disease. It was identified within the CaRE4 enhancer, which impacts the expression of IL2RA in activated Tconvs, and its deletion in experimental models completely protected against autoimmune diabetes, indicating its significant role in regulating autoimmune responses.
title: T cell subset-selective IL2RA enhancers shape autoimmune diabetes risk

finding: The SNV rs3730148 was also found within the GNAQP locus, indicating its commonality and further highlighting the misalignment of reads when analyzing somatic mutations linked to NKTCL.
title: Correspondence: Recurrent GNAQ mutation encoding T96S in natural killer/T cell lymphoma

finding: The SNP rs7916587:G->A was identified as a top-ranked Grad-CAM SNP for SP1 binding. It disrupted a RUNX binding site in conjunction with an SP1 binding site near the transcription start site of ARHGAP15. This SNP was linked to associations with white blood cell count (WBC), indicating its significance in understanding the influence of TF binding context on WBC.
title: Deep neural networks identify context-specific determinants of transcription factor binding affinity

finding: The SNP rs7903146 was associated with increased expression of the TCF7L2 gene in pancreatic islets, confirming its role in T2D predisposition and previously observed chromatin accessibility alterations.
title: Influence of genetic variants on gene expression in human pancreatic islets – implications for type 2 diabetes

finding: The variant rs2995310, identified as a cis-pQTL for ADAM8, associated with the majority of the meQTLs, amounting to 256 associations.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The SNP rs41298872 within the Artemis locus was previously identified as being associated with increased extent of V- and J-gene trimming in TCR beta. The study utilized data from 611 individuals to analyze interactions between the SNP genotype and various model parameters. Significant variations in trimming probabilities were found at positions 3' of the trimming site. Specifically, A nucleotides negatively impacted trimming odds, but this effect was reduced in individuals with different genotypes at rs41298872. Moreover, the count of AT nucleotides 3' of the motif significantly affected trimming probabilities, suggesting that individuals with the rs41298872 variant may exhibit altered trimming in relation to the local sequence context and enhanced Artemis expression.
title: Statistical inference reveals the role of length, breathing, and nucleotide identity in V(D)J nucleotide trimming

finding: The rs363371 allele was found to be associated with a lower risk of developing Parkinson's disease in an Italian population. This finding indicated that increased expression of VMAT2, which rs363371 promotes, could protect against the disease. The result was further supported by a study in the Chinese Han population that replicated the association for the rs363371 allele in males.
title: Tricyclic and tetracyclic antidepressants upregulate VMAT2 activity and rescue disease-causing VMAT2 variants

finding: The SNP rs7906104 was identified in the context of AUD GWAS and had not been previously connected to an AUD diagnosis, representing a new finding in the understanding of genetic risk factors.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: The rs41298373 SNP was significantly associated with planum temporale asymmetry at chromosome 10p14, with a P-value of 3.31x10^-17. This finding was confirmed by sensitivity analyses focused on the asymmetry index. The SNP represented a coding polymorphism within exon 9 of the ITIH5 gene, which is known to be involved in extracellular matrix stabilization. It was associated with various aspects of brain structure, including sulcal depth and cortical thickness, and highlighted the divergence in genetic influences on brain asymmetry.
title: Using rare genetic mutations to revisit structural brain asymmetry

finding: The SNP rs35054928 was included in the analysis as part of the 180-SNP PRS. It represented a significant association with breast cancer, contributing to the understanding of risk in the Latina population.
title: A polygenic risk score for breast cancer in U.S. Latinas and Latin-American women

finding: The SNP rs1334909357, located within the PALD1 gene, was identified as significantly associated with BMI in children from Salvador, driven by high African ancestry.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: In linkage disequilibrium with rs141274185, the SNP rs79947827 was found to be significantly associated with BMI in Salvador children, highlighting its importance within the ZMIZ1 gene.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: This SNP was identified alongside rs79947827 as significantly associated with BMI in Salvador children, indicating its role in BMI variation related to African ancestry.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The N999S variant in KCNMA1 was associated with gain-of-function properties in BK channels, leading to increased BK currents and action potential firing, as well as decreased seizure thresholds in transgenic mice. This was linked to impaired stress response and modeled the clinical features observed in patients with paroxysmal non-kinesigenic dyskinesia (PNKD3).
title: BK channel properties correlate with neurobehavioral severity in three KCNMA1-linked channelopathy mouse models

finding: The D434G variant in KCNMA1 also demonstrated gain-of-function properties similar to N999S, which resulted in increased BK currents and action potential firing in mice. This variant contributed to the model of PNKD3, showing pronounced behavioral responses consistent with the phenotype observed in affected individuals.
title: BK channel properties correlate with neurobehavioral severity in three KCNMA1-linked channelopathy mouse models

finding: It was identified as one of the top QTL associations for N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine. Moreover, it was also the top QTL for N6-methyllysine, indicating its significant role in affecting levels of these metabolites.
title: yQTL Pipeline: a structured computational workflow for large scale quantitative trait loci discovery and downstream visualization

finding: This SNP was the top QTL for undecanedioate on chromosome 10 and was noted among a few other SNPs on the same chromosome that influenced other metabolites, indicating its multifaceted role in metabolomics profiles.
title: yQTL Pipeline: a structured computational workflow for large scale quantitative trait loci discovery and downstream visualization

finding: The SNP rs11101539 was associated with PARP1 co-regulating EP300-BRG1-dependent transcription of genes involved in breast cancer cell proliferation and DNA repair. This finding highlighted the role of the SNP in impacting the regulatory mechanisms within the context of breast cancer biology.
title: Epiregulon: Inference of single-cell transcription factor activity to dissect mechanisms of lineage plasticity and drug response

finding: This SNP in KNDC1 replicated in the Allada cohort, with evidence suggesting its role in malaria susceptibility.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: This primary sentinel variant at the OBFC1 locus displayed strong evidence for association and was shown to colocalize with eQTLs.
title: Novel genetic determinants of telomere length from a trans-ethnic analysis of 109,122 whole genome sequences in TOPMed

finding: This tertiary signal at the OBFC1 locus was also involved in the promoter region, showing association with telomere length.
title: Novel genetic determinants of telomere length from a trans-ethnic analysis of 109,122 whole genome sequences in TOPMed

finding: This quaternary signal at the OBFC1 locus was identified in enhancer regions, illustrating its role in telomere length regulation.
title: Novel genetic determinants of telomere length from a trans-ethnic analysis of 109,122 whole genome sequences in TOPMed

finding: The rs4919510 SNP is located in the miR-608 gene itself. Carriers of its minor allele showed reduced levels of miR-608. This reduction led to limited regulatory effects of miR-608 on AChE and other targets. Additionally, these carriers experienced a protective effect from sepsis following head injury, highlighting the significance of miR-608 in cholinergic regulation and its implications for human health.
title: Ribosomal protein L24 modulates mammalian microRNA processing and transfer RNA fragment production

finding: The non-synonymous polymorphism rs2986017 (p.P86L) located in the calcium homeostasis modulator 1 (CALHM1) gene was linked to an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease. It was found to affect calcium homeostasis and amyloid beta accumulation, highlighting the variant's role in the pathology of AD and its association with the gene in the 10q24.33 linkage region.
title: eMIND: Enabling automatic collection of protein variation impacts in Alzheimer’s disease from the literature

finding: The SNP rs11101244 was identified in a study associated with agronomic traits in durum wheat, highlighting its positive role in enhancing grain yield under drought stress conditions.
title: Identification of QTL hotspots affecting agronomic traits and high-throughput vegetation indices in rainfed wheat

finding: The ADRA2A rs553668 polymorphism was linked to obesity traits in the Malaysian population, suggesting its relevance in weight regulation.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs2102369 was related to the applicability of the Green-Red Vegetation Index (GRVI) for remote sensing of vegetation phenology. This finding was established in the study by Motohka et al. (2010), which emphasized the importance of GRVI in measuring vegetation characteristics relevant for phenological studies.
title: Time-series Multi-spectral Imaging in Soybean for Improving Biomass and Genomic Prediction Accuracy

finding: The SNP rs12354611 showed a significant association with the microbial signal Bacteroides stercoris with a p-value of 8.64 × 10^-6, indicating its relevance in the context of gut microbiome studies.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses support causal relationships between blood metabolites and the gut microbiome

finding: Identified as a P10 female-specific variant, rs76931017 showcased significant allele-differential regulatory activity in the study.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: The study found that SNP rs1983890 interacted significantly with the anti-apoptotic gene MAIP1 and another gene AGAP1, indicating a genetic basis for the prolonged survival of dysfunctional "loser" beta-cells in type-2 diabetes (T2D). The analysis revealed that the interaction was relevant to the pathophysiology of T2D, as PFKFB3 positive beta-cells, characterized by rs1983890, exhibited a transcriptional overlap with a "loser signature" where genes involved in mitochondrial respiration and ribosomal biogenesis were downregulated. These findings suggest that this SNP contributes to the metabolic dysregulation observed in T2D by affecting the apoptotic pathways and cellular competition within pancreatic beta-cells.
title: Dysfunctional β-cell longevity in diabetes relies on energy conservation and positive epistasis

finding: The SNP rs706779 was identified as a significant 1-SNP model for autoimmune thyroid disease (ATD). Its selection aligns with previous analyses showing consistent associations with ATD.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs61839660 was determined to be causal for autoimmunity, specifically noted for its role in the expression of IL2RA mRNA and its encoded protein CD25 in CD4+ memory T cells. Its significance transcended multiple diseases, including T1D and ATD.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs2104286 was linked to multiple sclerosis (MS) and noted for being a joint tag for other distinct causal variants, underscoring its role in autoimmune contexts.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs3118470 was shown to be a significant lead SNP for alopecia areata, thus classified as a positive finding.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs10795791 was identified as a key finding in the context of rheumatoid arthritis, supporting its role in the disease's genetic architecture.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: The study identified the risk allele at rs7903146 as the strongest genetic determinant of type 2 diabetes (T2D) in humans. Specifically, the T allele was associated with reduced expression of TCF7L2 in abdominal adipose progenitor cells (APs) and led to enhanced insulin sensitivity in adipose tissue. This suggests that genetic variation at rs7903146 may influence T2D risk not only through pancreatic insulin secretion but also by modulating adipose function.
title: TCF7L2 plays a complex role in human adipose progenitor biology which may contribute to genetic susceptibility to type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs61839660 variant in the IL2RA locus was shown to exert context-dependent effects on IL2RA and CD25 expression in primary human CD4 T cells. This variant influenced gene expression and Treg differentiation, supporting its role in the etiology of several autoimmune diseases.
title: Defining the function of disease variants with CRISPR editing and multimodal single cell sequencing

finding: The genotype frequencies for rs11003125 indicated that the frequency of the LL genotype associated with low MBL production was significantly higher in the Russian population, being 37%, compared to 10% in Nenets and 15% in Dolgan-Nganasans (p<0.001 for Russians vs other populations).
title: Mannose-binding lectin gene polymorphisms in the East Siberia and Russian Arctic populations

finding: The combined rare O allele comprising rs5030737 was found to be significantly higher in homozygous state among Russians at 10%, compared to 2% in Nenets and 1% in Dolgan-Nganasans (p<0.001 for Russians vs other populations).
title: Mannose-binding lectin gene polymorphisms in the East Siberia and Russian Arctic populations

finding: Similar to rs5030737, the allele related to rs1800450 contributed to the combined O allele, which was identified at a higher frequency in Russians (10%) than in Nenets (2%) and Dolgan-Nganasans (1%) (p<0.001 for Russians vs other populations).
title: Mannose-binding lectin gene polymorphisms in the East Siberia and Russian Arctic populations

finding: The SNP rs61846889 showed allelic changes that increased predicted binding affinity for the transcription factor Ahr::Arnt::HIF1 and was a strong eQTL for <italic>OGDHL</italic> across multiple tissues.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: Although the rs363324 allele was initially identified as associated with VMAT2 overexpression and a lower risk of developing Parkinson's disease, a direct replication study did not confirm this association. Thus, while the original finding showed potential, its replication remains uncertain.
title: Tricyclic and tetracyclic antidepressants upregulate VMAT2 activity and rescue disease-causing VMAT2 variants

finding: This SNP was associated with chronic inflammatory disease (CRD) and was identified as one of the SNPs that contribute to the shared pathophysiology in autoimmune diseases (AiDs).
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: Similar to rs2227551, this SNP was linked to chronic inflammatory disease (CRD) and was part of the same set of pleiotropic SNPs contributing to multiple AiDs.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) and identified as a shared genetic factor across various autoimmune diseases.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs2675662 was associated with psoriasis (PSO) and was significant in illustrating the overlap between genetic risk factors in autoimmune conditions.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The study indicated that increased plasmatic levels of PSA-expressing exosomes, correlated with the SNP rs11101449, could effectively distinguish between prostate cancer patients and individuals with benign prostatic hyperplasia. This finding suggested a potential diagnostic role for this SNP in assessing prostate cancer risk and development.
title: Tetraspanin immunocapture phenotypes extracellular vesicles according to biofluid source but may limit identification of multiplexed cancer biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs4919685 was located in TSS-distal regions and was associated with testosterone levels. It was identified through analyzing variants overlapping Leydig cell differential accessibility regions, with a highly significant p-value of 4.203e-15.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs743572 was found in the promoter region of Cyp17a1, an enzyme involved in the conversion of testosterone to estradiol. This SNP was suggested to be functional concerning testosterone levels, evidenced by a p-value of 3.622e-07.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs1122688 was located on the SHTN1 (KIAA1598) gene and overlapped between the genu and anterior body, indicating its role in the positive regulation of neuron migration.
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs10901814, which was associated with splenium area, indicated a negative effect with a beta of -1.69 (EAF: 0.584, p = 2.02 × 10^-24).
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs11245344, which impacted thickness in the corpus callosum, showed a negative effect with a beta of -0.11 (EAF: 0.570, p = 6.28 × 10^-22).
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: Noted for its associations with breast, prostate, ovarian, and endometrial cancers, this SNP links to a widely represented trait within the gynecologic disorder framework.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The lead variant rs370974631 was identified in the known ARMS2/HTRA1 locus, with a genome-wide significance of P=3.1×10^-20 and an effect allele frequency (EAF) of 0.23. This variant showed high correlation with the reported lead variant for advanced AMD, rs3750846 (r²=0.93), indicating strong validation of its association with age-related macular degeneration (AMD).
title: Chances and challenges of machine learning based disease classification in genetic association studies illustrated on age-related macular degeneration

finding: The sentinel SNP rs3750846 was linked to a significant locus at 10q26 associated with AMD risk. It was found near a region of accessibility within the intron of the ARMS2 gene. There were two distinct peaks of accessibility identified, one shared by rod and cone photoreceptor cells and the other enriched in horizontal cells. Although the exact significance of these regions concerning MacTel and AMD was unclear, their association with risk SNPs suggested a potential role in the misregulation of nearby genes.
title: Multi-omic Analysis of Developing Human Retina and Organoids Reveals Cell-Specific Cis-Regulatory Elements and Mechanisms of Non-Coding Genetic Disease Risk

finding: The SNP rs11101596 was linked to the identification of Celastrol as a YAP-TEAD inhibitor, which further indicated a specific targeting mechanism involving YAP in cancer therapies.
title: Structure-based discovery of a novel small-molecule inhibitor of TEAD palmitoylation with anticancer activity

finding: The SNP rs11101422 was associated with autophagy regulation as detailed in the study by Dossou and Basu (2019). The finding contributed to understanding the role of MTORC1 in managing autophagy processes, particularly in the context of cancer. The study highlighted how genetic variations like rs11101422 might influence autophagic activity, which has implications in the pathology of cancer and potentially in the response to therapies targeting the autophagy pathways.
title: AutophagyNet: High-resolution data source for the analysis of autophagy and its regulation

finding: rs7087063 was found in the gene CELF2 and was associated with the HMM estimated activity variability during wake, with a p-value of 3.0×10^-8. CELF2 had previously been associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The SNP rs763236375 was identified as a splice-associated variant within breast cancer samples. Specifically, this 2 bp deletion was found in 20 samples, with 19 of these exhibiting alternative donor site usage for exon 5 of the gene GATA3. This alternative splicing led to the production of a frameshifted protein that lacked one of the zinc finger DNA binding domains, resulting in the novel junction becoming the dominant splice product compared to the canonical splice junction. Importantly, this finding was highlighted as being tumor-specific, as rs763236375 was exclusively associated with breast cancer cases.
title: RegTools: Integrated analysis of genomic and transcriptomic data for the discovery of splice-associated variants in cancer

finding: The IL2RA rs2104286 variant showed association with multiple sclerosis onset and severity, indicating its role in autoimmune responses.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs932658 exhibited a significant interaction with the mQTL rs117823351 related to the CpG site cg18035618. This interaction had discovery and replication p-values of 3.69×10^-9 and 4.33×10^-3, respectively. The interaction emphasized that genetically driven modifications significantly influenced the observed POE-mQTL interactions.
title: Lifestyle and Genetic Factors Modify Parent-of-Origin Effects on the Human Methylome
